tFQuxvBQx2qd4ig3CDo61Q.text: So good here! My mom had the crispy chicken sandwich. She said the chicken was juicy and the right blend of spices. I had the turkey burger. Very tasty too! But the crazy milkshakes takes the cake- literally! My boy had the Brooklyn blackout and my other boy had the cake shake. OMG!! Yes, the shakes are a bit steep in price ($15-17) but the look on you're child's face when they bring the shake to your table is priceless. And the taste? DELICIOUS.

vGzkfa5DhM3QGzg2gaR8Gw.text: Home of the crazy shakes! I ordered the Bam Bam shake - fruity pebbles shake covered in whipped cream and fruity pebbles, vanilla frosted rim with more fruity pebbles, a strawberry laffy taffy rope, half a strawberry Poptart, rice Krispy treat and cherry on top. Burger was really good but fries were average at best. Honestly, the best BEST part of dining at this location is the staff. It was a super busy night but we got seated at the bar almost right away. The servers behind the bar were absolutely amazing and so attentive. The atmosphere and vibe were also super fun, and it was a blast to see all the different crazy shakes come out and everyone's expressions when they saw their sweet treat!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bam bam shake!

OgMZrJ-AsjsxfmgHh07o1A.text: Went there to try the chicken wings and crazy shakes & we were not disappointed. The wings were a bit too spicy but we ate them anyway. The shakes though were outrageous! Fun, delicious and HUGE! Come with your appetite. They won't disappoint. The service was friendly too. Our server really sweet & he was joking around with us

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brooklyn blackout and peanut butter crazy shake
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean chicken wings

UFoa6w3anGukat5O8mJvlw.text: Crazy shakes have landed in Vegas! If you're looking for an over-the-top experience, this is the place for you! From the crazy shakes to delicious burgers and  endless instagram back drops to take pictures. I had The Greg Norman burger which includes wagyu beef, house butter milk dill, blue cheese and arugula. All burger patties are cooked to a chef medium so they are still nice and pink. Fries were golden and crispy. The fried pickles  were an app that will have me coming back! But the star of the show was definitely the crazy shakes! You can even go up to the bar and watch as they create your sugar filled treat! The Cookies 'n Cream Supreme was accompanied with a whole ice cream sandwich! The Brooklyn Blackout was accompanied with a whole chocolate brownie and The Cookie Shake included two cookiewiches!   I cannot wait to recommend this place to friends and family. Keep up the amazing quality!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Greg Norman burger, fried pickles, onion rings, The Californian burger, chips &#39;n queso, Chips &#39;n guac, and The Texan burger.
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cookies &#39;n Cream Supreme, The Cookie Shake, and the Brooklyn Blackout crazy shakes!

FSbyGUwBhRovVlTexqCpJA.text: Love the food and shakes! Veggie burgers were great and our server Caesar was amazing! Definitely a must do in Vegas!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UavvY4cmtqL_6Mj1uHzvEw.text: Still my fav burger in vegas! Way better than guy fieri and ramsays in PH. The wagyu beef and truffle burger cooked medium is super juicy and just full of flavor porn. I never tried the shakes cause i feel like a cow after the burger.   Idk if you are looking for a great burger this is the spot.

bHMfiVJQhYiogUj9k2hVNw.text: I had the fried busses sprouts and split a burger with my son. Brussels sprouts were good, burger was average, milk shake was amazing. My kids loved it here. Service was okay.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cotton candy shake

-C9aprhRVambiBxHi2Ty_A.text: Came here with my husband, omg everything we got was so good !!!! We got the fried pickles for our appetizer and I got the Californian with Sauteed onions and sweet potato fries.  my husband got the truffle burger with sweet potato fries . And we also got the bam bam shake ! The food, the service and the atmosphere of the restaurant was awesome !! We Highly recommend!!! make sure you come very hungry :)

ytOUZr4qh18KE6JI4j748w.text: Don't believe the hype.  Old school hip-hop themed interior.  Real cool and hip vibe. A little noisy, but not unbearable.  We had 2 servers. It wasn't a busy night, but it took forever for us to get an order in.  We ordered burgers and asked for medium rare.  At some points, it WAS medium rare.  But at other points, it was all sorts of styles.  It was like the Earth(I do mean the planet).  The outside was well-done, but at its core, it was rare as all hell. It was not worth the 20$  My girlfriend loved the blue cheese on mine, but after awhile, I got tired of it.  The milkshakes are ALL hype.  Honestly, the strawberry shake tasted like something from in-n-out. I wish it was made with actually cotton candy ice cream. To be a real cotton candy milkshake. It was a strawberry milkshake topped with some cotton candy.  And at one point, it felt like we weren't going to be able to order a milkshake. Our waiter told us the machine broke.  The only 'wow' factor of it was the outside part.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VyfAx10M3r8BJS-ddKGAsg.text: Damn this place is hella good.   I had the Mexico City burger with pickled jalapeno. What I expected was the pickled peppers you get at the burrito shop, but these are done in house and go very well with the cilantro garnish.   Additional appeal for having a GREAT playlist going and decor/ambiance is top notch and far out hip.   At first glance you won't notice the patio (very chill) with shuffleboard and view (but not too close) of the strip, but that's an option.   Great food = A  Well appointed style = A+  Black tap is killer.

G0VE3wrK73jx5-0pRBr3GQ.text: Great burgers to have. Shakes are a must. We tried the cookies & cream. It was delicious

jDvIsDtppeSJ-991vw_Lrg.text: If you like loud intrusive music, cold. Precooked, over salted hamburger, greasy onion rings,  over priced food, And obnoxious tourists, then you'll love this place. Nextime Wendys!!

4fTlgLMN5zLPh9W7hBi6pA.text: The vibe is 80's rock. When you step inside, you're surrounded by fluorescent lights and awesome artwork. The space is bigger than expected.   The menu is huge - be prepared to make some decisions. There are six different specialty shakes. We got the Cookie Shake - it was HUGE but delicious. The frosting flavors mingle nicely with the chocolate chip cookie and handspun ice cream flavors. Don't be overwhelmed when you see it - it's worth it.   We ordered the Greg Norman and the Crispy Chicken. The crispy chicken was the highlight of the meal (after the shake). It's soft and juicy yet crispy. The salad/pickle on top is fresh and crunchy. And the sauce is impeccable. We were not impressed with the Greg Norman despite the wagu - it was over cooked and charred.   Definitely will be back on our next trip!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cookie Shake
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Chicken

Z__tg8lUn9-px2HTLFh01A.text: I went in for a quick bite and Dominic was my server! Loved him! Gave me options to try when I couldn't make up my mind. That really made my experience, even though I had been there before he made it seem like it was my first time there ever! Shout out to you bud!!! Will definitely be dining again and you better be my server!

ODmD7qexj9vZT41G7Gyzcw.text: Milkshakes are definitely more for the fun of it. They're from $15-17. They're definitely big but what I noticed was the brownie in mine was very large which you have to eat first as it is on the top but then maybe 40% of the cup was whip cream. It took me a while to get to the ice cream part. I got the Brooklyn Blackout, I believe it was called. They're fun, a great IG pic lol, and something neat to show family or friends visiting Vegas but aside from that, I wouldn't run down to have one. I feel you'd get more ice cream from a DQ Blizzard.  I also got the Mexico City burger and regular fries. Fries are thick, burger is gourmet standard but nothing I'd sprint down for again.   Service was good, decorations are cool. No complaints at all, just nothing I would visit a second time.  Oh and if you're a light eater, don't order food before the milkshake lol or SHARE it! If you've got a large appetite, then go for it all lol.

fvO-XfFyvfQT92abikC8mw.text: the burger prices aren't cheap! Even for 'strip prices'....that being said, I have to say that it was probably the best beef I've ever tasted in a burger. I can't say the last time I have a burger that good! It's actually worth the price.  I had the old fashioned and it was damn good.   The shakes are over the top. I skipped trying a beer or cocktail and opted for a shake. The peanut butter one. It was fully loaded (as in my picture) with pretzel sticks, candy, frosting, etc. A fantastic shake but it was more loaded with whipped cream and candy that there was actually very little shake to it. Just as much whipped cream as there is actual shake drink.  Price vs item it wasn't worth it, UNLESS you are going specifically for dessert. If I just wanted a dessert and not a shake, then go for it. It's hand crafted and tastes like it.   Our server was fantastic and fun. The staff was attentive and helping each other fill water (if you have a shake with dinner, you'll drink a lot of water. lol) and clear empty plates.   Had the deep fried dill pickle slices as well..good stuff! The dill dressing on the side for dipping was pretty amazing as well.   The back patio will be the place to be, since it over looks the gondola's and you have a clear view of the volcano erupting across the street!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YMf30cs0DfViBR8uNN2PHg.text: Been waiting to get down here after missing them in NYC.  Was worried about a long line but had no problem walking right in.  Food and shakes were delivered immediately and everything was fantastic!  Our server was a pleasure too.  It's pricey but worth every penny!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sUsYK635VR6NgrDA1Ruz2A.text: My friends and I came here to give this place a try. We had a party of 6 and was about a 25 min wait on a Saturday evening (9:30pm). I ordered the Californian burger ($17) and a passionfruit lemonade ($5). If you aren't a big truffle fan, I would opt for the truffle mayo to be on the side. It's very strong!! My turkey patty was a little on the dry side, but with the guac tomato lettuce it was bearable.  I mixed in some chipotle mayo with my truffle mayo together and it tasted great! Like my friend had mentioned the fries were perfectly seasoned, our table was not given any ketchup, and forks were not replenished at our table.  Water was served luke warm, eww! I ordered a passionfruit lemonade to try instead of a shake which I regret now. I'd much rather spend an extra $4 on a classic shake or the extra $10 on the crazy shake due to the portion you get. My lemonade was mediocre and there was no refills available on it. The size of the lemonade was probably about an 8 oz size at most, only slightly larger than the mason jars for water. My boyfriend had ordered the Mexico City burger and felt it was a disappointment as it was lacking the Mexico City flavor... i.e. he felt that it should have included guac. Feel free to had a small spoonful of guac for $2. That's how much my Californian came with.   Our server was missing during most of our meal as well and for the price of the burgers, I expected more that's why I would rate this place at 3.5 stars.    The decor is pretty hip here, if I were to come back I'd like to try their drinks and shakes. A good place to have a quick bite and catch up with friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Passionfruit lemonade
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Californian Burger

ZM0s2kawIwEfmedCjFZuYQ.text: If you are wanting over-the-top dessert that takes you back to your childhood this would be the place to get it. We decided not to have both lunch and dessert as the prices are a little high. If you want to do both I suggest you share your shake. Burgers are between $15-22 and shakes are anywhere between $15-17.   You're probably going to make a mess eating these. They are stacked and in order to get your spoon out you'll shift some ice cream and toppings around. I didn't bother with my straw, just used the spoon.   I ordered the cookies and cream milkshake which had an ice cream sandwich on top and Oreos "glued" to the outside rim of the cup with I think frosting. It was yummy and not too sweet.   My husband got the cake batter shake which had a slice of vanilla sprinkle cake on top and sprinkles glued around the outside rim. His was very sweet and the ice cream tasted exactly like dipping your finger into a bowl of vanilla cake batter, had a tangy flavor to it.   Overall good experience just expensive for two shakes. The lighting is not very good very dim. You can enjoy your food outside as well it was just too hot for us.

tO5OLa8GF3h1i076YOrzxg.text: Yesterday my friends and I wanted to stop by this place since we heard great things! We stayed in Vegas for my 21st (it was on Saturday!) and before leaving today we wanted black tap for my last dinner.  My friend and I split a Texan burger, which was okay, not that flavorful or anything, but my other friends got old fashioned, the truffle burger, and another Texan and they seemed pretty okay with theirs. Nothing spectacular (which honestly was kinda disappointing!)   We also ordered ranch but apparently sauce costs extra and we didn't know until we got the bill. We told our server that we didn't know it was extra for sauce and said that he should've told us before hand it cost extra for it, but seemed like he didn't even want to accommodate for anything. After my friend spoke to our server, he seemed pretty annoyed of us, insisted we speak to the manager (for the sauce charge???), but he ended up removing it anyway.   Not sure what that was about but overall the customer service wasn't that great and I had higher expectations than this. Our server kept talking to his guy friend at the table across from us and only checked on us once at the beginning.  Probably gonna go another time but won't be back for a while. Thanks for the meh service!

urGVJ43iC2-w8bxy9fsxlg.text: Came for my bday dinner cuz I had to have one of those shakes! Turns out, the food is really good too. I had the crispy chicken sandwich, totally recommend it. Then, of course, the milkshake. I had the sweet n' salty one, everything I thought it would be, but couldn't finish it.

CF_i5XdMWSFcMfUjrNcKJA.text: Came for the shakes. They were great! A little slow but worth the wait. Staff was very friendly.   Pro-Tip: skip the line, bar is seat yourself

ItWtRsLkZR5Xe6TLV6GkPA.text: This place was just okay. I honestly wasn't expecting much. Most of the exclusive restaurants on the strip are like that, awesome premise but no follow through. Service kind of sucked and food was just okay. There was one thing that was awesome, their shakers. They are alcoholic beverages advertised to serve 4 to 6. I had imagined martinis, but out comes shots. And they do serve 6. They were delicious and strong. I will go back just for those.

Tc0PYDZI8B0s_67sCoo6JQ.text: Wound up coming here for dinner with a few friends for my birthday and I'm so glad we did!  They do not take reservations but we showed up around 6:30pm on Friday and didn't have to wait for a table.  We sat indoors but they do have outdoor seating with fabulous views of the Strip and the Venetian gondolas.  The truffle burger is, by far, one of the best burgers I've ever had!! Nice and juicy burger with smoked gouda cheese.  I really like how the burgers come with fries without an additional charge, you can upgrade to onion rings or sweet potato fries for $2 more.  Didn't end up trying a shake because I was so stuffed from my burger but they look so delicious!  Cannot remember the name of our waitress but she was awesome and very attentive, top notch service! Great place to go with friends or take the family out to lunch or dinner.  Thank you Black Tap for a memorable birthday dinner, I cannot wait to return!

ZVgBfTGh6vFmu9eWhTKgcw.text: Only THEEEEE BEST burger AND fanominal shakers on the strip we are locals and LOVED IT!

dCaNyeaNOukSvlg3TCccDA.text: Fun place! Sat at the bar and was entertained by the bar staff. Great recommendations and conversation. Everyone worked efficiently and took care of each other's guests. Awesome service. Rachel was the bomb! As well as the other two bartenders (didn't get his or her name). Will be back soon.

BcqDZ5o-wbWJxoWnLdP6og.text: jason was seriously amazing! so patient and really made the whole experience worth it. also special shoutout to Zack!! def made my experience above & beyond

FLzfw9jRy0GAkRz2yjDcYA.text: Shakes are amazing. Decor and music are on point too. Our waitress friendly and made sure we got we wanted. She also suggested things for us. The dipping sauces for the fries are good too! Definitely a must stop when in Vegas!

h1VDdy93FJXKF8SdWviZgA.text: Ok. YUM. Crazy milkshakes and burgers cooked perfectly to order. Great 80s music playing and young servers with personality. A great first visit and a place we plan to go back to whenever we're in Vegas again. Our server told us that the cakes and pastries for the shakes actually get flown in from NYC (where the only other Black Tap is located). Order a milkshake. It's totally and completely worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I forget the name of this shake, but it had TWO brownies on top of it, which were amazing!
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday cake shake. All SIX of us had some of the cake slice!

S4NOgddoWau5llsMajKmbw.text: Amazzzzing!!! Perfect sweets fix, perfect hungover fix, perfect everything. Love this place!!

ZdTpTz8nJpN4SIAtSjgkdQ.text: Jonny and Nate were both AMAZING! Knew exactly what to recommend and were so accommodating! Will definitely come back and recommend to everyone. Black Tap is definitely a must try while in Vegas!

blE2wWjDyYF03DhgCMtlOg.text: Mediocre service and food. I came here a few weeks ago with 5 friends so six of us total. We were looking over appetizers and ordered their "fried mozz" and fried pickles. The server didn't forewarn us, but the fried mozz was a 4 pc. for $10! So that was nice, having to split that amongst 6 people.   Throughout our visit, we saw 3 different food runners bring food to the table next to us that they didn't order. One runner literally dropped an f-bomb after walking out with the duplicate milkshakes that those patrons were already sipping on.  We all ordered burgers and not one of us said "this is really good" we were all just surprised that they were just "okay". Considering I got a $19 Mexico City burger, I expected it to be crazy good. But the flavors of it just seemed mix-matched, it didn't blend well and neither did my girlfriend's Greg Norman burger. Their menu makes items sound really good, but the actual food did NOT deliver.   But to top it off, I was waiting outside their restrooms for one to open up. An elderly gentleman starts to walk out of one, and as I start to step toward the door one of the servers cuts me off and walked right into the restroom. It was unbelievable. Seriously the worst experience, considering myself and my party are all in the service industry. For this being a restaurant at the Venetian we all expected great food and great service, and it was honestly mediocre all-around.  Also, spoke with the manager on my way out. Pretty young brunette woman. I explained the gist of our experience, and she apologized just once and honestly just seemed like she was just waiting for me to stop talking. She was uninterested and made no attempt to make things right. At any restaurant any of us have ever worked at, the manager on duty would have gone above and beyond to make our experience more favorable. But nope. Thanks Black Tap!

RMUQ3lHLDhOD3YWIAmddZg.text: Finally got the chance to visit with friends here last night, and was so sadly disappointed . Everyone in our party came in for dessert only, and we all ordered the shakes. While they were in fact very pretty to look at, they all fell flat on their asses as far as quality and flavor were concerned. For $17. bucks a shake I would expect nothing short of a thick high quality creamery style of ice cream, and rather they were like melted ice milk. The ice cream was simply disgusting, and reminded me of blended whipped cream with absolutely no flavor profile whatsoever. It was like sucking on whipped flavorless air through a straw. I mean come on folks, if you don't want to import special creamery ice creams; at least buy some Haagen-Dazs. Perhaps the millennials are looking for Strawberry Quick style loose milkshakes, maybe these are supposed to be skinny girl shakes? The kind you just snap photos for social media, but don't actually drink lol. In addition, how sad that I looked at the shake preparation area to find that your team is pre making the glasses up hours before so that the frosting on the glasses turns into inedible glue. What a total shit show here. I simply cannot believe the low level crap ice cream they are attempting to make their famous shakes out of.... Black Tap should be so ashamed of their knowledge and fact of serving this shit. $80. bucks down the drain for some pretty girl Instagram milkshakes, that didn't even come close to tasting as good as some fast food milkshakes..In addition, I knew something was off when the shakes came out in less than 5 minutes. Even people's food was coming out this fast after ordering. Hmmmm I wonder if their burgers are precooked? I can't see how hot food comes out this fast unless it is in fact precooked. I would skip this establishment, as it simply does not live up to any reputation it may have had from NY.

igSgQPNPq81m1F4-Kx3mRA.text: Went on a Sunday night, was seated right away. They don't take reservations, so first come first serve. Our waiter was awesome and very friendly, as well as the other staff members. We came for the milkshakes but decided to share an All American Cheese Burger with regular fries. The burger was cooked well and was juicy. Then we got the Cookies and Cream shake and the Confetti Cake Shake. Both amazing. I did end up liking the cookies and cream more because the cake was alittle too sweet for me but the presentation was A+! Be mindful the place isn't that big. You can sit at the bar or in the booths. However they have an outside area that overlooks the strip and the gondola rides. Which opens in the next few weeks for more space and entertainment. Overall we had fun and enjoyed watching what everyone else ordered.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zOjhndzfImsawDr2aHSFAQ.text: Great food and service! It is just overpriced but other then that, place is amazing!

ux5JSvMcSM4db2ox0lKZWA.text: A really solid burger joint in a fun setting in the Venetian. I enjoyed the burgers but felt the service was only OK and the prices were exorbitant, even for the strip. Both times I ate there the servers seemed a bit tired and grouchy. Lastly, no ice water is served. If you might be thirsty after walking around in the desert heat you'll get a wine bottle of slightly warm, gross-tasting water that you can serve yourself!

LYTFkQrkX4CYse3DjOkeCQ.text: Worst burger I've ever had. The meat wasn't seasoned and the buns ended up being a soggy mess also the server really didn't seem very helpful to us. I've had better burgers from fast food restaurants. The appetizers we ordered were alright but we went there for the burgers bot the appetizers. Needless to say we paid over 20 dollars for a burger that left us dissapointed, we went to another burger restaurant the next day.

_D2vD-B3leWz1v2k-ySQ9A.text: All I can say is YUMMMM.  I have a massive sweet tooth and the milkshake was for sure satisfying. I also consider myself a fry fan so I had to try them as well. SO good as well.   Shakes are HUGE so I recommend sharing with someone even though you would probably want all of them.   Only complaint was it was a little pricy and the server was slightly snotty but oh well, it was busy

Bv9c86ktxhkuI7FFYOs4Jw.text: I don't know that I've ever been so let down by a restaurant and a burger. The patio is beautiful, but I came to eat a good burger and I left pretty bummed oht. I don't think I've ever had a worse burger, and I'd sooner go to a drive thru than come back. Service started out great but waned as the meal went on. The food took forever (which is expected in Vegas) but it wasn't special or even very warm. Fries and burger bun were soggy. My turkey burger had NO flavor. My friends had a Texan burger and they also were totally disappointed. We wanted to send the food back, but the server didn't come back for a while and given that both burgers were lacking, we didn't think it was a fluke. I LOVE burgers, but this place blew it. Their milkshakes looked really good, but after some pricey burgers than flopped, I didn't want to continue ordering. Please season your meat and serve hotter. So sad.

RByeMzO2n3w6rVxWRMuMMA.text: Difficult parking, difficult to find. WAY TOO LOUD, slow service. Worst "music" I've ever heard. Have to scream to be heard. Good beer & food but won't return due to AWFUL atmosphere. Overpriced.

9W_7rM6qW7a3Pi7L4vpeSA.text: I emailed the company regarding my experience and never heard back... Very disappointing :(

U_IqReBNDmbs0ezjvgY3dw.text: Delicious, delicious, delicious!!! I'm just talking about their crazy shakes My suggestion? Go straight for the milkshake and not eat the outside decorations otherwise you'll be overwhelmed by the sweetness and not be able to enjoy the shake. Their burgers are pretty good, too... Ok, they are better than pretty good.  I've had the Greg Norman burger which has wagyu beef, house buttermilk-dill, blue cheese and arugula.  Today I tried their Wagyu Burger Salad. It has wagyu beef, fresh mozzarella, arugula, roasted tomatoes, roasted pine nuts, chimichurri and shaved parmesan. I'd suggest to add more of that chimichurri because it just brings the salad together.  I'm looking forward to trying their bison burger when they add it to their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. 4th of July shake cake
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wagyu burger salad

HINl_7KK0Qoj_Xa3ZncBYQ.text: The BEST! and I mean BEST $20 burger ever! I totally don't eat burgers and rarely eat red meat unless it's excellent high quality steak, this place will have you craving their burgers for sure. It's always a $80-$100 for two of us and that's splitting a shake but a small price to pay for such excellent food. Every time we have friends/family in town we take them here and everyone always loves it. The service has always been impeccable, a very fun upbeat staff, they must treat their employees well because they're always happy! One shake is enough for 2-3 people after a meal and they're all good, personal favorite is the cake batter! That slice of cake on top is so moist and delicious you can't go wrong!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Greg Norman
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza Burger
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A whole brownie on there!

h9n5bOdnTWYXGXdynhOwYg.text: What can I say?  Fantastic au poive burger and check out the shake photo.   Crazy wild shakes.  My daughter and I love this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Cake Shake

48Z-9L9YXb6DfweQb06rCQ.text: After a long day and disappointing Vegas restaurants, Black Tap did not disappoint.  Went with group of 4 and despite being busy we were seated fairly quickly.  Waiter was prompt and paid good attention to our table.  THE TRUFFLE BURGER with wagyu beef was delicious, cooked exactly medium rare, fries i'm sure were great but the burger over shadowed everything else.  Others had the normal burgers and were just as happy with the quality and taste.  One person got SPICY KOREAN BBQ wings and even though they do not look like a wing place said they were excellent.  Definitely recommend

IqP9b-rk4ytjxQqfAsl-8Q.text: This is one of my regular visits with my daughter on the strip. Today we had an excellent waiter named Joshua. Not only was the food and music great as usual, but Joshua added a lot to the experience. Thank you!

Ea-tbvbA6XOTFQ2C8E9Qzg.text: I came here the other day on my birthday and I'm really glad i did! We only got the crazy big milkshakes but they were so dang good. They truly are as big as the pictures. We got the all chocolate one and the birthday cake for the 4 of us and we had soooo much left at the end. It was such a fun dessert place to go to and it really did taste good too! I unfortunately don't remember our servers name but she was so sweet and really added to the good experience. Highly recommend for dessert!

TNsiWjGwcuWTDnQi2swV7w.text: We stopped in for lunch and were able to get to right in. Service was excellent. I ordered the classic Nutella shake and the grilled chicken sandwich. The shake was very good and had little gobs of Nutella in it. The grilled chicken sandwich was nice and juicy. It was on a soft brioche style bun and was topped with bacon, avocado and some salsa. The fries were nothing outstanding. My husband ordered the crispy chicken sandwich and thought it was excellent. The dessert shakes looked amazing and I plan to get one next time I go there.  We were very impressed with the quality of the food especially since it advertises itself as a burger place. The burgers did sound amazing though. Check it out for yourself.

sGWwb_4dg9PpfoHPD5dHxQ.text: On behalf of all VEGANS please get a new Vegan burger..... Your service and environment rock, my GF loved her burger and birthday cake shake. Unfortunately the vegan burger i got was one of those outdated burgers that make people think eating vegan isn't amazing. Please look into beyond burgers, impossible burgers and please change the bread too.... I do recommend this place and hope to return someday, thanks!

avoJdXj2i6x2BPEg3kOUpw.text: Couldnt find a late night place after coming in to Vegas and this place in the Venetian is AMAZING! If you like spicy try their Mexico City Burger! It does not disappoint. Had this with a Froze (very good). They also have off the top shakes that are delicious.

quVcb_jdKpBFyelxjwDVPg.text: I actually liked Black Tap. Funky theme and music. The food here is expensive and a little above Mediocre. The burger was solid but the onion rings were just salt to the point of having to peel the batter off. Gross. The cake shake was amazing, if you like super sweet. The cake was much better then the shake for sure. I'd come back, though it wasn't mind blowing.

enLtlVkuQ7POsndbTSKkmQ.text: View from The outdoor seating is to the Venetian very  pretty with ducks in the water. The service was great the waiters were very friendly and the shakes were huge I had the burger with the salad burgers not that big but it's very filling the place is kind of pricey but what do you expect for Vegas prices I will try the ones close to home here in California and try other stuff on the menu and compare.

0ZkagDe4g6NqkKO_uyTEyQ.text: I'm giving 3 stars only because the hostess pictured was extremely rude. But when we went to the bar to order the bartenders were nice and helped us with our to go orders. First off, we wanted to order to go to take back to our suite and we asked for menus (there is only 4 of us around, no one else) the guy in the picture gave us menus and he kept giving us menus non stop and I said ok that's enough menus. And he says "well, you didn't tell me how many" in the rudest and an ugly attitude. And I state back "well as you can see there is only 4 of us" and either way he could have asked how many in the beginning instead of being so rude. And then he rolled his eyes and walked away, without taking the menus from my hand so I just left them there. Vegas a place for people who vacation/travel and to get this experience from a restaurant/hospitality business is a no-go. This seriously was a major downfall of our trip because it truly was so rude. We all walked in trying to have a good meal and a good time and he really ruined it for us.   On another note: the food is really great here! The fried pickles were really good! The burger was reallllly good as well! I recommend eating here if you're craving a burger especially since if you're staying in Venetian/Palazzo and you want something other than Italian, LOL.  But even though the food was great, service because of the gentlemen really left a bad taste in our experience here, so hopefully they take him out from the front or serving, he was epic-ly rude.  Seems like the front staff just needs training because they looked like they all didn't want to be there and his co-workers just watched him be rude to us, even more embarrassing for us! I don't think I would ever forget this experience about this place and I hope no one will go through this like we did!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The rude hostess

qrNqBjIjyzy-AHdCcMiWzg.text: My wife and i hadn't ventured down to this end of the strip in a little while. We usually get more my vegas rewards and groupons for the north strip. We read the reviews for black tap and decided to venture down. We were without our 4 year old so we like to sit at the bar every chance we get. We think the service is better and some of the stories they have are awesome!  Now the food.   I had the california burger with no cheese and subbed my fries for a side arugala salad. The burger was seasoned well and tasted good. The side salad was a little over dressed but tasted good. My wife had the baja grilled chicken and also had a side salad. She liked it. The restaurant had a nice bar feel. Our bartender/waitress was very attentive. The bar is also really well known for their "over the top" shakes. We dis not partake because they looked like they had about 2000 calories. They looked awesome and vegas over the top. They also had a lot of great beers on tap but my wife and i had a pretty good morning at a Mimosa bar so needed a break from alcohol. If you want a good burger and an over the top dessert it's worth a try!

OddeYFjW6BH7JQ2OyxIDUA.text: Line to get in is long but there is no waiting at the bar (wink, wink). Pizza is my first love and they've made a burger after it so how could I resist?  Burger with fresh mozzarella, parsley and marina for dipping.  I got reg fries and they were just okay. Next time I'll try the onion rings. They have a strong drink menu and service was solid. I ended the meal with the cotton candy shake and it was way overboard and definitely a showstopper. People I didn't know were taking a pic of my drink!  Good job Black Tap

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CdI7vKtlaxRMhad-FayTjA.text: I had heard about Black Tap about a year ago. I went last night with my family (6/16/19) for Fathers Day and my daughters birthday.  First the wait was only 15-20 minutes on Fathers Day at 6:30 which was amazing. We were sat promptly and our server Carlos was extremely personal and informative. I ordered the Fathers Day Special "The Boss" Burger. This may have been the best burger I have ever eaten.  There were 5 of us (we all ordered different items) and everyone said the same thing "I would order that again". After dinner we ordered their Ice Cream Shakes, again AMAZING. When I go back (and I will) I will order the Shake first. Thank you to the Manager and a huge thank you to Carlos our server for making the night great. If you are wondering should I go or not go, GO don't look back and order the Shake First.

1qh_Dup5_wx0XZ41VWLmtA.text: Great food and the cake shake was redonkulous! It literally gave my wife the chills and she loves sweets. Will come back next time in Vegas. Great atmosphere and staff.

KVDqMTrEuQs9vkaYbQ8jsA.text: I came here with some coworkers with the idea of each of us ordering a different shake and sharing so we could all have a taste. Even at 4pm on a Friday there was already a line and the place was crowded and loud. We put in our orders and only had to wait a bit for the shakes to come out. I am still confused as to why we were served room temperature water. It was gross. We shared the shakes and each had our favorite. What a sticky mess was made. They should offer wet wipes. Our waitress was not very friendly or helpful. I sat near the prep area for the shakes and as you can see from my picture, it was very dirty. I know they were busy, but a kitchen/work area should be clean. We ordered some appetizers to share, but they were not worth mentioning.  I'd say pay Black Tap a visit if you have family or friends in town or if you are feeling glutenous.

iFVUMPUC8UhHpvX8r5bm7g.text: My review is solely gonna be for the milkshakes. Got the caramel and Oreo basics, which honestly came out fancier than I thought! Caramel was really good - tasted like the chewy candies and not too sweet! Oreo was good, but had too many large chunks of Oreo cookie, which was good at first but then overwhelmed the shake... Cause then after awhile I was just eating a bag of Oreo cookies.  In general a really chill spot with great and friendly service. I was craving a shake which is why I came, but I'd definitely go again to try their food and drinks!

Wi8HZ-6OkWHGNBstnUPv-w.text: Came here for the Shakes! We opted for some appetizers to start, we had fried pickles, mozzarella sticks and french fries. Everything was amazing, tons of choices for sauces with your fries. With those appetizers we had enough for our party of 7.  The Shakes are where it's at! The Cotton Candy shake, the Cake shake, and the Chocolate Brownie shake were all amazing! Each one was shared by 2 people and so worth the price!  The environment was great and fun with great music playing.  I love the small mason jars they give you for your water and they give you a tall glass kinda looks like a wine bottle full of water. Lines can be long so think ahead about what time you want to get there and plan accordingly if its during a meal time rush.

A4LuguJJmt9oEloOIsgOUg.text: I decided to give Black Tap another chance after talking to other locals who have been there and had a much better experience....  The manager Nate was not only friendly but inviting. He made sure that we were taken care of and that we really saw what the Black Tap experience was all about.   The server was amazing she took the time to recommend menu options that really fit our needs instead of just throwing an item out there cuz it sounded good or was popular.  The food.... MORE THAN AMAZING. The burger are cooked to perfection. They are beyond juicy and the sweet potato fries best ever!!   In all the whole entire experience was worth giving it a second shot. I would recommend Black Tap to anyone who is looking for a great restaurant on the Las Vegas strip.

p8JXTqz3pMWsSfz5_bd84g.text: Loveeee this place!! The burgers are A1 and the staff are amazing. Me and my sister vlogged the entire experience. We got the American burger and the Texas burger omg the best!! The owner was super nice to us and continued to check on us. I can't wait to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cake shake and bam bam shakes

7hPbBVZB4aNVVg9Hw6ykgw.text: First off, the food was amazing. PERIODT...... BUT beyond the food our server Luis went above and beyond to make sure that our first experience here was nothing but epic! With a positive attitude and friendly smile, luis answered all of our questions and made sure we were taken care of. Literally the best server Ive ever had.

NtqLeCRRYNo4_Qx7iTvZGA.text: Update: After Samantha contacted me I decided to take her up on her offer of coming back for a second try. This time the service was as it should have been. Our waiter was amazing! He was attentive and very helpful. The meal was as delicious as last time. This time I ordered the classic American cheese burger. My friend had the Texas bbq burger. We also split the Cakeshake. That was like having a birthday in a glass. So much food!! The portions are huge.   Just wanna say thanks again for the second time around Samantha. The staff definitely stepped it up. The tables didn't sit unbussed and the servers were busy and attentive to the surrounding tables. Definitely a much better experience. Even planning to actually come back a third time. Just wish y'all would put one off the strip for us locals!   A friend recommended this place to me and Said they wanted to try it out. So we did. Upon arrival we were greeted and sat quickly however the quick seating was right next to a table with a small child who could basically turn around and grab off the table we were almost seated at. The tables were way cramped together. We waited for another table to be cleared as there were a lot of dirty tables. We were finally seated. The atmosphere is pretty fun and hip and they play a lot of old school music. It is however a bit loud so if you're looking for somewhere intimate this is not the place. Our waiter came and took our order. We split a California (turkey) burger and the black out shake. Definitely plenty of food. The burger was very flavorful. It came with a homemade pickle as well and they were kind enough to split the burger for us. The fries were crispy. The shake was fun and quite tasty. When dinner was done the waiter dropped off the check and then basically forgot about us to pick it up. He actually said he forgot about us. That won no points with me and he got quite the side eye. I'm not sure I'd be back just because as a local I hate going to the strip. But I might give them a second chance

Sr5SppM4KTdKcJkH72_b0w.text: Awesome food, amazing shakes, and great service. This is our third time and we love, love,love this place. We love the food and the atmosphere, specially the music. Come hungry and you must save room for a shake ..... out of this world !  The manager, Jose s, is super nice along with the entire staff. Definitely five stars!

J-pvRQJgGNKNz8IpF3SGWg.text: Great food and great vibe. Love the Old School Hip Hop that was being played at the Vegas location.

MXkPKs72_MY2zkgpekIEag.text: This place is bomb. So I recommend coming hungry the  food is delicious and the shakes are a must! So for that reason come hungry! The service is also amazing. Our waiter was Michael and he filled us in on all the secrets. Yes they have a secret menu! With the burgers you can switch any of the meats, or any side for 2 which the sides are anywhere from 5-9 dollars but when you add them to you burger you add them for only 2 bucks. I had the crispy chicken Caesar salad it was really really good. The letters is so smooth and the chicken is bomb. Also got the Texan burger and it was also very delicious. The burgers are big enough to share if you like sharing. Lastly the Shake i got the cake Shake because Michael recommended it and the cake is shipped fresh from New York every day  and it did not disappoint! The service was magnificent and I think everyone should try this place out.

OjjFwF6SQPNgrae1_pQwqg.text: Yes, the shakes are 17$! Yes, the burgers are 17$ and Yes! That's the going rate for anything on the strip! BUT at least it was delicious!!   The burger was great (we got the Mexico burger) and my girlfriend got the Vegan burger option. The fries were great (the sweet potato ones were amazing) and they give you 10 options of different sauces....... Other highlight was the fried mozzarella! It came with a little bowl of tomato sauce/soup. So good!!!  And of course! You can't come here and not get dessert! We opted for the cake shake. The cake shake was amazing! Not the normal "looks good, tastes eh" the cake was so good and not nearly as messy as i anticipated (even with a two year old in tow)  Our server Kendra was lovely. She was happy to give suggestions and at one point offered my son a lollipop from their massive milkshake candy bar, because his behaved attention span was quickly fading.   I would totally go back!

bbDJA-6vKR6ep0-hlsk6Xg.text: This may be one of the most overrated restaurants in town.  We were told there was a 30 minute wait. Over 80 minutes later (with no follow up or explanation), we were seated. The $20 shaker drink that said it served 4-6 wasn't even a decent sized drink for 1.  My burger was dry (despite having a pink center) and too big/messy to pick up.  It was seriously lacking sauce and flavor.  We were crowded into a booth way too small for our party, and it made eating with a knife and fork a challenge.  The fries were flavorless. The shake was very Instagram-able but nothing special to the taste buds - very light on the actual ice cream and filled with lots of stuff.    My meal was so disappointing that I only managed a few bites, and the wait staff didn't even ask or notice when they took it away to become compost.  Between the two of us, my husband and I had a tab of over $100, and I left starving.    The waiter dropped my husband's plate on the floor and so he had to wait while the rest of us ate, and he wasn't even offered some free fries to snack on or a discount.  Go across the street to Sugar Factory for much better service and equally Instagram-able treats.

ZIGcTBqUFnXoZ1dByaIqBw.text: This place had some of the biggest shakes I have ever seen! It's almost like attempting to eat an entire meal in just that! They're known for their burgers which was delicious I wound up eating the Texan burger and I loved every bite! The service was decent slower than other places I've been to. But service was still polite and nice.

K6LNkpvHmJ7Ng1tR5gzlSA.text: Wow! This place has insane milkshake concoctions! I bookmarked this place for some time now and I'm glad I can now say that I've finally been here. My friend was in town this weekend and we decided to come here tonight for dinner. We were immediately greeted by the friendly hostess who seated us with no wait at all. Once we sat down, our waiter came by to introduce himself and even gave us some tips on his favorite items off the menu. Upon his recommendations, we ended up ordering the truffle burger with sweet potato fries and the crispy chicken sandwich (with a kbbq sauce) with fries. We even asked the waiter if he could cut it in half for us so we could try both. He was more than happy to do it for us. Both burgers were delicious. The fries were really good too. For dessert, we ordered the cookie shake and loved it. I'm so glad we split the shake because it was so filling but good.   The only disadvantage about this place is that the burgers and shakes are pretty pricey. We were surprised that we got charged a dollar each for bbq and ranch sauce. But then again, it's expected since this place is located on the strip.   As a local here, this place is a great spot to take friends and family who are visiting LV. This place has great food and excellent customer service. We will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cookie shake

7X2M-ZBL3OVMFtA4FYCqWQ.text: The milkshakes are pricey but a MUST HAVE because of how fun and picturesque they are! We get one each time we go to the strip! We have never had bad service

CvskdyMU_ZQT3rHjxuuwMQ.text: We are always looking for amazing burger spots - and this one hit the nail on the head! Our wait was short and our server was very personable- he gave great recommendations!! The All American Burger + bacon was cooked to perfection.  We loved how you could customize your toppings!!! This place is definitely worth a stop!

PchMm9IbKZeArsjNDRSwUw.text: Loved the crunch chicken sandwich. The beer was great also and awesome service. Definitely recommend it

ojWuztydYnpFkhPGFZYw1w.text: I had the Mexico City burger. I was surprised with the size of the burger and the deliciousness. The meat was cooked a perfect medium just as I like it and the buns taste fresh out of the oven. I recommend this place to everyone so long they have an appetite because after the meal, I also recommend their milkshakes. The strawberry milkshake will change your life.

sKpkH4wvFZGLse4JTdtmGA.text: I loved the aesthetically pleasing, pixie lit porch and the great views from the strip-side restaurant. Great environment. I wish the misters would have reached all the way to our table though. It was nice and steamy even at 9oclock!  The food and drinks were amazing with traditional options along with semi adventurous, unique items too. High class and tastey. Pricy, but worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yQJoJgbWKn56SDOpQT-w8A.text: My friend and I got a coupon for a free crazyshake with the purchase of a burger, so we went in attempt to utilize that.   First of all, if you're a local or are just parking in the venetian, this place is a little difficult to find in he casino. We found it after walking around for about 15 minutes asking how to get to it, and once we got to the hostess and showed her the coupon, we were told we needed to redeem them at a desk, which took another 5 minutes to find. From there we needed to get a players card. Long story short, we aren't 21 years old and couldn't redeem the coupon but we went to Black Tap anyway to see what the hype was.   We knew the milkshakes were huge and wanted to indulge so my friend and I split one- the chocolate brownie one. It was alright, but it looked cool! It's more of an aesthetic experience with the beautiful view of the "lake" in front of the Venetian and the artsy decorations inside. However, splitting just a milkshake and fried pickles was $25. I guess that's what you get when dining on the strip. Our waitress was very friendly at least!   For locals, I'm not sure if it was worth the trip but we got some cute pictures on the patio where we sat.

eKqWwCFK1sJJ0Wd7G5V19A.text: Location was the only difficult part.  It is located on the casino floor across from the sports book, not in Grand Canal or Restaurant Row like I was imagining.  Went just for the Crazy Shakes. $15 of amazing sugary goodness.  They are so popular, there is a dedicated location that is used to make them. Best part?  You can watch the action happen!  Shakes are NOT made in the kitchen, they are made where you can see them.  Each one is hand crafted carefully, and seems "with love."  They do top it with a LOT of whipped cream, and that is what filled us up faster, then when we got to the shake portion, we were struggling.  The quality and presentation are superior to anything I have ever seen.  Each has their own unique flare.  For example, Sweet and Salty has pretzel sticks, Cookies and Creme Supreme has a cookie sandwich, and the Birthday Cake has a literal birthday cake wedge on top.  Excellent place!  Will have to come for the food to try next time, and of course to indulge in another Crazy Shak  My suggestion for Management if this is reviewed: slightly larger diameter straws.  The ones they use are simple soda straws, and I'm assuming most of the shakes have particles in them that gets stuck in the straw.  For example I had the Cookies and Creme Supreme with a cookies and cream based shake, and found the straw to be unusable.  SECOND VISIT 3/24/2018:  came for another round.  This time, had a turkey burger salad prior.  Salad was incredibly fresh, very large portion, and flavorful.  CrazyShake chosen was a Brooklyn Blackout.  Just like the first experience, this shake had a delicate display but was bursting with incredible flavor.  The key to this visit was our waitress Bailey.  She was incredibly fun-spirited, took care of our table very nicely, and communicated with us whenever possible.  It is people like Bailey that help make experiences worth the while in Las Vegas.  Bravo!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_ufUAxjtwssxL8Z2C8vDtg.text: Extra good burger not your run of the mill cheese burger situation. Cool vibe, fun staff. Busy but not stressful. Get a shake just do it. Definitely come again.

z2aecba0k-GOPaaPKqIAYg.text: Save yourself time and money by staying clear of this place! 1) the service was terrible. Granted, it was a Saturday night and they were busy. But I mean it was really bad. It took them so long to bring my friend's beer he ended up going up to the bar. 2) the food is pricey for a burger joint and the food is borderline subpar/bad. My guacamole somehow tasted along the lines of spoiled milk. How does that even happen? 3) they're known for their milkshakes, and while they did look cool, none of ours tasted good. Tasted like dollar store ice cream. In conclusion, I don't want to harp on the place I just don't want anyone to pass up a good establishment for this one. Went to celebrate my boyfriend's 30th birthday so it's a bummer that it wasn't at least decent. Don't make the same mistake we did!!!

6fhUSWd6VUWA3wpiqJ9S7A.text: Milkshakes looked amazing but was a bit overrated. I was recommended to try by coworkers. For the price not worth it.

LxziTOLrlhcWo8qSzGByew.text: Over rated and over priced....we went with my family for my Mom's birthday and we were greeted with a glass of warm tap water? I didn't find anything special about the food itself. The shakes look impressive but taste like your basic milk shake with stuff added for glitz. For the amount we paid we could have gone somewhere way better. Sorry Black Tap. I won't be visiting again.

gjs6wI3urGhEuq0jnHDEIw.text: Great service! Delicious burgers and fresh fries! had the veggie black bean burger and falafel burger .

pWjb_C-d6WA8CIK0_SSCZg.text: I can say the milkshakes were really good definitely go for the milkshakes have no complaints about them. And the staff was really nice and sweet. But the food it self lacked a lot of flavor for me unfortunately. It just didn't had a taste of being burnt and no seasoning.

eV3XE4TSSIQBoUW2iAZe2w.text: Over priced for quality a gimmicky over priced strip restaurant. For a couple of quarter pound burger a water. Decent 80s -90s music tho. Wahlburgers is better.

YU8yeble5YUI7Ku8MEiteQ.text: OMG. Ok so I ordered the Cobb salad, and it was amazing !!!!!!! Like idk but it felt like the freshest, zestiest, crunchiest thing ever haha. I added chicken strips and it was amazing. The only thing was, the water lol it tasted kinda strange  but overall, food was amazing

VkwKyvSwlspEVQftdAS-9Q.text: I had been hearing a lot about Black Tap from some local friends that said it was a much try! So I made the trip down to the Venetian Hotel/casino and gave it a shot. Obviously they are well known for their insane shakes but had not heard much about the food. I decided to skip the appetizers (given I needed to save room for desert) so I went with the chicken sandwich topped with coleslaw, bacon and a side of fries. It came with a special sauce on the side which really making the sandwich (ended up asking for extra!) The place was really busy so I do understand the lack in service however I do feel their could be some improvement in that area. Now for the highly anticipated shakes, I went with the cookies and cream that came with an actual ice cream sandwich affixed to the side of the glass shake cup! To Die For! The shakes are huge but really live up to the hype in my opinion! If you're in need of a sugar fix this is the spot! Exotic shakes of all flavors to say the least!

_cCd6kmOweDMUx2ApySvKA.text: This place was awesome! The burger I got was made perfect. The fries were great and they came with a lot. The shakes are the best things I've ever had. My server was the bartender Johannah. She was excellent. My drink was never empty and she did a great job checking in with me. Definitely would recommend stopping by if your in the casino. If you want a shake, you might want to order that first. They are huge.

A7XcV59ud0sMV33ElDcSOQ.text: THIS JOINT IS INCREDIBLE! The food is amazing, the staff is wonderful and the shakes....they are absolutely out of this world. This is a MUST if you come to Vegas! We loved it so much New Years Eve we had to come back the next day! The bartenders are quick and let me tell you they know how to pour a drink. Great hospitality, quick service and the food is fantastic. Fun place you don't want to miss. Did I mention the shakes? Best I ever had....

oXrY63FKqCv2haO6zbGVEQ.text: My wife has been following this place for quite some time and she called tonite to make a reservation and we were told that we don't need a reservation! So we got ready and headed down only to find that they have the place booked for a private party! Not cool

vEp0T5vkeTypG-0n4UF1Zw.text: This place is amazing. We had a party of 6, as were celebrating my youngest 21st birthday.  When we first arrived we checked in and the stood in line. I was expecting to wait at least 30 to 45 min, but they got us in pretty quick, I think wait time totalled 10min. The atmosphere of this place is very upbeat. The music was loud, but enjoyable. The food was very good. My husband and I had the Mexico city burger, now we're not big meat eaters,  but we had to try. It was hands down one of the tastiest and juiciest hamburger I've had. Everyone in our group really enjoyed their meal, so no compaints. The drinks we ordered were tasteful and full of alcohol. I had the michelada royale, so yummy. My husband had something called the godfather 2, that was very very strong, but he liked it. This place is known for their specialty milkshakes so we ordered the cotton candy strawberry milkshake, hands down one of the best milkshakes we've had and I'm speaking for the entire group. To top of our wonderful experience here the service was fantastic. Our server Aaron was energetic, nice, upbeat and just a delight, he checked on us often to make sure we were all doing good, enjoying the food or needed drink refills. This is a place I will definitely return to and I highly recommend. Kudos to Black Tap.

7CdhbAqUlcKhE39Oa4FgVA.text: Came here for dinner, started off the meal with dessert, ordered an Oreo cookie sandwich shake right away. It filled me up so much I didn't leave room for their entrees but I did enjoy their mozzarella bites, fries and buffalo wings.  The cocktails were yummy, especially that watermelon one (can't remember the name). They're strong but tasty enough where you can't tell it's alcoholic...I love that.  Service was fast, easy and the noise level was just right. I love that it's casual like a bar but you don't have to shout over the table to have a conversation.

OJVqfJWVvRTisiKtfY9-UA.text: The shake with the Cinnamon Toast Crunch was  the burgers are truly delicious & I highly recommend the fried pickles.

WIhpMa2fJB4DiYP64eFNLw.text: I read so much about this place and saw all their pictures on Instagram, so I was pumped to come to this place. We came right at the lunch time rush and was told we could wait 30 minutes to sit outside or could be seated immediately inside. I really liked the whole vibe of this place, we sat right under these big neon pink lips. The women in my group could not stop posting pictures of the lips to Snapchat and Instagram.  Alesi was our waitress, we ordered our food and shakes pretty quickly after sitting down, and the shakes came soon after. The shakes are huge (and expensive) we split 2 shakes between 6 people. We got the cookies and creme shake supreme and Brooklyn Blackout. The Brooklyn Blackout was not great, there was too much chocolate syrup.  The Bison Burger was good, it was cooked well, but it was missing something. The flavor and juiciness was just missing.  The worst part of this place was our Waitress Alesi. She took our order, someone else delivered the food and she didn't come back until the bill came. We had no water for most of our meal. We then get our bill and realize they had already charged us 18% tax because we had 7 people. I guess she realized because she was already getting paid she didn't need to help us.  Food was decent, but could be so much better, and service was not good.

18O7NItAcE1edx5aTAftrw.text: Your standard bar food (burgers, fries, etc) but with massive and exotic sundaes. This is definitely a fun place to go to satisfy your sweet tooth and people watch others do the same.   It's on the bottom floor of the Venetian and, if you're lucky and/or patient, you can get a table outside on the water. If you're impatient (like me), just ask to sit at the bar and avoid the wait.  Good beer list, great desserts, friendly staff and fun ambiance. It checks all of my Vegas boxes and more.

wnvpQ6fHkPzi7NcBFfN0dA.text: I was very impressed with Black Tap! To start, our service was excellent. Our waiter was adorable. English was definitely not his first language but he powered through, he made jokes, we just had so much fun with him. In addition, multiple other people in the staff came over to get us whatever we needed, ask how things were, clear plates, etc. i was incredibly impressed.  I got the strawberry shake to start. I wasn't sure I could finish an entree and one of their beautiful dessert shakes. The strawberry shake was still huge but I literally felt like I was eating strawberries with ice cream. The flavor was impeccable.   I got the grilled chicken sandwich as a main dish. Dare I say, I might recommend this over the burger? It was SOOO GOOD. Our waiter told us it was his favorite and he did not steer me wrong. There were tons of avocado on it, the chicken had a nice Cajun seasoning, the salsa, I would eat this again and again if I could.

Disappointed.****

GJ8cLr2utn-Z0KkYZI9TPA.text: I am always looking for the best burger in Las Vegas, so whenever a new burger spot opens up I am always elated. When I heard a Black Tap opened up here in Vegas, I knew I had to see if the burgers and shakes lived up to the hype.  Black Tap is located within The Venetian, but the vibe I got going into the restaurant is much more of a Cosmopolitan vibe. It's a pretty trendy place with street art adorning the walls and neon signs everywhere. It's not a huge restaurant, but there are indoor and outdoor dining options which is always a plus for The Strip.  We took a booth inside by the Milkshake bar. Typically I am not a milkshake girl. I've been to Holsteins more times than I can count and have never gotten a shake, but when I saw them coming out of that bar area I knew I needed to try one. Ironically enough, the only photo I took inside Black Tap was of the milkshake!  We ordered the Brooklyn Blackout to start with. This is a chocolate shake with a chocolate chip rim. It's topped with a chocolate chip brownie, a mountain of whipped cream, chocolate sauce, and more chocolate chips. The crazy thing was the shake wasn't sickeningly sweet! Even crazier - it paired beautifully with the fried pickles we ordered.  If you are going here, you absolutely must get the fried pickles. They're pickle chips instead of spears, and the breading is so crispy. They bring them out piping hot and with a side of cool, creamy dill ranch. I'm not usually a fan of ranch, but the fact that it's made in house and has dill in it won me over.   After much deliberating we ordered The Greg Norman burger. This was made with a wagyu beef patty topped with house buttermilk-dill, blue cheese & arugula. What I thought was a tad odd is that they served the burger open faced with tomato and lettuce even though there was arugula on it. We decided against any additional toppings which was the right move.  This burger was perfectly balanced. The wagyu beef patty was seasoned to give it so much flavor. I would have been happy eating just that patty, it was that good. But then on top to have the peppery arugula and creamy blue cheese. It all melded together to make the tastiest burger I have ever had the pleasure of eating.  I was very impressed with how good the food was here, and considering it's at The Venetian it's reasonably priced. For a burger, a beer, a gigantic shake, and an appetizer we got out of there with only spending under $60. I can't wait to come back and eat my way through the rest of their menu!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brooklyn Blackout Shake

Fp0JTIA-7HoYrNP1wpWnvA.text: Super modern restaurant with really funky decor. Played awesome 90s music and service was really quick/friendly staff. The shakes were unreal to look at - truly works of art. Can only imagine the calories ;)  We had a burger salad, turkey burger salad and a regular burger - we all enjoyed it!

xQNHObFmX662HbqSIibLhw.text: Wow! What an amazing place.  Last night was my first time going to black tap after hearing so many family and friends rave about it.  John A. was so amazing in helping our large party and making sure we all felt comfortable and taken care of. He made us feel like family.  If you think the shakes are just for show to take cute pics for insta, you are so wrong. I mean yes, they are super impressive visually and will make all your friends at home jealous. But they are even more delicious! My party ordered multiple different flavors and they were so amazing I couldn't pick a favorite.  The atmosphere is also super cool.  We enjoyed being able to watch our shakes being prepared. We awed over the frosting being artfully applied to the glasses and covered with multiple fun candies.  We had such a great time and I look forward to the next time I will be able to visit.

SwcGpQOK0w9wmQjQTndMdQ.text: Really enjoyed eating here. The restaurant ambience is really cool and has a nice vibe. The service and food were great although none of us had stomachs large enough to try a milkshake. The onion rings here are enormous, so order those if you enjoy them. They looked fantastic.   I enjoyed a burger salad that honestly had way too much "salad". I only lament this because a large portion was left unconsumed. About half as many greens would be sufficient and also reduce food waste. Just a thought.   Everything was delicious and we had fun eating here. We also managed to arrive around 6pm and didn't wait for a table for 4. There was quite a long line when we left however so go a bit early when possible.

W5hzpEhJgIPkm4QbFRfzbQ.text: Overrated place for burgers inside a crowded and stinky casino. The dessert shakes a ate fun and amazing to eat but all whipped cream which was disappointing. Service was great and food was ok, expensive for the quality.

qoTlKm771w5zmwFT3JjjuA.text: The kids had one place they wanted to go during our annual trip to Vegas - Black Tap! The allure of crazy big , sugar bomb, calorie laden shakes was too much and we ended up here on day one they needed a much needed boost after a 3am start to our day!  Service was fast, friendly and efficient- kept order simple - two beers, one shake to be shared by two ; quite easily, these are huge) and fried pickles!  Let's begin with the food - the fried pickles were the best I have had anywhere, hands down ...amazing!! Kids loved the cookie shake.. outside is covered in Oreo pieces - an ice cream sandwich and whipped cream atop a huge shake - kids were a fan and price was reasonable and beer was good  Well priced , good good and amazing shakes!! Worth a visit

Pw8Ec8IhGNmV36C9B_c_zQ.text: Came here for my girl's birthday after a whole day of drunken brunch debauchery.  The staff was amazing.  They were so patient with our shenanigans,  and handled us like pros!   We got 3 milkshakes, French fries with truffle mayo,  and fried pickles.  I can tell you with certainty that all of the above may have saved our lives.  The pickles were the unsung heroes of our evening.  They even put a candle in my friend's shake for her birthday!  The beer list here is great for a milkshake spot on the strip.  I found the voodoo ranger double imperial IPA on tap!!   It's located in the Venetian casino floor next to the poker room.   Bonus fact: Venetian/palazzo is like the best place for vegas local food and bev not only for the stellar restaurant row, but because parking is easy and FREE!!

TlJ19N4U4N4nsmRVFXPyKA.text: The best Korean chicken sandwich and wings I have had in a long time. Didn't have a ton of expectations since yah know... it is Vegas... but I can't wait to go back! Nice service, interesting atmosphere, diverse and fun menu that doesn't have to break the bank.  We also had two milkshakes that were absolutely ridiculous (in a good way), because again... it is Vegas.

fAjafvJB7RQHcnN-kEIRGg.text: Had seen all the rave about this place on Yelp and figured we had to check it out. This is located inside the Venetian hotel. Be ready to wait a couple of minutes because there was a line when we went and they said that is the usual. When we get seated, we decide to order a beer and their passion fruit lemonade. Both were good. We order the truffle burger and the texan burger. The truffle burger did have a good truffle taste so they do not skimp out on that. It comes with wagyu beef, smoked gouda, baby arugula, truffle-yuzu vinaigrette, and black truffle mayo. The texan burger was also delicious. It's a prime burger with aged cheddar, crispy onion ring, bacon, sweet baby rays bbq, mayo. We ordered these with sweet potato fries. One of them came with sweet potato the other did not. This was not an issue as they quickly brought us sweet potato fries and apologized. When it came to the desserts, we ordered the cake shake (cake batter shake). This came with vanilla frosted rim with rainbow sprinkles topped with a funfetti cake slice, whipped cream, rainbow sprinkles & a cherry. AMAZING. Please note these are big enough to share! Overall, we had a good experience and I would recommend eating here.

jjkMPRsgEgTDZMdnv-fvMQ.text: So there are a few Black Tap's here in NYC but for whatever reason have yet to try them...but did get to try the Vegas version of it and was pleased much with what I had. At first was gonna get the birthday cake shake they have but being that I went on the 4th of July my waitress suggested to me to get the July 4th cake shake. Wow how amazingly good...and huge it was. Couldn't believe that I managed to eat the entire thing in one sitting but I did...but also made sure not to eat anything before I ate that. lol.   Have yet to try their burgers but I will in due time in one of the NYC locations. Hopefully it lives up to the expectation. May even get another shake if I have enough room for that.

AG0Ljcmk6mlNQcTcZ5dunw.text: Sat right at the be to try out one of these shakes. We ordered the Oreo shake so there would be some chocolate without being overwhelming. To be honest this has to be a completely overrated shake. It wasn't as amazing as I've heard it being. Tasted like a normal shake. Definitely too much for just one person to finish. Staff was nice, not the best service.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xQgym60nPbkb3-LFGmh6Eg.text: This is NOT your ordinary burger and shakes place! I came here for my birthday and I was very impressed. From the time we walked in we were greeted with smiles and great service. Seated promptly, and handed a menu with so many delicious options they leave you no choice but to return. We asked for some suggestions and was told the queso dip was popular so we tried that as the appetizer, definitely the right decision. Warmed perfectly, with just the right amount of kick to it, not too spicy, and the portion was a good amount.   For our meal we tried the Mexico City burger with sweet potato fries and the Texan burger with onion rings. Food came out shortly after we finished the our appetizer and it looked delicious we were excited! Now I will say we didn't try the regular fries, but the sweet potato fries were excellent, well seasoned and cooked to perfection. The burgers were amazing such unique flavors and prime beef you can tell the difference in these burgers. The Mexico City had a nice spice to it and the cheese melted in your mouth. The Texan was great, and it came with some zesty bbq sauce that was also good.   Had to leave room for a shake. We ordered the cookies n cream supreme. It was amazing, the detail they put into crafting these shakes are out of this world. There was cookie crumbles pasted to the side of the cup, a whole Oreo ice cream sandwich on top with a lot of whip cream and I was in heaven. It was delicious. I met the manager John and he gave us a little background on the establishment and decor. He was very nice, as was our server Ashley! All in all it was a great night and I enjoyed my birthday dinner. Thanks Black Tap, see you soon!

Environment: Hipster, casual ambiance, great for date night   Customer service: Bartender was friendly.   Checked in with us frequently.   What I ordered:  * Sour Power - If you love sour gummies or sour worms, this is your milkshake. Creamy goodness with a hint of tang.  * Bam Bam - Fruity pebble lovers unite! * Mexican City Burger - Burger patty was cooked to perfect and stayed juicy. Pickled jalapeno was a great twist.   Overall: I wish the menu was more affordable but I would return for another fun night of milkshakes.

Overall: Awesome milkshake! Friendly Service!
