znX1hVirk-M1sIiOB0QR8Q.text: I went to lunch with my cousin and were halfway through our meal when she felt something on her foot, she was wearing sandals. It was a huge cockroach. We were shocked and disgusted and immediately lost our appetite. She spoke to the manager Eric and instead of acting as disgusted as we were he seemed annoyed and inconvenienced by our distress. He said that it was because of construction nearby and that they are having pest control out once a week. If this is an ongoing problem then they should be closed down until it is resolved. Customers should not be exposed to the possibility of this happening again.  Very disappointed and will not be back ever.

ChmXxREUnkIe57uXeJKBVA.text: Not sure what the hype is all about. Had a hamburger and fancy milkshake. I gave 2 stars for the excellent service and 1 star for the mexican burger. ZERO stars for the milkshake. i had the peanut butter one. all fluff, no flavor. the entire top of the shake was filled with whipped cream. the frozen liquid milk was blended with one spoonful of peanut butter. m&m's stuck to the side of the cup with old frosting. really?

f9cbQx1DFyRw6aac1sDrGw.text: Soooooo, we went to Black Tap for a birthday dinner and it was a group of 13 people plus one baby. We called ahead to see if reservations were needed, they said no, its first come first serve. The wait wasnt that long for a table big enough to fit our group. It was about 15 minutes. The atmosphere of the restaurant was amazing. I loved their music theming and their playlist was fantastic, I was dancing in my seat.    The food and the service on the other hand left a lot to be desired especially considering the prices. I ordered the chili cheese burger and it came with fries. The fries were delicious while the burger was okay. It could have used a bit more seasoning, but the actual serving size of the meal was more than enough. The main reason for being at Black Tap was of course the milkshakes. I had the Cotton Candy Crazyshake, and it was very pretty. The shake itself was a normal strawberry one overshadowed by all the bells and whistles of the cotton candy, lolly pops and rock candies.   Our waitress wasnt the most customer friendly. It would have been nice to know how they split their checks before hand. The receipts were all mixed up, but thankfully the manager came through and was more accommodating. I believe Black Tap is relatively new to Vegas so maybe a bit more training is needed.   I dont think the music and ambiance is enough to make me want to go back though.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cotton Candy Crazy Shake

ERK4HAQ1eUx5x2esUa_mWw.text: This is my new favorite burger spot! The truffle burger is a must try and so is the cookie shake! Amazing service and some great spots to take some pictures!

GjyX53ijuePGsR1Mn6zlJQ.text: I was very excited to bring my daughters to eat at this place the environment looks fun but the food it's horrible tho the shakes are pretty good, and customer service is horrible my daughter order a pizza burger she had took two bites and she hated it , we asked the waitress if she could please give us a different plate or different food and she asked her manager and she said the manager refused to do so, we have never been told that before which is it was very weird,  the restaurant manager will not even come out and ask us how was her food or any concern towards it, to me that speaks horrible customer service. my daughter was very upset that I had asked but I thought it was only fair that if we spend that much money, we will have one meal be replaced. And they didn't , not only that but the food taste quality was very unflavor Not best burgers for sure, if anything try the Sugar Factory there Amazing from there food and deserts and for sure customers Service and you will not feel like you just spend your money and not had a good experience. Oh and we still tip 20%  not going back here again

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wn6AGwzvd9-vkWHjosS80A.text: Ok this review is just for the milkshakes and service. We didn't eat any food or drink any alcohol. So. We show up on a Monday evening and there's a 20 minute wait, so, if you go on a weekend night, good luck. So we get sat. Then it takes another 20 minutes after we order to get our milkshakes. So. In case there's any math majors, we're at 40 minutes. Then we eat them. I'll go over the milkshakes in a second. When we're done, it takes ANOTHER 20 minutes to find our server and get our check. THEN it takes him 10 minutes to find a manager to split the check, which, why is that necessary? So we're past an hour now. For a few milkshakes. Which, really, weren't that good. The milkshake part itself is mediocre at best, the baked goods on top are crumbly and dry and you can tell they're ordered from the lowest bidder and come in frozen. The frosting and other stuff added to it just make it way way WAY too sweet. You could easily get plain milkshakes for the table and order just one fancy shake to share the extra bits but why? They're 15-20 bucks for a plain vanilla shake, frozen, pre-made, dry baked good, and way too much sugar. All of that plus the terrible service means: just don't go. It's honestly not worth the effort for an Instagram pic, I promise. They're pretty but you're paying for the showmanship, not for taste. Sigh. Why did Serendipity 3 have to close?

BP9SSU2Jb7jkVilLaoNeOQ.text: Great atmosphere, I took my 13 year Daughters here for their birthday dinner. The music here is right on point

cOAUKlgbyimm85CTT9EvFg.text: What a great find! Quickly seated with our reservation on a Monday night.  Ordered their mule and it was delicious! Fresh ginger flavor that wasn't too sweet. All people in our party loved their entrees but the quinoa salad definitely stuck out as a highlight for the otherwise meat eaters. Great feedback on the veggie burger & California burger as well. Service was on point - attentive, knowledgeable and quick.   Will definitely be back again!

z1_YH0ceaZapiIr26bVNeA.text: Amazingly huge shakes! Very creative way to consume a million calories. They are as good as they look, but bring friends. You won't be able to eat one alone!!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

COHNQYuHcpGzDWS1QpsE9g.text: I was so excited to take my granddaughter here!  We live here in Vegas, but don't go to The Strip often.  She has been wanting to go for a long time and I promised to get her one of those amazing looking shakes.  Well, the line to get in was ridiculous and we stood in it for over half an hour.  Not even reaching the podium.  I finally went to the lady at the podium and asked about how long it would be and she said probably another hour or hour and a half.  I asked if we could get a shake to go and she said "sure!" So we got out of line and went to the bar only to find out that the special shakes are not available To Go and we could only get a small regular shake.  Which we did since we were exhausted trying to get in.  What a disappointment.  To make matters worse we could see Black Tap employees in the kitchen area having a great time messing around for a really long time.  So....   :(

MvKQEOyaVqSgpS9DciPi8A.text: If I could give this place a 0 I would. The only reason why I'd let this have 1 star is because the food was decent.  Last night I had my birthday dinner, which was a party of 15. And I had the worst experience from the moment I got there to the moment I left!   First, I called a week ahead to make reservations for my birthday in which I was then informed that they do not take reservations and they told me to call the morning of my party and they would reserve a table for my party. As I did. Yesterday morning I called as soon as they opened and they ensured me that I would have the table I wanted and not to worry. Just to be safe, I called when I was on my way to the Venetian and they then told me they didn't have any tables and they would only sit us at separate tables. I told them that it's a party and I would like to be seated at one table. They told me they would do so.   When I got there, I talked to the hostess and told them that we had a reserved table and she said that they did not have the table and that I had to wait in a long line and the wait would be an hour. Another worker came out and said that she could seat us and also told me they have a cake fee where they would charge me per slice for them to hold my cake in the kitchen and to cut it. I told her I would just do it myself so I don't have to pay and she said that's fine. She then seats me outside at 2 different tables.   30 minutes after my entire party arrives, our server comes out and asks if we were ready to order... but we never got menus!! I also asked her if she could turn on the mister because it was very very hot outside. She came back with menus and told me the mister was broken. So I asked for iced water. Another 20 minutes pass and she finally comes out with warm water and takes our order. After we get our food and eat, we had to continuously ask her for water!   As I was about to do my birthday cake, the server said she was going to charge me and I told her the previous worker told me they would wave the fine. In which she brought her manager to us where he basically scolded us like we were children. (I had made goody bags for my friends with drinks and all the servers were saying how cool it was and such a good idea. We were never informed at any point prior to being scolded that we could not have it). He said we aren't allowed to have the goody bags and that we were supposed to pay for the cake fee (WHICH I BROUGHT AND CUT MYSELF SO WHY WOULD I BE CHARGED???) He said he wanted our business but there were rules. Which is understandable, but we were never ever informed of any rules!!! They knew it was a birthday party as I made that very clear on the phone multiple times and they never once told me about a cake fee?   LASTLY, our server messed up all of our checks. I informed her before everyone got there we wanted separate checks and she told me that would be fine and easy.   She gave us all of our checks back and they were all wrong. Personally, my check was for $45 and some change, I gave her my card and she came back and charged me for $65 and some change. I was not aware of the extra charge when I gave her my credit card, but left it as I was already pissed off and just wanted to leave. As for the rest of my party, they all had trouble with their checks and cards.   After dinner, my friends and I were all trying to figure out how many Uber's we needed and we were outside the restaurant to the side and the hostess said that we needed to leave and could not be there. Why were we getting kicked out from a restaurant that we just spent hundreds at? And we weren't even in the restaurant!! We were in the hotel casino waiting. Not causing any problems or anything.  The whole night was absolutely ridiculous and ruined my whole birthday. Truly one of the worst experiences at any restaurant I ever have, ON MY BIRTHDAY.

0q-dQBES0t-7i-AXsPJQoA.text: Really good is burgers...cool vibe.  Also ridiculous millshakes!!  Pretty much on par price wise with other Strip burger joints.  We waited about 30 min for a table on a Saturday night.

0vH60Ud_UqB39Gyp6jC0Eg.text: Ok, me and some friends are here last night.  I read the reviews and I thought I was in for so typical over priced bull crap... NAH FAM!  The Greg Norman burger was crazy good! I had the cake milkshake was everything thing I thought it would be.  Customer service was solid so I had no complaints at all man (shoutout to the swole waiter with the glasses, homie was super helpful).  I'm local and I can say it was worth every penny.  I highly recommend it

_0ERJ6q21mVgKIzTOhJv8A.text: The food was decent. I highly recommend the queso and guacamole. I went more so fit the dessert, but I was underwhelmed. The ice cream was blah with no flavor and the cookie was not sweet. The presentation was amazing, but the dessert was a 2 1/2 - 3 at best. The food, however, was flavorful and filling; hence the four stars.

ftubFJNsIvlaIPkKWAcI0g.text: Food is okay, shakes taste like McDonald's shakes, service is extremely slow and forgetful about bringing drinks, and it's automatically 18% tip on 6 people.

PznBSbWtpuJ9atMwfDAzjA.text: My family and I really enjoyed the food here. The shakes were delicious and presentation decadent.  My husband I loved the music playing in background and the volume was perfect. We got burgers cooked just as we ordered and I got a Cesar salad with a beef patty. House sauce recommended and definitely didn't disappoint.  Overall, definitely a great place to get together for good food and desserts! I give them 4 star

uYBcLcmMWGpwrxjJS5oaGA.text: This place has the most amazing shakes and a brilliant presentation!!!!! The wait staff is so friendly and fun!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

B3kEb8TvkCwboJ-wVOoH2A.text: Came specifically for the gourmet milkshake selections and it did not disappoint! I knocked down 1 star because it's right by the sports betting area and poker tables, where the waiting line starts, so it wasn't an ideal location for the kids. Nonetheless, the milkshakes were enjoyed and be prepared for that sugar coma to kick in quick!

8eu8dod3Bnox3_7hiQVm0w.text: I came for the milkshakes because they looked amazing online. The Oreo milkshake was AWESOME! You have to spilt this with someone. It is huge and pricey!!! The only downfall is that the restaurant is in the middle of the casino and smells like smoke!! I would not be able to actually eat there due to the smell of smoke!

5xojnbVMNQjMaIRGVaMvMA.text: Got the truffle burger and it was cooked just right. The sauce wasn't my favorite, but when you're trying to be adventurous in your food choices it was a good shake up from the normal "cheeseburger". Fried pickles were a must have, and a must have again. Our waiter/bartender was very professional and funny. It felt more like talking to a friend than a waiter which is hard to find.

yVRtrOS_lToyQVJa48zECw.text: the meal was mediocre, and the prices were high. we were charged extra for sauce sides that should have come with the meal without notification. there are no free drink refills, and overall just a mediocre dining experience. the food as a whole wasn't at all bad, nor was the service, I was just expecting a little better from previous reviews. i will most likely not go out of my way to eat here again. i ordered the bison burger and cake shake.

r3nFWYf8BvdHhCBjT9xrjA.text: The pizza burger was a little underwhelming for its name. The sweet potato fries were great though. Our server, Carlos, was the best! The burgers were cooked well. The milkshake needed way more ice cream in it. The only reason it's not 5-stars is because it's a much higher priced Steak-N-Shake. My wife and I had four beers, two burgers, and one shake, and it came out to $125, including tip. As Vegas locals, we could have gotten a lot more for $125 than that.

pzg9Iou2T_QHPcHhO0KJRg.text: We arrived at about 6pm.  There was a line to get a table but the bar is first come, first serve, so we sat down immediately.  The burgers were huge and the service was pretty quick!  We did not get any shakes but they look amazing!

8YQBbBuLqSn3LGKXNOdgWQ.text: I'm extremely disappointed with the black tap restaurant. They over compensated with the lack of flavor in their burgers with a abnormal amount of salt. The shakes are way to sugary almost to the point where it was inedible. The only plus is the music played but still not worth the trip down.

VUxdENnzYQ72fRPC1SKbhA.text: While visiting Las Vegas decided to finally try Black Tap which has obviously been an instagram favorite for their decadent milkshakes. Disclaimer, I didn't actually try the milkshake because I think given the size of that thing you really need to come just for that and we were looking for dinner!  To start we shared the brussel sprouts app, which was deep fried and then came with a tahini lemon dipping sauce. The sauce was super unique and the veggies were fried to perfection. Highly recommend.  I ordered the mexican burger with a turkey burger patty. It was yummy, had pickled jalapenos, a fried onion ring and a chipotle mayo with cheese. I really like the buttered bun and overall it was a good burger that hit the spot. However, I have had better turkey burgers (less dry, more flavorful) My boyfriend got a regular beef burger with mushrooms, onions and cheese. He really enjoyed his and while I didn't try it he said he would come again for the burgers. The fries were okay but nothing special. They could try and jazz those up given that they are a craft burger place, maybe make the fries a little more "crafted" as well.  Sitting at the bar, we had a great experience. All the servers were AWESOME. Super friendly, attentive (constantly filling my water glass) and just overall a very welcoming bunch. Loved the decor and the 90s/00s music they were playing.  Ambiance gets a 5/5  Food 3.5-4/5  So I'd average the experience a 4/5. Next time I need to come back and try the milkshakes (if only for the picture :)

iTVLl4PSX8rVb4sZfSkj1Q.text: Waited three years to have one of these shakes after following them on instagram on their NY location- amazing!  Thanks Jason M. for outstanding service at our table tonight!! #blacktaplv #bestshakeever

gm15QqC1OfhYU5voapy4zw.text: Phenomenal shakes, food and service!!! This place has exceeded our expectations!!! As we walked in everyone was very friendly and greeted us with a smile. We were seated right away and the walk from the front to our table was just amazing as we saw some vibrant wall murals and the boom box shaped seating area that is just screaming fun and gave you a very nostalgic 80's vibe. We originally came in for the shakes but as we were going through the menu everything sounded so good so we ended up ordering their famous All American burger, Chili cheese burger, Old fashion burger and Crispy chicken sandwich. And may I just say that it was the juiciest and most well seasoned burgers I've ever put in my mouth and all 3 of my children felt exactly the same way... but that was just the tip of the iceberg when we got our shakes that's what hit the spot not only for the kids but for a kid at heart like me as well...the shakes was insanely delicious enough balance of sweetness and creaminess it was just unbelievably good... it's a piece of heaven on earth!!! If someone is having a really bad day just one look and taste of this crazy shake will definitely turn it all around!!!   To top off our experience the owner Chris and General manager John Abin  even approached our table and checked on all of their other guests now that's good customer service... when was the last time a restaurant owner and a manager check up on you while your dining?!!! My guess is never only happens here at Black Tap where the food, service and Shakes are Crazy Good!!!

tLsiFXJBgxZW29DP3zxqDA.text: My wife had a get together with her work friends. Saturday they had a ladies night out so I found myself alone for dinner. I stopped by Saturday night and had the The Mexico City burger. It was so good that I went back Sunday to try a different burger. Sunday I had The Greg Norman Burger which did was amazing as well. I had the Cookie shake for desert. The service was excellent. I tend to drink a lot of soda; the waitress was quick with the refills. I will definitely be back to try the other burgers and shakes.

qHaTj4-tAO6VZDJwVGVTJA.text: Burgers, fries, and fried pickles were all really good.  The fried pickles were hand breaded and crisp.  The pickle that came with the burger reminded me of home jarred pickles.  Burger was thick and cooked medium temp as it should be.  I didn't have one of their shakes, but saw several customers purchase them.  They looked excessive and delicious.

kuJvT8tfgqanRv5C6BiK8A.text: The Food is amazing price is great, and the Shakes are great. I Would really recommend this place for a date night

ZLLD5DA3khTTbZ2V8kRV-g.text: Very average food. Walk a few blocks and get a budger from in and out. Much better quality and value. Don't try their onion rings....

71_5mdKc1nrhgwgC2Q78Lg.text: WOW! Talk about indulgent! My girlfriends and I decided it was about time to treat ourselves and I've been wanting to try this place out for a while. While waiting for our party to arrive, the bartender, Jonny, was friendly and knowledgeable about the cocktails leading me to order a watermelon cocktail. Yummy & perfect for summer! If it wasn't 100 degrees outside we would've loved to sit on the patio overlooking the lake and the strip, but we opted to stay inside. We weren't too happy with the table we were sat at, but the manager, Nate was kind enough to move us to a better table for our group. He checked on us throughout the night to make sure we had an enjoyable meal. We started with the chips and guacamole and as basic as that sounds it ended up being the best guacamole I've ever had! Three of us ordered the truffle burger because we love truffles and it was amazing. Juicy burger with a yummy soft bun. Fries & onion rings were delicious. Comes with your choice of dipping sauce. I opted for the truffle mayo of course and it was delish. We finished off with a crazy shake and boy are they CRAZY! Crazy huge & crazy good. These milkshakes were monstrous. I ordered the cake shake that was topped with a slice of funfetti cake. The cake was super moist and the milkshake was a perfect ending to our meal. Everything from the ambience to the service was on point. Will definitely be coming back!

39xUuPQi2QjfjZxgEQUQ4Q.text: I was super stoked to try this place, but it's really nothing special, but the food is pretty good. My friend and I went for dinner and sat outside and it's so pretty to sit next to the water at the Venetian and watch the gondolas. We got a cookies and cream shake, the old fashioned burger with onion rings and coleslaw, the Texan burger with fries and ranch, and the fried mozz. All the food was good! Like I said, it's not a die for restaurant, but it's definitely good if you're looking for a burger/shake place to eat at.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Texan burger
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried mozz

p1mQ-ApSRs6Ya_q85IPFnA.text: Black Tap Vegas was amazing!   Couldn't be happier with the service and of course the food.  Everyone in our party enjoyed their burgers and the shakes!    Can't wait to go back!!

mSboVz1bAoM7ij5gxK6IZw.text: My friend had been wanting to try this place for forever and we finally got the chance... and it did not disappoint! We were lucky enough to sit in a semi-private booth, which made us feel special :) Our server greeted us quickly and warmly. She was great all night. We ordered one of the specialty "Shakers" to share since we were told it would serve 4-6 people. If you were pouring half shots, you could serve 6, but by real pour standards, you'll only get about 4 shots out of it. That was disappointing. I ordered the Turkey Burger salad for my entree. I was nervous at first, because turkey burgers can go wrong very quickly. This one was wonderful! Not overcooked, nice and juicy, a little too salty, but overall really yummy. And I love fruit in a salad, so the cranberries and apple pieces were more than welcome! Honestly, wish there'd been more!! When it came time for dessert, we decided to split the Bam Bam crazy shake. After seeing several shakes come out of the kitchen, we knew we couldn't handle one of our own- they're massive! It was soooooo good! I highly recommend and would absolutely order it again... though I'd definitely like to give the other shakes a try too :)  My only real complaints would be the noise level. It was CRAZY loud. I had a REALLY hard time hearing my friend sitting 3 feet away from me and the server. Having to shout at one another got old fast. Also, there are only two restrooms for the entire restaurant. As in two one- room bathrooms. They smelled and were quite dirty. They could definitely use a couple more.   All this to say I enjoyed my first experience here and look forward to returning for more.

2sq-s5V7TdnFBYuLYAcxeg.text: Line to get in at 1pm on a Monday was about 20 people long but moved fast, only took 10 minutes or so. Sat at the bar and were given tiny mason jars to drink water out of- silly. The menu looked great but prices were unexpectedly high ($17 for a hamburger). We don't eat dairy so the crazy shakes were fun to see but no dessert options other than shakes. We got chips/guac (skip it- $12 and tiny portions) a chicken sandwich w/ sweet potato fries (large portions) and house salad (tasty but small). The salad came out about 20 minutes after the rest of our food, only after I asked where my salad was. The waitress didn't put it in when placing our order. The food was good but it was just overpriced, wasn't worth the hassle. $50 for lunch for 2..And we didn't even order 2 full entrees. Bartenders are busy, understandably, so get a table so you have more attentive service.

Mt75OpIjGNCUYblsB_GHDw.text: I was so intrigued to visit the restaurant because I absolutely love craft beer and amazing foodies. However, the experience was less than average. My mom just had heart surgery and as a result, needed to be in a wheel chair. The hostess said no wheel chairs were allowed. We were a party of 8 so had to wait ... one hostess said 25 minuets and another said an hour. The hostess said she could spilt the tables into groups of fours, across the room or seat a party of 4 at one time and the other party of 4 25 minutes later. We still decided to wait to be seated all together .. as we waited we ordered 2 beers and a Kahlua  and cream. The bar didn't have kahlua or cream. So because we were wanting an hour for our table, we got a kahlua drink from the bar across the room. When finally called for our table the hostess told my mom that she couldn't bring her kahlua drink in ... well, that is when I had enough... had the bar at the restaurant had the ingredients then we would not have had to go to the bar across the lobby. Lastly, they were out of wagyu beef at 7:00pm on a Saturday!!!! AND they are lucky that  a law  suit isn't being drafted because to say wheelchairs are not allowed is against all violations. She is handicapped and now has a disability because of her heart and we were not allowed to bring in her wheelchair, which is a child's size because she is so fragile. Needless to say, horrible service skills as well as handicapped laws. Please review with your staff disability and handicapped laws...

rko7sg06sy5b4vKLo_swhQ.text: As a Las Vegas local I like to try as many restaurants as possible so I know where to recommend. Well, Black Tap, has earned a spot near the top of my list of recommendations! The Truffle and the Old Fashioned Craft Burgers are are two of the best burgers I have ever had!! (seriously, that good!) I'd also give a quick thumbs up to the craft beer selection. The service and management are both an A+! Unfortunately I cannot remember my servers name from my last visit, but I recall my meeting with the manager John. It's rare you meet a restaurant manager that will take time to stop and talk to you and genuinely show interest in what you are saying. I'll definitely be stopping in here after work on a regular basis!

4emE95xaLXyORvh9mU1ZZA.text: The fried picks are SO GOOD.  The atmosphere was cool, the burgers were good but it is over priced in my opinion.  $70 for a burger, a salad, pickles and 2 lemonades.

w_gBHq94wrceIYIxoE6F3A.text: All the excitement to visit this place for nothing! Two thumbs down to their hostess and customer service skills, We stayed at Venetian for my daughters 23rd Bday late January. We were a group of  10 7 adults 2 teenagers and a baby. When we approached the hostess to request a table, she was very short tempered and said wait time would be close to 30 minutes. Mind your there was no one else waiting and counter seating as well as bar seating available. We asked if we could be split between those two areas. She said she would ask, meanwhile she asked that we "all move aside as a group of 4  walked in and she tried to accommodate them" I immediately told her We are customers too and if you don't' have room for us then we can go elsewhere. Shortly after she got my husbands attention and magically found two table for us just a few minutes later.  I know is Vegas, but this Food is waaay too overpriced and milkshakes look messy life compared to their ads. Oh and Be ready to drop a $40 tip for their terrible service. Never again! #fail

Q_zSqWvVZt_c2K67TSWnqw.text: The BEST NEW GEM in the VENETIAN!!! What a FANTASTIC MANAGER !!  It was 10 minutes before closing can't remember it was either 1 AM or 2 AM. Called  the restaurant and The hostess says they're closing. I asked to speak to the manager and he said his name was John I told him that " we are staying at the Palazzo Hotel and we are starving. His reply was " come on over and I'll wait for you. "   Not only did John wait for us but to our surprise he personally served us because everybody else was cleaning up for closing.   What a AWESOME guy & MANAGER.!!!!!  5 STAR burgers & sundaes 5 STAR JOHN the manager  This place is a SOLID 10  LUCKY US, STEVEN & BLONDIE

oojAFYOycW2pTCNvK-Ihgw.text: The hype is definitely the shakes. I give it a three only because our server Alyssa wasn't very attentive. We (party of 6) work inside the Venetian and asked our server for employee discount once our check came and asked that we needed our badge. We randomly came in to try it out so didn't have our badges with us . We had our work schedules on our phone and paycom for proof but didn't seem interested to check it out.  Will we be returning ? Probably not.  We work in the industry and provide excellent guest service to Venetian guests and employees. I don't see why we're being treated so differently here. Especially for being Venetian employees.

UqnM-iANyspnxDi1yPxWWw.text: From the first time I saw pictures of the sundae creations on Facebook, I knew I had to get to Black Tap and see it for myself. I made the short trip from LA to LV and connected with girlfriends for our foodie fun, cuz that's what we like to do.    My first impression of Black Tap was not exactly what I was expecting. That being said, I should have kept an open mind.  The restaurant was far more upscale than I thought it would be, but definitely casual and easy going with a modern decor perfect for burgers and beer.  I guess I pictured it to look like a 1950's style malt shop based on the incredible sundaes. Glad I was wrong.  The host was very nice and I think he could see we were excited to be there. He sat us in a very cool booth where we had a great view of the the sundae preparation and all the candy on display.   I can't say enough about our server, Carlos.  He was very friendly and helpful when we had lots of menu questions.   Two of us shared a Texan Burger and onion rings. The burger was scrumptious and was generous in size, so perfect to split. I appreciated that it was divided in half in the kitchen at no extra cost.  My other friend ordered a side Greek salad and crispy Brussels sprouts for the table. I think the portions were very nice and we were all satisfied with our meal. Of course, we left room for that much anticipated dessert.  After much deliberation, I decided to get the Cake Shake.  Yep, it's a vanilla cake batter shake topped with a huge piece of white cake and sprinkles everywhere!    We had a terrific time, sharing dinner and dessert.  This will not only be a great memory, but I plan to make it a tradition every time I go to Vegas.  By the way, my girlfriend who lives in Vegas is also a chef and culinary instructor and she raved about the burger, and I think that says 5 stars!  Linda R.

xqBsUyacoVt3jFrsC-irpQ.text: I absolutely LOVED this place!! The vibe was really cool (located inside the Venetian) and the service was outstanding. But let's talk about the food....really great wings and guacamole. We really wanted to try the desserts so we didn't order a lot of food or apps....needed to save room for Churro Chaco Taco and the Salt n Sweet dessert and both were outstanding!! My go to place when I get back to Vegas!!!

OuqwqcPngoLCxDyFFQFlpQ.text: Honestly one of the worst milkshakes I've ever had, and milkshakes are are hard to mess up. The reason these milkshakes are popular are for photos for the 'gram. I got the Bam Bam and the cinnamon churro milkshake. The toppings on both of them were stale. The fruity pebbles rice krispy treat was hard to bite into and the churros were not good at all. Now for the milkshake, the cinnamon toast crunch one had almost full size pieces of the cereal in the shake. This is fine if it was an ice cream sundae, but not for a shake that you're supposed to drink out of a straw (the pieces were way too big to fit through the straw). Same goes for the whole pieces of fruity pebbles in the Bam Bam shake. The churro shake was overly sweet and 6 of use together couldn't even finish the 2 shakes. Like I said, these shakes were made to look good, not necessarily taste good. The fries were okay, if you're a fan of soft thick cut fries then you'd probably like them. The truffle mayo house sauce was pretty good though.

dGtr6dBcFxuiSkQm3hrROA.text: I WOULD NOT GO BACK FOR A BURGER. Went for a late lunch during EDC weekend, it was surprisingly not busy. We got a table right away. Our server took our order and then within 30 seconds we wanted to make sure he understood we wanted the shakes after our meal. He rudely acted as if it was a huge burden on him. Our server then changed to a different person shortly after who had no clue what was going on. Did not wait long for our food to come out but it came out with the shakes. The fried pickles were awesome and are now my favorite. The dill pickle ranch was great. The burger was way overpriced and mediocre. The bottom bun was completely soggy due to the fact that the lettuce was not underneath the burger. The onion rings were not great and I would recommend sticking to the fries. The shakes tasted and looked good. If I ever go back it's because someone with me wants to get a crazy shake and I want fried pickles.

pymGNXtF5VfGnxkBDZxqCQ.text: There were 4 of us, they were very kind to hold our table for ten minutes while 2 arrived. However, I ordered my burger medium. The waiter however pushed me to order medium well (little bit of pink) like the rest of the group. When we got our burgers, ALL of them were well done to the point of being very dry and burnt around the edges. We all agreed the burgers didn't taste juicy or flavorful, which really sucked because mine was $22. I recommend order MEDIUM with pink all the way through.

y8VnatC9T7r4QTFJUkqaZg.text: So I arranged a date for my husband and I, to The Void Star Wars VR experience then to The Black Tap Tavern for lunch (he must've asked me 1,000 times "where's that place with the awesome milkshakes?"). I got the Bam Bam Shake (aka Fruity Pebbles shake), Doug went with the Brooklyn Blackout (all chocolate). We also got burgers which we both agreed afterward we should've just split a burger. The shakes were so yummy, it's all about the shakes here, if you don't leave that place with a smile on your face after having one of their shakes, then you are lame. The burgers are just ok, they were good but nothing special, same with the fries. Everything is pricey but that's life on The Strip. Staff was great. Loved the Old School Hip Hop vibe. I'd for sure go back for a shake.

IhHVXiXFzOK8vcqifmtMRg.text: These shakes are solely instagramable food hype. There was nothing WoW about the flavor of the shake. It was a basic runny milkshake just decked out with some basic candy. Too be honest I'd rather go to Sonic or DQ to get a milkshake and avoid the hassle. Literally tastes the same. We ordered a Sweet and Salty- basic peanut butter shake coated with m&ms and ONE Reese? Sorry but I'd prefer Reese's over m&ms on a peanut butter shake. . The cookie shake ice cream flavor was tastier as they blended cookies into the ice cream, but it was way to runny. Not very satisfying at all. The fries here were delicious tho! crispy and super hot.

PJ10Y8EaxFUJ0yVE25TEzQ.text: Black Tap comes west.   The shakes are obviously amazing. The flavor and style of the crazy shakes are really something to see.   The burgers are top notch and extremely filling.   Personally I like this location better than the NYC one just bc it has more lighting. It's hard to see in the NYC location.   Very clean as well which I appreciate.   I also think that it's a little expensive for what it is. I wish it was about 2/3 of the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

muwGVRIJUJXE8Yt27wtf_g.text: I've never had a lollipop or cotton candy garnish my milkshake but at Black Tap, this is the norm. My bro and I sat at the counter that faces the casino to avoid a 15-minute wait for a table and had a great time. He ordered the cake shake, which has an entire slice of cake on top of a milkshake and people looked at his shake the entire time he had it, until he took the cake off to save it for later. My cotton candy shake (which is actually a strawberry shake with cotton candy-flavored candy as a garnish!) was delicious and eye-catching as well; the couple next to us asked what both of our shakes were called after checking them out. Everything about it was a hit for me; the shake itself, the cotton candy carefully placed around whipped cream on top of the shake, the three lollipops that I saved for later, and the pink and blue chocolate balls that were 'glued' to the glass with frosting.  I was in cotton candy bliss. I didn't try my bro's shake, but the cake slice was big enough to eat later for dessert (we went at lunch time) as well as for dessert the next day and he said it was great. He actually wasn't even going to order a shake until he saw my shake. Although they cost $17 apiece for our two flavors, they were worth it in my opinion as I've never had anything like the cold, sweet, fluffy treat in which I indulged. A return visit for burgers and cocktails are on tap for my next trip to Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cake shake!
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cotton candy shake!

EN7212N4nd5Wev4lMCQoVg.text: My ratings are based on experience and the journey getting there.   I was received by a vibrant, populous, aestheticly pleasing pop-stand. Greetings were pleasant and the music fit the deco*.   As you make your way to your seating, your eyes are greeted with gigantic mouthwatering milkshakes. The size is not the only thing that attracts you but it is the artistic design. It's as if all your favorite sugar treats were eaten by a unicorn and the unicorn threw up rainbows on the milk shake.  On deck:  The cake shake  The cookie shake  No need to describe what is in the milk shake, the name and photo speaks it all, and the taste is also the same. Wish I could speak more about taste but that is why my 5 stars are missing one. There was nothing out of the ordinary. You pay for the plentiful servings and the taste of a sugary milkshake.   The service is on par! Michelle is helpful and all smiles. Thanks for the good service.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cake shake and the cookie shake

NVU7vKgoIYJp5sLzUKQwow.text: Omg!! Baja chicken sandwich so damn good!!! Too good. I loved it. Margarita was perfect. Service excellent.  Dope hip hop 90's music playing. I was very happy!! Worth it!! Very worth it!!. I couldn't have a shake after my meal.

8c0BRc-YAWisicYgZ282nA.text: Black Tap was a very fun place to dine! I was in Las Vegas for the Gartner conference back in December. So the conference was held at the Venetian Hotel (Sands Expo to be specific)- and my coworkers and I stopped here for dinner one night. We had read the reviews-- looked solid, plus I walked by everyday... and we wanted craft beer/burgers/salads. I ended up having the turkey burger salad over kale. So yummy! What a lovely portion, the kale was so fresh & the turkey burger was delicious. Their craft beers on tap-- large variety, I had an apricot IPA (?). My boss was happy as he was loves IPAs. My coworker also had a beer. Apparently, they also make fancy looked shakes (kinda like at Serendipity) but we didn't try those. Overall, I would recommend Black Tap. I have fond memories of dining here!

EMECNHe_yb7w70sFkiYNEw.text: I've been dying to go to their NYC location. I was so excited to finally get to go to Black Tap in Vegas. Two of us split a Brooklyn Blackout Milkshake and the Truffle Cheeseburger. Those were both soooooo good. We didn't get too full because we shared. If you like chocolate- GET THE BROOKLYN BLACKOUT. Their fries were disappointing, nothing special and totally lackluster compared to the delicious burger. We were a party of 5 and got seated right away on a Monday night. The shake was so good, writing this review makes me want another shake...

DYNZsqDItQO8yFhE7IHPMg.text: Husband was surprised by how good the burgers were and I of course had the cake milkshake which was all I ever dreamed it would be, delicious!

1ppcS3yYU2MsR-P0NBICzQ.text: They napkins suck. No durability, no thickness to them. Like I definitely would not wipe my ass with it. But the food still aight

efrmJESwPJrlDlFdjltOHg.text: This place was pretty cool. All I cared about is that I left the place full. I had the mexico city burger and it was pretty tasty it was just missing a slice of avacado.it wasnt so spicy so dont be scurred. I wanted to eat another one but i knew i would of not finished it. It is a little tight spot having to squeeze thru and not to disturb other diners. The bathrooms needed more attentions. There were no seat covers and the hand soap dispenser was almost empty. I also enjoyed thier fries and onion rings tasted fresh. I want to go back back and try the other burgers out. I did take a bite out of my fiance's burger the bison and I wasn't a fan of the bison cuz I wasn't used to eating bison just not my cup of tea and I'm a buffalo slot lover. I also can't believe I was charged for 2 table spoons of blue cheese as well that got me laughing. I didn't try the shakes but next time I will.

TFrjgVyEcLB7tXUFqXGa6A.text: We looked these guys up on Yelp as we wanted a fun treat while we were walking around on the strip. The cake shake stood out to us and looked pretty crazy so we wanted to try it. Loved the cake shake that we got. Probably could come down on the price a little to make it a 5 star as it was $18! We ended up sharing so it's wasn't too bad.

Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cake shake $18

llOoEtU0RBAqFfFYfCvbhg.text: Came here solely for their out of this world crazy milkshakes. I've been seeing buzzfeed videos of their milkshakes from their New York location for a while so was stoked when they opened in Vegas.   The shakes are big, definitely 2-4 people can share one. Their most popular is the Oreo one but our server liked the sweet and salty one the most ( peanut butter based). I got the cookie shake and my friend got the cake shake. Both did not disappoint.  The actual piece of cake on the cake shake was very moist and delicious. It fell off quickly and was a little messy to eat but definitely enjoyable.   My cookie shake was also very good. It had a lot of chocolate chips which is not really my jam. I did enjoy everything else though.   The shakes were a little runny. I wish it had a thicker consistency.  Other than that the shakes were fun to snap, instagram and eat!

RPXfJiqV8XOpz7lWFQRXig.text: We stopped in on our first night in Vegas. The music was lively. Caroline, our waitress, was nicely attentitive and knowledgeable. We all got burgers: bison burger arrived juicy with a mound of fries; pizza burger arrived with the pizza sauce on the side so you could add as much or little as you like and we substituted sweet potato fries; Mexico City burger had the perfect kick, we substituted onion rings that we're massive; to finish off the meal we had the Oreo shake and it took all of us to finish this delicious concoction. A bill for 3 came to $114 including the tip. Try out this delicious and affordable restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Oreo shake. On the side is a Oreo cookie ice cream sandwich,  outside glass lined in oreos. It took 3 of us to finish it.

K4IzdyMiS2poxzaKxIB9Zw.text: When you craving something like burgers, and want something to suffice your appetite all in one. You gotta try this place out. My fiance and I have passed by this place almost every time and always try to find other burger spots to top the next.   So on one of the days when I woke up craving a burger, Black Tap came to mind. Located inside the Venetian near the casino floor and I believe opposite of restaurant row, you can find this spot cracking during peak hours. We got lucky and went during the week at a little after the lunch crowd and right before the dinner crowd.   This funky eclectic style restaurant is known for their ginormous burgers and their decorative, yet oh so mouth watering milk shakes. So of course the pricing is just like any restaurant on the strip. Burgers and salads ranged $14-$22, which come with a side of fries with the burgers. If you are hungry before the burger or burger salads, they did have Korean wings ( which we will try on our next run), to fried foods, and the basic queso and chips or guacamole and chips to share.   Everything on the menu was and looked amazingly appetizing, however I chose to get the bison burger. Never tried it and always wanted to, so this was the place to try it at. My burger had a bison patty, arugula, mozzarella, pesto mayo, shaved Parmesan, and tomatoes along with French fries. My fiance ordered the Mexico City. His had a prime patty, pepper jack cheese, peppered jalapenos, crispy onion rings, and chipotle mayo, onion rings in the burger with a side of Onion rings. Unfortunately, we did not get the milkshakes as we knew we would be too full to even enjoy it. We definitely will have to check it out on our next visit.   The food: service was on point while waiting with the water and soda refills. So the bison burger, completely different taste than a Kobe, angus, or beef burger. Definitely super tender, extremely tasty and juicy for the first bite. One of the healthiest burgers, yet filling especially for someone that eats as much as me. The pesto mayo surprisingly went well and was impressed. Their fries, they are huge and perfectly made and wish they were unlimited as they can get addicting on each bite. As for the Mexico City burger, my fiance loved it. Each bite for him sufficed in taste, spice, and surprisingly kept him full for a majority of the day. His onion rings, were ginormous as well. If you are an onion ring lover, the place to go would be here. You will not be disappointed!   Overall awesome experience to say the least. Completely bummed out as we wished we had more room to have shakes for dessert. Hopefully we wish to be back sooner than later!

b71bvpFAAfmoHZV3JyRsng.text: Black Tap is located inside the Venetian. I was drawn to this place due to the extraordinary looking shakes and the food looked much better compared to Sugar Factory.    The food portions were generous and although there isn't a kids menu,they can accommodate a simple burger or chicken strips with fries.   The decor is bright and vibrant with great music and service was awesome!    It definitely was a great dining experience especially for the kiddos. They were blown away by there shakes! They have a great selection of craft burgers and salads! I ordered the crispy chicken ceasar and it enough to share.   A Definite Must Try!

1zqxH5DN8lHSyyNHfMABlw.text: Wish I wore my stretchy pants!!!   Military discount honored here.  Awesome meal today. Everything was perfect. Glad I didn't settle on white castle.   The hostess quote 20mins. She called us in five.   We sat in a private booth, which worked great, because everyone else looked like they were on a business lunch. Outside seating available.   Service was awesome, a long with the old school hip hop. My husband sang to us the whole meal...  Our hamburger were delicious. Please see pics.   Our waitresses left a craft of water on the table, which we always love.   We ordered the cake shake and I wish we ordered 2 because it wasn't enough...sadly to say. The restaurant is located across the sports bar with extreme big screens.   Love love the desserts shakes. This is my first extreme milk shake and I always wondered if you can eat the outside rim of the glass and yes you can;)

The only drawback was the noise level and the seating is extremely cramped. If you are beside someone noisy !!!! Lol. lg0WlfC_kpDvzSuPODdgAA.text: Great place with a great ambiance and food selection.  Our family was visiting Vegas from out of state and were trying to find a family friendly restaurant with appropriately dressed women.   We were so happy with our choice. From the delicious burgers to the incredibly delicious and LARGE gourmet milk shakes, we left completely satisfied.   The cotton candy milkshake was more 'eye candy' than anything for my daughter but it was worth the experience, for sure. Share a shake. With like two or three people.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cotton Candy Milkshake.

3LGFyDB6fbVON8F9U3_Tyw.text: Likes: The outdoor space where you can overlook the Gondolas.  It was fun to be able to listen to the gondoliers sing while eating dinner. Service was fairly quick as well.  I didn't opt to get a milkshake, but loved seeing some at other people's tables. They are VERY impressive.  Cons: I was dissapointed in my veggie burger.  They advertise these really beautiful burgers, but it was pretty unimpressive. Also, as a person who really thinks any meal can be saved by knock-out fries I was also let down. Their steak fries were rather bland. Not even a ton of ketchup could save them.

mEstzZIWy8GgQ0vbv1m1nw.text: I was reading so many great reviews and at the end of the day I was kinda disappointed.   So Sunday my family and I decided we'd make a trip to the strip and check out Black Tap.  We were all excited to be hanging out!  First let's just start off and thanking the Venetian for giving everyone FREE Parking (woot woot!)   The restaurant is located on the casino floor at the Sports Book end & very easy to find.   Upon arrival the place looked alive and busy and the music was popping! A lot of old school hip hop, which I love!!    We checked in at the front counter and were surprised to get a table for 5 straight away!   The atmosphere in there is Fantastic!   The food on the other hand was average.... the crazy shakes of course are all the hype, and for $15 a piece they better be! Haaa haaa!   The crazy shakes are the main attraction and I would go back just for them!   Here's what we ordered:   The pizza burger with fries The chicken burger with fries The cheese burger with fries Sweet potato fries Cookies and cream supreme shake  Brooklyn Blackout shake  Regular shake with caramel   For 5 people and about $130 was pricey for burgers and shakes... I think I will just stick to the local burger joint down the road from my house ..

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nLMBBUiwozOk2F611TCIQw.text: Not cheap but they deliver on food quality , taste, presentation and ambience. Had the Old Fashioned Burger with mushrooms , Onions and Swiss cheese. It was  great. Upgraded to onion rings and they were fantastic-tempura style. Didn't have room for. A shake but they are spectacular. Glad I got to eat here . Highly recommended for burger and shake lovers but please note they have options for non meat eaters too. My friend got the falafel burger salad and said it was awesome.

ytmEb-0pfwLN_NUD6-gvDg.text: Our girls night out ended with dinner & dessert here, and I was impressed! We arrived before 6 and was able to get seated right away. The interior is super cute, with creative artwork and wallpapers throughout the restaurant. The milkshake bar looks like a big candy bar right in the middle of the restaurant.   Usually when I order burgers I always get a turkey burger but I decided to try truffle burger and it did not disappoint! The burger was just the right size and my favorite part about it was the two slices of Gouda cheeeeese. It made the burger so much more creamy and tasteful. They have add in options where you can add a fried egg or bacon or more cheese if you would like. I could have ate my entire burger but I wanted to save room for dessert! How can you come here and not have a milkshake! We ordered the Brooklyn blackout, this one is for all you chocolate lovers. Surprisingly it wasn't too sweet and we ended up finishing almost the entire cup. Their milkshakes are definitely made for sharing!  I will definitely come back to try a different burger & shake! We took a while to find this place in the Venetian, it's right next to the sports book in the casino.

9gmg54qYssKV944qCK-TnQ.text: Just left here the happyest most satisfied pregnant birthday girl EVER!!  Our sever JOSH was And is now my favorite human! Josh your the best and we love you! Had the choco taco shake and it was AAHMAzing!! didn't have the food but it smelled fan-frigen-tastic! We Definitely will be back to try the food and see our boy Josh before I pop!!  Keep up the amazing work!!  Meggan, Rachel and amber!

ngTasc4RCH-5_SthD6UyWQ.text: This place is obviously famous for their crazy monster shakes. While everyone is going crazy over the birthday cake shake, my friends and I decided to experiment a couple of other ones. Safe to say that everything on their menu is worth going crazy over, not just the birthday cake.  Even though you take a look at the shake bar and you see tons of stale looking glass containers filled with the candy used to dress up the shakes, the ingredients still seem to be very fresh and not at all stale. The ambiance was also very impressive. Highly recommend sitting outside if the weather permits!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VZe-jZ1uDZt2RcCI6gLzaA.text: Went here for a private event and ate the shrimp, chicken sandwich and a mini shake. All were delicious. The decor is very cute and the views from the front of Venetian are pretty at sunset. Would return for a full service meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yGoT7sXW--UJaqN9jOl1Iw.text: Ehhh, we stopped here cause we didn't really have anything else to do before our flight.   The regular oreo shake looked great, but tasted meh. I love oreo shakes and didn't drink half of this. Not enough oreos, the ice cream was weird...  The Burger (Texas?) was huge and impossible to eat but we gave it a go - we love messy burgers. It was okay, not bad not good.   The wings were pretty good, the sweet potato fries were good.  The guac we got with chips was the best thing we had, the guac was real and really good.   We were sat in a weird echo-y round thing, service was okay. Overall it was really expensive to have meh food.   I guess if you're into the giant shakes it would ok to come here for that, but as a regular visit, it was meh and I'm pretty easy to please.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. regular oreo shake!

FQMoJ5rBVpurhldRIDw85A.text: Hot diggity! This place is really awesome. They had an amazing, unique menu, including their milkshakes! I had their spicy chicken sandwich and it was really good. I would go back to Vegas just for that sandwich.   I also had their milkshake and it was definitely a one-of-a-kind experience. My party and I were seated in front of the milkshake station and we watched ours being made. It was definitely really cool to watch all of the shakes being made.   The service was awesome too! I was being a klutz and accidentally threw out my receipt. I went back and asked the manager to help me reprint, and he found my receipt in a flash and emailed it to me! It was great. Amazing food, amazing service. Will definitely be back!

O-VlINjw-r1PzGpxZDaEoQ.text: I had to try a crazy milkshake. I went with chocolate with brownie topper. It was huge, fun, and very tasty. There is cool artwork as decor giving the place a fun vibe. If you want a milkshake this is your place!

sJM0X4gPHxyVkHK391O8Dg.text: This place has great desserts. The Churro is my favorite and I highly recommend it. I will recommend that you share their milkshakes because they are really large and a bit overwhelming.   I highly recommend this place for a late night decadent dessert.

3Bk7z-4P7uEhRQRPs-M10A.text: Really solid burger spot. Got the All-American Burger with bacon and was really satisfied. It's located in the Venetian so expect strip prices. As good as it was, it was highly talked up to me by an Uber driver from NY who described it as the "best burgers". It was really good, but there are others out there I like more. Would definitely recommend to anyone seeking burger spots in Vegas

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. all-American burger w/ bacon side of onion rings

1w5ZTZOom5eBuuGiWFSL3g.text: Black tap over all was great! Couple things that could be better.  Place wasn't as clean as it could be. The water they provide tasted too much like hose water. I'm someone who always gets water at restaurants and that was probably the worst water I've had.   Also, something that may be out of their control but it was extremely noisy. The small room in the back is covered in tile and the echo is horrible. We were almost yelling to be able to hear each other, literally 2 ft across from each other.   On a good note, their burgers were great! And the ranch was exceptional, both my boyfriend and I loved it and both ordered sides of it for our fries. The milkshake tasted good but more importantly looked amazing! Definitely instagram worthy but tasted rather ordinary.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Mexico City burger
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate Chip Cookie milkshake

kjNFR-0iWs9egGow6gZ2pg.text: If you're in Vegas definitely give this place a try if you're looking for a snack in between meals and those crazy Vegas buffets.   We went around a weird time and there was still bit of a wait. 3pm  If you like pickles! Their fried pickles were pretty good. Lightly battered and surprisingly the batter was not soggy one bit from the pickle, was crispy all around. From crispy batter through to the crunch of the pickle.   This place may be known for their big milkshakes. Of course we ordered one. On the menu they list the topping that come with each shake and which base is made with it. You can actually switch out the base to a different one according to the toppings.   Sweet N' Salty with an Oreo base shake instead of the peanut butter one was a perfect combo.

WF5YmTj5ZQ4wg1xGtmpykg.text: This place was a fun hangout atmosphere. Definitely more of a street style pub with a yummy twist of crazy milkshakes. We topped the meal off with the Colorful Cake Shake and it exceeded our expectations! A heafty piece of confetti cake with real cake batter mixed into the shake was like the cherry on top. We'd most definitely visit again and most definitely recommend to anyone! Our only set back was the price. We're willing to pay for good food, but I have a hard time paying over $15 for a burger and fries and here you burgers start at $16-$20. Not terribly priced but not quite what I was hoping for. We also split the shake because it too was a little spendy($15). I'd probably suggest splicing the shakes anyways since they are very large and full of yummy toppings!

58JiDahVxsnP6woVRWHmPg.text: Like many others, it was the photos of Black Tap's crazy shakes on social media that piqued my interest. When a friend and her daughter came to town on vacation, we decided to have dinner here on a Wednesday evening.   There was no wait, and we were seated in a comfy booth by the shake makin station which was pretty cool. I definitely dig the overall vibe at Black Tap... casual yet somewhat upscale feeling at the same time, servers wear t-shirts with lyrics from classic hip hop songs, the music played was all over the place but all good jams.   Our server was awesome, I wish I could remember his name. He arrived quickly after we were seated to drop off a carafe of water and answer any questions we had. When we ordered our food he made sure to ask if we wanted our shakes with our meal or afterward and put the order in with the kitchen accordingly.   We decided to start out with some fried pickles which were super tasty. My dining partner and I shared the Old Fashioned burger. It was alright, very juicy but nothing overly special in my opinion. The star of the show was absolutely the Fruity Pebble milkshake. With a strawberry pop tart, fruity pebble treat, candy and TONS of delicious cereal this shake was everything that I had hoped for.   Total damage for an app, 2 burgers, 2 crazy shakes and 1 normal shake with tax and tip was just over $100 which isn't too ridiculous for the Strip. I'd return for the shakes but not for the burgers.    Yelp Reviews 2018 22/100

DJF1ItoBCNgTWfpU0el4aw.text: Please tell me why it took me a good while to find this restaurant?  When I finally did, my sister and I were seated right by the entrance. I assume it was just incredibly busy.   We ordered the Cookies n Cream Supreme, the Crispy Chicken Sandwich and the Falafel Burger.  The only problem I had was that the crazy shake came out before the food, so I was almost full by the time I got my burger.  I was taken aback because I assumed the shake would be pretty sweet. Hmm... it was like a thick, creamy vanilla milkshake with chunks of Oreos at the bottom. The glass rim is dipped in chunks of Oreos and a round ice cream sandwich lay on top of the whip cream decoration which was not very sweet either.  The portions are huge! The side of fries can fill you up already before you even take a bite out of your burger. The chicken sandwich seemed like a good old chicken sandwich. There was nothing korean about it. Nonetheless, my sister said it was incredibly delicious. Now, the falafel burger was quite unique. The sauce that came along with it made the burger tangy and sort of bitter. Overall, I'm glad we checked this place out. The servers were all around nice and fast. Our food came out pretty quick, and I think I'll come back for another crazy shake.

qpjD2lCTPKzrVsph3dRiRQ.text: I had to check this place out simply based on the photos of the most epic milkshakes I've ever seen. We were seated promptly. The decor is kitschy, and not really to my taste, but that wasn't going to deter me from my mission.   They have quite a selection of craft beers on draft and bottle.  Most of the food items on the menu are burgers, but they have burger salads and some chicken options as well. I understand that it's Vegas and things tend to be pricey here, but most of the burgers were in the upper teens to low 20s range, and the cost for six chicken wings was $14. Six!  When the food came out, it was made to custom specifications as ordered. My husband got the chili burger with no cheese, and I got the Wagyu burger salad and chicken wings. The wings tasted fresh, and the sauce tasted like a spicy teriyaki sauce mixed with BBQ sauce. Still, I don't think it was $14 worth! My husband said that his chili burger was good, no complaints. My Wagyu burger salad was essentially a good-sized burger patty on top of a huge amount of arugula, with some tomatoes, cheese, and pine nuts, but the dressing was super salty.  Finally, the time came for milkshakes. My husband ordered the Cake Batter Shake, while I got the Cotton Candy Shake. They were just as epic as the pictures make it look. You know it's good when people at the neighboring tables lean over to take pictures of your food! The milkshakes were thick and tasty, topped with a generous amount of real whipped cream. The glass itself was coated in frosting and had candies stuck to the outside of it. In my husband's case, the garnish was an entire slice of Funfetti layer cake! My garnishes were an entire lollipop, two sticks of rock sugar, and puffs of cotton candy. The cost of these two milkshake masterpieces? $17 apiece! Yikes.  To summarize, this restaurant is a burger and shake place at heart, that seems to have realized that making the food look amazing draws new customers in, who are willing to fork over an unreasonable amount of money for a milkshake. We experienced very good service while we were there, and the food was decent. Minus one star for salty food, being way overpriced, and weird decor/ambience.

We finally decided on the SweetNSalty Peanut Butter flavor. Very rich and very good. They have a lot of other flavors that I hope to get back to and try. Nki-rjsHeZHDyFt9U2IjPA.text: Fun vibes with crazy looking shakes. We came here for those two reasons.   Waited about 30 mins to be sat which is understandable because this place is new, popular and on the strip.   Unfortunately we were super unlucky the evening we came because they sat us at a bar top overlooking the casino. There are two reasons they should entirely get rid of this area: you are faced away from the restaurant so it feels like you're not even there to begin with and secondly it's open to the casino and people walking by smoking cigarettes. As a non smoker it's extra disgusting smelling smoke as you're eating.   We asked to be moved and the ladies at the front told us we would have to wait back in line again. Seriously? Luckily another girl came by and told us two seats at the bar opened and we could have them. This helped because we could actually see the place and weren't smelling smoke from the casino any longer.   So we ordered a truffle burger, onion rings and sweet potato fries. Both sides were delicious. As for the burger we specifically said we would like it medium and the waiter said that's what the chef recommended. Unfortunately we received a rare burger that was entirely bright pink in the center. Our waiter looked at it and said he'd be back with it cooked the right way. As another 20 mins passed we had already eaten our sides. Can't say that wasn't annoying. So when the second burger came back it was charred. I wanted to cry.   So we ended up getting a shake because we were still hungry. The playful & huge shake was great.   If you sit inside the restaurant you'll probably have a much better experience and I guess we just got unlucky twice with the overpriced, inedible burger. Keep in mind the burgers here average about $18.

We got the American burgers those were amazing! The French fries were some of the best I've ever had! & the Oreo shake to die for!!   We had our daughter with us, which from the first view of the place you might assume it's a bar but to the left side there are tables and it's kid friendly.  We will definitely stop here again!

JjiBEGcvtPABA5FErOtFQA.text: Cookies N Cream Supreme $15: It looks huge because of the mound of whipped cream with the ice cream sandwich tucked in, but the milkshake part itself didn't seem much bigger than normal. It was more on the thick side so it was hard to drink through the straw. It's fun to get for the pictures, but other than the aesthetics I didn't find it to be memorable.   Greg Norman $20: I'm a sucker for burgers with blue cheese so choosing this one was a no brainer. The house buttermilk dill sauce came on the side so it could be added as desired. It was a good burger, but I don't think worth this price tag. The fries were just ok for me, as I do prefer more thinly cut fries.   Truffle Burger $22: I liked the truffle mayo more than the house buttermilk dill. I'm not that into Gouda on burgers though.   I also asked for sides of special sauce, truffle mayo, and creamy horseradish. The latter 2 were good. I'm not sure what's in the special sauce, but it didn't really taste special.

The bun was perfect and not to large and the wagyu beef was cooked perfectly. The fries were hot and perfectly cooked and their buttermilk dill sauce is amazing on the fries!   We decided to share one of the famous CrazyShakes and opted for the cookie shake which was amazing! It was the perfect amount of desert for the three of us unless you are a huge eater!   They also have a great selection of beers on tap and in the can. I had the nitro milk stout which was amazing.   I would also like to mention that our server did a great job. He was friendly and made great recommendations. Everything arrived super fast and the wait was only about 20 mins to get a table. My only complaint was that it was a bit loud in there but it wasn't a deal breaker.

zlr3lRU_2XXY-RFrvORPSg.text: Local to Vegas, came out to the strip which I usually avoid. I have been waiting to try this place for a long time!!! We figured on a Wednesday it wouldn't be crowded. We drive and park find it randomly in a crowded ally way in the Venetian, and it turns out the place is closed for a private event. Nothing was posted on their social media or online about it. KzxrBGd6kYnfiiZZBnkD1w.text: we were so excited to go to this place and it is WAY over priced! More then half the shake is just whipping cream and half the stuff you can't eat because it is stuck to the side of the cup for the "wow" affect. Plus $15-$17 a shake is a little much! They also brought it out before we got our burger. Duh! It was quite awhile before we got our burger too!  The service was really poor. We wanted our egg for one of the burgers cooked a certain way and they said "no, we only cook it one way" what! Then they said that about burgers too. You either get medium or well done. For a $20 burger - cook it the way I want it!!   I got the Mexican burger and it was good. I have to give them that. Great spicy flavor. The pickle was awful.   If you want different sauces it is $1 a sauce. We got 3 shakes and 2 burgers and our tab came to $107.00 for a family of four. We will NOT go back. But fun to try the "over the top shakes" once right?

FCkiaE_NeXDeOXMcCAyv7Q.text: We did not eat the food here but we did go for the shakes. We had the cake shake and it was great. There was a full piece of confetti cake on top of the shake. It was $17 but was well worth the price and was enough for two people. The service was quick and we only had to wait a few minutes for a table. There was a private event though, so the bathrooms were closed in the restaurant which was weird.

-mZvTd919tzozhQNaESCew.text: I've been trying to get to a Black Tap for a while now. This visit was no disappointment... I was just too full to enjoy a milkshake! I think those require their own visit. We split the Greg Norman and it  was  delicious

Mx9KAjc7pxJ4PvYsRmDnow.text: Gotta give it up to Black Tap for their legendary shakes. If you want diabetes in a cup, this is the place to be. I had the cake shake, which was epic. The cake was delicious, and IMHO, it's two desserts in a cup. The oreo cookie shake was also amazing.   The food-- fries are not bad with their sauces available. Burgers were about a 3/5 stars for me.   Service is not bad, and it's a trendy spot to bring some visitors for a "Las Vegas" experience.

fu_u7Zvs-ABO5t_nPDI0ag.text: Decent burgers. Super friendly staff. Fresh toppings.  A new burger joint recently opened up on the main level of the venetian casino. And it gets very busy bc of this. The menu has a little bit of everything and im sure picky eaters could find something they like. They dont offer much variety for their sides and this disappointed me.   The bartender highly recommended the broccoli as a side saying it was sooo good. It made my mouth water by his descriptions. Unfortunatly it is nothing worth writing about as its just charred brocolli with some teriyaki sauce. Nothing special or outstanding bout it and frankly it did not pair well at all with the burger. It just kinda was one of the worst suggestions ever and i love brocolli. I hardly finished half.   The burgers were decent. Fresh toppings and very filling. But hardly anything special than a typical burger joint. Our food came relatively quickly so that was a bonus. Although initially our order was given to other people first, but luckily thy never touched it before giving it to us. This error cost them 2 stars. Never ever should my meal be served to someone else than moved to me afterwards. And on top of it. We were not even given an apology or anything. Instead our meals were slided across the bar to us by the bartender as if nothing hapoened. Total utter complete fail.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom burger @black tap
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle burger with broccoli @black tap
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Burgers for 2 @black tap

wY2VnIVCuVCoarzC9wGSUw.text: The rudest bartender we have ever met. She was too busy pouring some kind of drinks she had stashed behind the bar into shot glasses for her co-workers to bother with paying customers. My husband and I, another solo woman, and two men were all seated at the bar waiting for her to attend to us. Rude, clearly annoyed by us, and blatantly ignored for a full 5-6 minutes. Thus, because of her and the previous lackadaisical service, we will never be back to what was one of our favorite little spots.   When you can't acknowledge customers at the bar you're working behind, and are visibly annoyed we interrupted your vent session with coworkers, it says a lot about your staff. All of us sitting there got to hear all about how annoyed they all were by "stupid customers" in your restaurant. I'm assuming because darn it, we all wanted to order food/drinks/shakes and give you our money. And I'm guessing the collective lot of us were being so difficult by trying to get your attention multiple times since none of us were being acknowledged while 4 of your staff were having their circle of shit talking instead of working.   The hostess was the nicest person there and that poor girl was working her tail off dealing with the long line of people waiting to get in and getting everyone sat, she was great. The rest of your staff can learn a lot from her. The wait could have been a lot shorter if the attention inside the restaurant were more efficient.   This is the 2nd time we've had really bad service here. I'm a full believer everyone gets a second chance or has a bad day, however, this seems to be the norm for this place.  Edit to add: the two young men working the counter where the shakes were made were also working very hard and efficient. One of them had to repeatedly ask a server to get the shakes as they were dripping from melting from sitting so long. He was visibly annoyed/frustrated and I don't blame him. My husband even jokes with him that he would walk the shakes to the table for him. It seems the issue this and every other time we've been have been the servers/bar staff.   Craving ice cream? Skip this place and try the Godiva soft serve in the Palazzo.

FDO6Q0UoLcS69Dn4LMsdPA.text: I was amazed by their "Crazy Shakes"! The shake was tons of fun and delicious. I was dining alone, so I sat at the counter facing the casino, multiple people stopped to take a photo of the shake. I also ordered a burger, The Texan, it was scrumptious, cooked to order and top quality! To top it all off, I had an AMAZING, waitress named Ashley. She was attentive and we had a great conversation during my dining experience. I can't wait to come back, with family and friends, later this year!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Texan Burger
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The funfetti cake Crazy Shake

i29X_t22_V7iTMObjhpk_Q.text: 1-12-19 After seeing the crazy shakes on a Facebook advertisement I've wanted to come here! I was expecting a high class restaurant (not sure why). But it's more of a hang out with your friends kind of place. Comfortable. When we arrived the waitresses were kind of all over the place and couldn't tell us how to just order a shake. Finally we just asked for a table and figured it out ourselves. The tables are very close together. So get ready to meet your new neighbor. Not a problem for me because I'm a talker. We shared a cake shake and it was more than enough for 2 people. You can actually go up to the shake bar and watch them make your shake. There are sprinkles everywhere. LoL! The milkshake was awesome. Made with cake batter ice cream. Yum! The cake was awesome. Presented with whip cream and an overload of sprinkles. I challenge you to eat this and not spill sprinkles everywhere. :) This was a one time thing for me. Little on the pricey side. Expect to pay $15-17 for a milkshake. The cake shakes are limited each day. If you're looking for something different I definitely recommend this place and their shakes! If nothing else it makes for a fun Facebook profile photo!

The burgers are really good.  In my second visit I meant to "save room" for one of their "crazy" shakes but it was impossible - I ate the whole burger, left and will try to come back a third time just for their Birthday Cake shake, which I'm dreaming about it after I saw it being made.  Super recommend!

m5xNl6qktYYLtHuyZpWLCQ.text: Best place for tasty milk shakes that have the beat decorations ever! We ordered the cotton candy milk shake and split it. It came with cotton candy, a crystal sugar sucker, a big low or later and lots of sprinkles plastered to the outside of the glass which was covered in buttercream frosting and rolled on the sprinkles for fun.

Usj8Pps2cQqJoDZunWhOMQ.text: I had been wanting to try this place after seeing their insane milkshake creations on Instagram. I went with a friend and when we walked up we were seated immediately. The hostess was very nice and put us in a cute booth. The milkshake menu had a lot of choices but we ended up with the cotton candy shake and ordered some fries to go with it. We chose the Korean BBQ sauce with the fries. It was ok but not great to dip fries in, we should have stuck with ranch. The milkshake came out very quickly. We were also seated next to where they make them and it was fun to watch. It tasted great and was relatively large so we were glad to share it. I will return to try the other flavors for sure!
