ropegxmY-B4yEzuxuAeAGg.text: I haven't ate here, but was so excited to as I heard really great things about the service, food and environment. I called to see if they had a kids menu, the girl who answered rudely said "anything that doesn't have alcohol" and hung up on me. I'm sorry but that's not a good way to represent the restaurant you work for. She had attitude and was very rude. I will not be visiting this restaurant. The management needs to teach manners and customer service to who ever answers the phone.

xVgIdtrEOzpATgMy2Gcz-A.text: Ambiance - 4 stars  Service -3 stars  Food - 2.7-3ish   We were a large party of 12 first told we couldn't sit together . Only to come outside and see a larger party of 18 all together. Our server wasn't nice or rude . For this place to have so much advertising online you would expect alittle more personality or something . But any way after being seated we had Luke warm tap water in a small mason jar with no ice ..  I ordered a Strawberry lemonade that was sent back because it was so watery and flavorless .  Brussel Sprouts for an appetizer which were great . My chicken Sandwich was great . The birthday girl Wanted the cake milkshake but they ran out of cake . So we just called for checks . Instead of our server telling us in the beginning checks could not be split he waited until we asked after dinner had been completed . So the manager comes Out WITH ATTITUDE and allows us to have a 4 way split .  I wouldn't recommend this place to a burger lover because the food isn't worth the money and the venue has more personality than the staff

wj4O7ch0JklMZDJAU0WY8Q.text: My mother and I were the first ones in line waiting for this to open at 5pm. We had been stalking Instagram since it was first announced that there would be a location at the Venetian. It certainly lived up to the hype. Best salad I've ever had with such balanced flavors. It was a turkey burger with cranberries, avocado, green apple, bleu cheese, and kale. The staff was so friendly and the shake (Aka: The main event) did not disappoint. The Cookies and Creme Supreme was fabulous and was just like drinking an Oreo but better. We feel so honored to have been part of the opening night and to have been treated so well. Great atmosphere, awesome song selection. Super cool patio I would have eaten on if it wasn't winter.

D3xeYkQFyK4Hbg4cOAD8Iw.text: Amazing service at the bar! Been to the one in NYC and this is just as great! I THINK this was opening weekend? Not sure but it seemed like it! Multiple bartenders came over to see if we were all set multiple times during our meal and dessert. It was nice to actually be served at a bar and not wait! Our meal was served super fast and our shakes were amazing! They have a "wow factor" look but just as importantly they actually taste good too. Shout out to the amazing service and food. Had to knock off a star because my friend asked for a beer on their menu that they said they didn't have, then asked for another on the menu which they also didn't have, then asked for a coffee milkshake, also on the menu, also not available. Kind of weird but again, great food and great service :)

EepHbdVJA3Jchld4MU8gFw.text: I had the old fashion burger, others in our party has the Texan burger and the chili burger. All three were very good. Sweet potatoe frys were very tasty. W-M2VyIqO9AZ45EuiPWeWw.text: Atmosphere:  music was bangin the whole hour we was there.  We knew all the songs playing.  Booth for four people was great space.  Food:  chicken wings was decent,, just right if your not to full and don't want a big meal and want to save space for the MONSTER SIZE MILKSHAKES!!!  THE SALAD BURGER and sweet potatoes fries F- ing AMAZING!!! Definitely a must try!  Milkshake:  Had the Oreo Milkshake and Cotton Candy Milkshake!!! d7dyDIzWQT4UgtpdlQuyVg.text: So worth the money to have this cool experience! The inside is beautiful, I love the decor. The menu has anything from burgers to shakes to appetizers. My favorite appetizer had to be the onion rings and the queso & chips!  Of course I came here mainly to check out the dessert bar. I got the Brooklyn black out because I love chocolate and my friend got the cotton candy shake. Talk about YUM! The service was good, our drinks were never empty and our food came quickly. we will be back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

SqC0a0xteO9HxszC0XbQRA.text: Black Tap was a cool experience. My friends and I were seated outside of the main restaurant and I'm so glad they asked us to sit out there. One, the view was spectacular. Two, we were strip-side where we got to see the Mirage volcano erupt a couple of times and see the romantic gondola boats in the front of the Venetian. And three, we didn't have to wait in the massive line to get in the restaurant. Not only was the view amazing, but the food was great. My wife and I shared a Texan Burger & fries and the Cake Batter Cake shake. And my friends ordered fried pickles, the All American burger and the Brooklyn Blackout shake. The food and drinks were a lil pricey, but the restaurant is on the strip.

pbgjPq_f2EVD6Hk2fvrusw.text: My husband wanted to go here for his birthday dinner simply for the amazing shake. He had a cereal and a slice of mint chip ice cream cake from Cold Stone for breakfast but wanted more of an indulgent dinner. We sat outside at 6pm and although at 100 degrees in late June but the patio was shaded enough that it was nice.  Luckily it is Restaurant Week here in Vegas! Depending on the establishment it can be for a week to a month where prix fix meals are heavily discounted and a portion of the bill goes to 3 Square. He asked for the 3 course meal- selection of 2 appetizers, 3 mains and any basic shake for $30, $5 of which goes to the charity. This does not sound like much but usually all that come to $50. I cannot eat beef so I passed.   We shared the fried pickles. Usually not a fan but delicious! He asked if he could upgrade giving the extra cost. He added an egg to the All American burger for $1 and upgraded to a gourmet shake from a basic for $6. Still, an awesome deal!   I asked for an Old Fashioned with a turkey burger sub and a Greek salad instead of fries (a $2 upgrade). The only bad thing is that instead of the salad they gave me fries. Within 3 minutes the salad was given. Hey, free fries! Mistakes happens and it was quickly remedied.   I was way too full to eat half the meal so I skipped on the shake to taste a little of his. He ordered the Brooklyn Blackout, holy smokes it was monstrous! I ate a little to taste and it was delicious! He could barely finish it.   So, prices are high but you get the bang for the buck with size portions and quality. I did slip that it was his birthday, no awkward singing but no comps. Still, I feel we were given more than the price. Plus, as we were outside so the view was really nice, of the gondolas and LV BLVD.   If you want to go to try it out, now it the time. A 3 course dinner is heavily discounted and goes to a good cause. Any other time, just was worth it.

8Y2hRMvvPH0ZBN5P__3D9A.text: Came here for my brothers birthday. The place is nice. We ordered two appetizers, the mozzarella triangles were great but the Brussels were not so good I didn't eat them at all. My brother ordered the Texas burger he loved it but he got onion rings with it wich he did not order. So he ended up with no fries. I ordered the Californian Burger wich is the turkey burger I personally did not like the meat at all it had a very strong taste and I just ate part of it took the rest home. We ordered a shake it was the greatest thing ever. My serves was nice but he didn't introduce himself at all. Our bill was $101 for two people.  If I come back it would be for the shakes only not to eat

0_HY7itI91rrF-lUK6E2Pg.text: Awesome Food! Classic Burger, Fries, Fried Pickles , Onion Rings so delicious! Can't forget about the milkshake The Cookie Shake so yummy must have! Kinda upset that I wasn't able to sit at the patio but food made up for it lol...

Pe1KebNovumBGOtCx0FhOQ.text: Had to make this a stop on my last visit to Vegas! Fun environment, good service, good food. Come hungry! My daughter had the Pizza burger, I had the Vegan burger, and we each ordered a shake. Yes, it was too much food...but we knew what we were walking into. The shakes are too fun. I would definitely love to see mini versions as an option though. I would definitely return to try other items on the menu.

nhwvqVsAowQidCcigFZyhw.text: I'd really like to give 31/2 but obv I can't on yelp so I'll be generous and go 4. Firstly, I didn't like the layout of the restaurant. We were right at the back and  it totally lacked atmosphere. Our waiter was friendly and extremely good at upselling. "You only want 1 fried pickle for the table? you really need 2" "only 1 shake to share? You could really use 2".  As we were jet lagged we agreed to it all. Kudos to him though.  He was right. The fried pickles were fantastic. The shakes were ok. More style over substance but still nice. Do they do free refills on sodas in here? Not sure. We didn't get any. The burgers were good.  Mine was severely underdone though. Positively rare. I was too tired to complain.  Everyone else's were medium. The burger salad options could use tweaking. I'd present them in wider bowls and toss the ingredients better.  Anyway, it was a nice meal but now I've experienced the hype I can cross it off my list as done.

h81sGxtXjYgsDB_0mHsFTA.text: This is a must stop if you are in the area! We had about a 15-20 minute wait which wasn't too bad, you get to people watch in the casino so it makes time go by fast. Dorothy was a great server, very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. We got the fried mozz. app and it was amazing! The sauce that comes with it, you could tell was home made and really made the dish. My mom got the falafel burger and I got the falafel salad and both were delicious. Prepare to come here hungry because portion sizes huge! I wish we could have taken our food to go but it wouldn't have held until we got to our hotel. Everything was fresh and crispy and you could tell they care about each dish. I'd go back here in a heartbeat and recommend it to anyone who is near by! I also of course had to get the cookie shake and don't regret that decision at all - YUM!!

vXN6xsyyu_x_BdfsWdVTTg.text: This place is ok. The burgers are not something I would come back for, the truffle burger was pretty good though but other than that there wasn't anything special about this place, onion rings were bland as well. I guess it's one of those restaurants that has a nice environment for a casual hangout with friends and take nice instagram photos of their shakes. I would recommend this place to go at least once but honestly liked Holstein's at Cosmopolitan better which is very similar to this place.

_Xvs6Rfbrl4nydUwaQVd-A.text: We were in NYC a few months ago and the service was WAY better. I mean we came in at 11:15pm on Thursday ( they close at 12) but it did not feel like the service we got in New York, seemed like we were a bother because we came close to closing. It's kinda sad because we were really looking forward to a great experience since we are staying at the Venetian and it's expensive and our experience in New York was amazing. The girl was okay not super friendly but okay. If you are opening a restaurant from a different city maybe make sure everyone you hire is extra awesome to make your restaurant a great impression.

vVPM54zNYrLe2XdGxa2d9g.text: This place was amazing! An ad popped up on my Facebook while in Vegas, birthday cake milkshake, I walk anywhere for that. It literally has a piece of cake on top of the cup. It was the best milkshake I think I've ever had. So good, we also got the fruity pebble shake as well. I highly recommend if you're in Vegas within distance of the black tap it is a must. I sent three friends there and they all loved it as well. 15/10 on taste. Worth the price. I think one was $17 and one was $15.

TTmXi6bSrQ6bCsRhoXHcRA.text: I've been to black tap while in NYC over the summer so I was so excited when my husband text me saying he saw an ad on the back of a cab when we were in Vegas. He text saying I think there's a black tap here. I was so excited. It's in the Venetian. It's hip and cool and we loved it. We (myself, husband and daughter) all got the same sundaes we had when we were in NYC. I had the peanut butter, my daughter the cotton candy and my husband the cookies and cream. It's the novelty of getting this visually amazing sundae brought to you but it taste equally amazing. My husband has eaten food from here a couple times but I haven't yet. He said the food was good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DQf5EGVnFTis4sqAX97jMg.text: Brand new spot way in the back of the Venetian. As for food, I would probably go 3.5 stars, but service was great and friendly, great beer list, and the vibe of the place is pretty cool.   Black Tap is known for its burgers, crazy shakes, and 90s hip hop environment. We cannot comment on the crazy shakes, though they look amazing! We shared some fried pickles, which were good, but the oil they fried them in could have been hotter. Enjoyed a side of queso, which was also good. Eat it before it gets cold!!   We also shared the Chili Cheeseburger, which was decent. Aimee, our great bartender/server, told us that their 'medium' doneness is a bit under medium, which is fine for us but it's really good that they tell people that. A friend of ours who works at another spot says he thinks they over grind their meat, making the burger a bit mushy. I totally see what he's saying. Maybe it's opening kinks the need to work on, maybe not.   I'd definitely stop in again and sit at the bar. Check it out!

RC8thSWNS1B-y4AvWZOifg.text: Okay first my family and I are visiting Vegas and don't come often so we relied on yelp. Black tap was amazing. Specifically, the food and flavors were well put together. Great options and remarkable customer service from Daniel. Daniel's energy made the night (attentive, genuine about menu, great recommendations, and very relatable). I hope you not only go for a great atmosphere and great food, but to experience quality customer service from Daniel!

GFTD-g8gtQIQlc050A0yAw.text: The milkshake was massive, and the drinks are excellent.  The service was very good as well.  Not economical, but not expected to be.

YNQqdEcvbyg_b1cO1oOriA.text: My oh my where to start?!? This place is amazing! I was skeptical due to all the hype, I thought it might be one of those overpriced burger joints with a popular name and fancy shakes that weren't that great...I couldn't have been more wrong!   We arrived at 5:30pm on a Wednesday and they were already fairly busy. We were seated in about 10 minutes and our waitress Bailey promptly arrived to take our order. Bailey was so friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive; she was fantastic! While waiting for our order we were lucky enough to be able to see all the crazy shakes being made, and holy smokes those things are massive and look delicious! They were expertly crafted and each one looked beautifully enticing in its own sinfully sweet way. The food going by all looked great as well. It didn't take long before our food arrived, and it was all perfection. We got the crispy brussel sprouts with tahini (I'm not a tahini fan, but this was good), a burger salad, and two American burgers (one with an egg) with fries. The sprouts were to die for; they melted in your mouth. The burgers and burger salad were cooked just right and were incredibly juicy (We eat burgers all the time and this is in our top 5 for sure) The fries were good and plentiful, and the sauces (chipotle mayo and buttermilk dill) complimented them well. After enjoying each dish it made us want to try the entire menu!   My only knocks on black tap is that it is very loud and not necessarily a good place to chat, the bathrooms are unisex (which can be gross for a lady such as myself who walks in to a toilet seat left up), and the napkins are flimsy paper that require you to use 10 or more with your burger. Those are all easily overlooked since the overall experience is pretty grand. The staff is efficient and friendly, environment fun, food stupendous, and prices somewhat reasonably for Vegas. Next time I go I might have to try one of those crazy shakes. I definitely recommend black tap!

vJfZfLo7WfQBcI44Ir6LFQ.text: Flavorful but slightly overcooked burger. Unimpressive meat. Not exactly sure why there's an hour long line in the NYC locations, but happy I went here in Vegas and just sat up at the bar. Would have been more upset if I actually waited a long time to eat that.

SO1DEO5vMNITto71f3qpiQ.text: Uhh yeah stayed at the Venetian and found ourselves here multiple times. First day for a really really good chicken sandwich (long debate cause the burgers looked money and were with my friends). It was crispy cheesy and came out fresh and hot.   Got a cesar salad instead of the fries which was also very fresh and very good. Nice crunch factor just like the sandwich. And covered in delicious delicious croutons..  Later was with friends playing craps and blackjack best the spot and pit stopped for a drink and ended up also getting the regular Oreo cookie shake which was also on point, at that point where you kind of lose track of time, space, etc.  Will be back!

LxUvPKLJPMsRJDRYtcKwEA.text: Came here on a Monday night around 8pm and was seated right away in the front of the restaurant by the bar and milkshake bar.  I wasn't crazy about how close the tables were to each other and how the booth to my left had a seat facing our table, but at least we were seated immediately.  During our meal, great old-school hip hop was playing in the background, so that was another plus.  And something to note, a jar with utensils are on each table as well as thin napkins in a holder, which were hard to pull out.  I had to come here and get one of their Crazy Shakes, and it was recommended by our server to order it and have it served before the meal so as not to get too full for it.  I got the Cake Shake which was very good.  We put the the cake that was on top of the shake on a plate and ate it separately.  It was moist, very sweet, and pretty tasty.  The shake was tasty as well, and very thick when it was first brought out which is just how I like it.  It is definitely something that can be shared with another person portion-wise.  To eat I got the All-American burger with bacon added to it, and it came with the veggies and top bun on the side of the plate.  It wasn't the best burger I've had, but still pretty good, though I feel like bacon makes everything taste better :p  I substituted the fries for onion rings which were heavier on onion than on the batter, when I actually prefer it the other way around.  Definitely a place worth checking out if for the milkshakes alone :p  Not only Instagram-worthy but yummy as well!

ipMCAXNn4c_7QrcVwB6Dlw.text: Black Tap straight from NYC is now open inside the Venetian hotel.  Think of fun 80s hip hop joint that dishes out massive yet unique burgers, fries and overloaded milkshakes! Makes me feel like a kid again. They do have vegetarian and vegan options on the menu. Bring a friend or two, and spare time to relax after the food coma.

rmjgjt1x6JlP19rKCLAx_A.text: The food and shakes are great here. Make sure to try one of the crazy shakes, it's worth it. We had a group of 9 people with a few small kids. Our server Kendra was excellent, she was accommodating and friendly and even  invited the kids to come watch how the shakes were made. She then gave them some lollipops, and they loved it. Thanks Kendra!

JNVprSkQjHfOwJMKfZWkNA.text: I don't know where to begin! I came in with a group of girlfriends for a birthday celebration after hearing all the buzz about this new place! We ordered a bunch of appetizers to share including mozzarella sticks, arugula salad, chicken wings, chips and guac, and fried pickles! I can't say which one was my favorite because they were all so delicious.  They have a wide selection of burgers but my friend and I decided to share the truffle burger since we were so full from the apps. The burger was delectable, juicy, amazing. I only had a few bites since I was saving room for dessert.  And of course, you save the best for last: the shakes. Best shake I've ever had in my LIFE. I have a thing for anything Oreo so of course I had to go with the Cookies N Cream Supreme and it was everything I had hoped for. I was already so full from the apps and burger but I couldn't stop slurping down my shake. My girlfriends ordered the other shakes and they looked just as amazing as in the photos.  The staff was great and very welcoming. They were very attentive and always checked up on us to make sure we were doing okay. Most notably though were Mikey and Jonny. It was busy but they took the time to take care of us and made sure we were happy. Thank you Black Tap for the amazing food and hospitality, we'll definitely be back!

dtuEezKNF4GJWBtwbjLB2w.text: This review is for 4.5 stars.  Pretty damn good burger.  Milkshakes are photo worthy and sides and appetizers are tasty.  Though the burgers are steep at $16-22 depending on the meat and toppings, they came with a healthy portion of fries or a different side for an extra $2.  I had the Greg Norman - a wagyu patty with blue cheese, pickle, tomato, with added egg and onion and broccoli premium side.  The burger was huge and filling.  Meat definitely did taste better than a typical patty and fried egg had that perfect pop.  The broccoli was a nice side with a Chinese twist, better than your typical fries.  As a table we tried a bunch of sides and sauces and the sweet potato fries stood out as did the aioli sauce, with the Korean sauce a close second.  The milkshakes are as good and unhealthy as advertised.  They're big enough (and expensive enough) for a meal on its own but you're in Vegas so it's worth it.  Black Tap sits on a patio on one side overlooking the canal and strip and the sports book on the other.  Really prime location in the Casino and quick service.  Wine is super expensive and they were actually out of Chardonnay when we ate at about 6pm on a Monday (really?). The beer is fine but nothing spectacular; though at $9, an IPA is actually quite a good deal for the strip.  Black Tap is one of the better burgers on the strip and you could do much worse to get sustenance and drinks.

DPfliOMZVgrVg9XQq9MHWg.text: It was OK not the greatest burger I've ever had but about average for the strip. The milkshakes were OK not the greatest again but OK for the strip.

qrQrd_MDb0ChvZELHox5Kw.text: Ate there last night, had chicken wings and nachos.... music was a bit loud, but ok.  Food was very good, my wife was happy, all is well.

pMeuPRC0vb9NKrb6vX5ZfQ.text: On our 1st visit, what I noticed 1st was SUPERB service. The staff was patient & attentive to our every need!  The food (Norman burger & fries) were served hot & were DELICIOUS.  Simply put, the shakes are #TODIEFOR!!! The manager, John,  came to our table & introduced himself , inquired about our visit, & even wished our daughter a happy birthday . Several staff, including the manager, thanked us for coming! I knew that the place was busy so i expected the great food that i had-but I was shocked to recieve IMPECCABLE SERVICE on a friday night in Vegas. Thanks BLACKTAP ! Even my 17 year old (who is impressed by no one and nothing) was IMPRESSED & asked to go back!!  #GoodVibes

AoLwjJkRJoy8bigdy6jRrA.text: Finally satisfied a long awaited bookmark that I had to visit in Vegas and it did not disappoint.  This solid casual restaurant to fulfill your unhealthiest cravings. Though their specialty are burgers, their claim to fame are their crazy shakes which are amazingly good.   They're located in casino level of Venetion Hotel, adjacent to poker area. We got there late around 10 pm and the place was still bustling. Thankfully, they were able to accommodate a party of 5 and we were seated at the booth with no wait. Modern decor and whimsical wall art compliments the space well. There's a sports bar on right with TVs and shake bar in the back, which is where all the magic happens.  We tried three burgers, All American, The Texan and truffle burgers. With exception to truffle burger which was delicious, the others were  pretty standard and okay in my opinion. The burgers are served with fries, but you can substitute sweet potato fries, onions rings or house salad for extra $2. We all got the sweet potato fries which are really tasty.  The shake choices are creative and decadent, with all the toppings you could dream of to put you in a diabetic coma! Not only are they sweet and scrumptious, but they are huge. We shared the oreo cookies n cream and cotton candy milk shake. I don't really drink milkshakes too often but their milkshake I would drink over and over again. Both are so good! I actually enjoyed the cotton candy milkshake more than oreo. The base is strawberry ice cream which pairs nicely with cotton candy. The decorative tiny candy balls on rim of the glass was yummy and I couldn't stop picking at it. The shakes themselves aren't cheap $15-$17, but worth every caloric intake.  Service was fabulous from beginning to end. The staff here are quite friendly and attentive.  Overall great experience at Black Tap!

y98i5CiaY9ON-s71svtd-g.text: Today the inner child who screams for sugar's dreams came True, but my adult body was in full overload from sugar. Yes! I enjoyed my dessert and also the falafel burger. The deep fried pickles were a good amount to share among 3-4 people.  I split the falafel with a side of fries with my friend. It was perfect to split if you're going to have other items.  For being on The Strip, the prices were pretty decent for what you get. The portions are good for sharing.  For desserts, we shared the Bam Bam Shake and our friend got the Cotton Candy Shake. Awesome presentation and it was really good! Among two of us, we couldn't finish one that we split as all the treats and stuff in it was delightful, but our bodies were asking us what are we crazies putting in?! Hahah. So good and worth it!  The place looks like a lot of fun and cool. There's a patio for warm days. The bar has a couple of TVs. It is next to sports book at Venetian so if you sit at the window to people watch, you can also see the screens at sports book. Service was pretty fast and they were kind. Great place for birthdays, treat yourself to one spectacular dessert, or if you want an impressive dessert for your date. Kids would enjoy this place. I mean, we couldn't wait to get our desserts!

H7DBH7ZerY56Ir1ZcUrN9w.text: I've been following Black Tap on Instagram for a while. I knew that if I ever went to NY, that would be my first stop. The day they announced they were opening in Vegas, I about screamed. I was so excited because I live about 4 and a half hours away and went frequently. Sure enough a couple months after they opened, I had a trip to Vegas. I wasn't too hungry at the time, so I only got a CRAZY SHAKE. I would be lying if I said I didn't get one for a picture haha. I got the Sweet N Salty one. First off, the shakes are HUGE! Definitely can share them with multiple people. The shake was ok. It was a peanut butter shake so it was even more filling but I have to say, I've had better. I only drank about half of it. I've heard the food is delicious and the burgers look good. So I would return and try the food but maybe not get a shake. Or at least not that flavor.

2HeqpICo3OnaMCgNSwOBQg.text: The Crazy shakes live up to the hype, and the black bean burger and fries were a very satisfying vegetarian meal!  I arrived in Las Vegas late on a Sunday night, super hungry after a day of hiking. I was staying at the Palazzo, and I was pleased to see that a burger and shake spot was open late immediately adjacent to my hotel. My friend and I were seated at the bar with no wait: it would have been about 20 minutes to get a table.  Both my vegetarian burger and his classic burger were well received. The black bean burger was well-seasoned and paired nicely with the salsa and other toppings. My fries were perfectly crisp, but a touch on the salty side. My friend's onion rings were nice and thin and had a tempura-like crust.  The highlight, though, was the Bam Bam Shake, a bomb of fake fruity flavor that was impossible to put down. Lots of places try to make shakes with crazy toppings, but this one was actually delicious. Almost every element, from the vanilla frosting on the rim of the glass to the pop tart topping to the fruity pebbles milk shake itself were well-executed and complementary. Two small improvements would be to eliminate the Laffy Taffy, which gets very solid in the cold glass, and to provide a wider straw that isn't so easily clogged with cereal.  I am excited to come back to Black Tap for an awesome meal and to try the other crazy shakes on the menu!

Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The vegetarian black bean burger was really good with the salsa verde.

9qCST-668GtXDTQ0hl_f5A.text: This place will make you feel like your on the movie Pulp Fiction with its fun and hip decor. The scene is hip and fun, the service is top notch and the food is to die for. I had the truffle burger and the flavors were perfect- not too much truffle just the right amount to make it flavorful.   Fries were done right perfectly crispy and everything came out in the perfect amount of time. Burgers are very well sized and filling but definitely leave room for one of their signature shakes. We had the Brooklyn whatever- It was this amazing chocolate concoction with brownies hanging off of it and probably the best shake I've ever had. I attached a photo of this one.  If you're looking for a hip place with great food and excellent service, this place will not disappoint!

e-33g5k9cSM1CCYX4ALu-Q.text: Previously visited four months prior, an impromptu dinner during Las Vegas' snowfall discovering The Venetian's replacement for B&B Burgers & Beer to be a more fully-envisioned concept built around the same kind of Food, it was on Saturday evening that Black Tap Craft Burgers & Beer was again found jumping, a brief wait in the queue outside soon seating three guests in a comfortable booth.  Still popular nearly 18-months after opening, fair prices and Social Media savvy combined with excellent service undoubtedly part of Black Tap's appeal, it was learning from previous mistakes of ordering everything at once that three Sandwiches were requested first, the high volume of patrons creating nearly thirty minutes delay during which wait-staff repeatedly stopped by with updates as The Notorious B.I.G. rapped overhead.  Louder than remembered, both the music and several tables of teenagers on summer break contributing, it was in the middle of a conversation about the rise of "upscale" Burgers that three arrived simultaneously, Chef Isidori's signature Truffle Burger featuring ground Wagyu, smoked Gouda and two truffled toppings immediately setting a high bar while Fries were crisp, hot and appropriately salted.   Continuing with two SoHo staples built on Prime Beef from Pat LaFrieda, the iconic butcher's Patty unfortunately a bit overcooked in the case of Black Tap's Pizza Burger crowned by fried Mozzarella, it was instead the Chili Cheese Burger that impressed by way of both its medium center and Brioche Bun that stands up surprisingly well to meaty Chili and thick Cheese Sauce.  Underwhelmed by Onion Rings and their non-adherent coating, but happy with Sweet Potato Fries in a reversal from last visit, it was after watching staff build CrazyShakes for over an hour that three were finally ordered, the fact that all threaten to topple over a given but the bases all rich and creamy with the recently-debuted Churro Choco Taco Cinnamon Toast Crunch Shake particularly memorable as it tasted like Cereal Milk beneath a frozen treat that hadn't been tasted in over a decade.   FOUR STARS:  Although many will argue that there is nothing quite like a classic Burger it would be hard to claim Black Tap is not dedicated to their craft, a Patty of Prime Beef from Pat LaFrieda the base to several fun concoctions supported by a good Bun while the eye-candy Shakes are silly but delicious, and provided by great service.

UXsuPTs9QGpMgU6fnRYKtg.text: My gf and I have been dying to go here. Finally came to the Vegas location and it's not what we expected. At all.  Started with the fried chicken and fries. Fries were the best part. Chicken was seasoned well but chewy.   Main reason we came: the shakes.  We ordered the cookie shake and presentation was bomb. Never saw anything like it. Definitely photo worthy. Taste: very bland. Didn't even finish it. I understand the price is high bc of all the work it takes to put together this shake but they forgot the basics. The taste of the shake.   I would not recommend. Unless you want to take cool pics of a shake. And not eat it.   Service was good. My two stars are for service, presentation, and the fries.

K7_JL6akNBpLcdhqxRy5Ww.text: Very cool! I ordered the Old Fashion Burger and it did not disappoint at all! Delish and I recommend it. My daughter had the bison burger and also loved it. The shakes are crazy good. Worth the $$$ at least one time. I took a party of 14 teenagers and the service was impeccable as was the food.  They don't accept reservations and I thought that that was odd and inconvenient since I had such a large group l. But the hostess was very accommodating and in spite of the wait, it all worked out.  I wish they had not included 18% service charge on the bill then sales tax on top of it. I would have easily given the server 20% instead which over a $600+ bill, she would have scored. So that did not work on her favor, unfortunately but I get why they have to do it like that.  Cool place. A definite must if you are at the Venetian.

7eTWwSfgxTic3rGcUpwetg.text: Black Tap is definitely doing something right! Their line was pretty long for a lunch wait, but only took about 15-20 mins for us to get seated. They have an option for outdoor seating, indoor seating, or first available. You may get seated at a bar top area, tables, or booths.  We got the main corner booth right in the middle and it was such an awesome time. Of course babes and I had to share the cookies and cream shake, arugula salad, and the chicken burger. We got some extra dipping sauces which are $1 each but I'm glad we did, cus they were yummy!   The shake was just as good as it looks! It comes with an ice cream Oreo sandwich which lasted throughout our whole meal. The salad was tasty, not bland at all. And the chicken sandwich was pretty good!   Definitely recommend this spot if you wanna have a cheat day! Located inside the Venetian, you have to go down the escalators and then turn left to find the hidden spot. :-)

KmKGV45FPqtypuldRy93vA.text: Cool ambience, delicious food and great service.  Really enjoyed black tap!  My friend and I both did the turkey burger salad.  We swapped out the blue cheese for cheddar and did dressing in the side.  It was really good!  We also did a side of fries which were great.  We didn't try a shake so I'll have to do that in the future.  They look enormous and fun.

8yO1Il9xFTWIkL5hZwFYmw.text: This place has all kinds of awesomeness! Great environment, great music, great food, and great service. I wish there were more of these in other markets. Nobody does a milkshake like they do!

XVQlVSNOlO7vdhAgLCC3tA.text: I was super excited to try this spot but was super let down. I'll start with the positives...decor was really cool & the milkshake was delicious.   The cons...service was horrible, there was something non-edible in my food, empty plates on my table for 45 minutes before the waiter took them away, water was never refilled and the manager did nothing but say sorry wayyyy after the fact.   My husband & I both got drinks, which were just okay. Definitely over priced for what we got but not bad. The appetizer was standard cheese stick type app but the sauce it came with was really good. We ended up using it all to dip our fries in. When my burger came out I noticed what looked like a thick dark hair on top of my tomatoes. It took at least 10 minutes to hail down the waiter to tell him about it. Without saying sorry he took it back and then came out to say it wasn't a hair but just a bristle from a brush. Still no apology. He asks if I needed a new burger made or if I could just eat the original one...hmmm...now that burger is cold & it had something inedible on it. I asked for a new burger. By the time my new burger came out my husband finished his and we had a table filled with dirty plates, dirty drinks & empty water glasses.   By the end when we were getting ready to leave the manager came and said sorry but we were leaving at that point anyway. No compensation given. I never want to return again, if quality is lacking in the kitchen and the front of house. Working in hospitality on the strip and dealing with hundreds of tourists on a daily basis, I will let everyone know to go to another burger spot like LVB Burger, Gordon Ramsey's or the other amazing local restaurants that care about their patrons.

9QBGZckQUeFVCC4nLIASsg.text: Fun place!  Great burgers.  I am gluten free, so was quite pleased to see them offer a hamburger "salad".  While I didn't indulge, the desserts looked over the top.  YUM!

JK_vdEsAIV65QY64HftsFg.text: Had our oldest daughters wedding reception here. Food was great, service was amazing! Had a bit of a communication problem but everything was perfect on our daughters day! The black tab crew was on top of it for all our needs!  Milkshakes were amazing!!!!!  Thank you everyone at the black tap for making our wedding party feel like we were the only ones in the place! Top notch. Jose your crew did a great job!

DIDfI-vdh9XSMX2POx8zOw.text: I got the cake shake and it was amazing! It's a bit on the pricey side but it's worth it! Our waiter was very friendly and laid back. We only came for dessert but as I was looking over, people had got burgers and they looked amazing. On my next Vegas trip, I will make sure I dine in here and have dessert again here. It's a cool looking place. I highly recommend you make a stop here!

0UYo54aJeteGzuFqCu5DHg.text: Well, it was pretty good.  A good meal after so much alcohol in Vegas!  Me n my husband are vegetarians - so we're always looknig for veggie options before we go in to a restaurant.  The black bean burger - was too mushy - not great! The sweet potato fries were good!!  My falafel burger was yummmy! I overate like a pig!!  Venetian has better Restaurants - dont try this one if you're in Vegas for the first or second or third time even!

QkxA-qVy3J_WtbGUKAXaCw.text: If you're craving a good juicy burger or a yummy, ginormous shake, be sure to check this place out! Black Tap is located in The Venetian Hotel. If you enter through the main entrance off the strip, just take the escalator down one floor, hang a left and you'll see it on your left hand side.   The place has a cool and funky 80s' theme going with fun vibe. It seems to be a hit so there may be a short wait but it's well worth it. The staff is very friendly and attentive. And the burgers are delicious! My friends and I liked it so much that we went back the very next day for round 2. My favorite is the Old Fashioned Burger with Bacon of course!  They also have a full bar stocked with most of your favorite poisons. BUT, the bar that you really want to check out here is the shake bar. These shakes are some of the craziest, best looking, ginormous shakes I've ever seen. They have a bunch of different toppings and flavors. You can easily share  one between 2 or 3 people.   Cool spot, check it out and enjoy!

That being said we came here for one on their amazing milkshakes! My girlfriend got the bday cake shake because we were here for her birthday. Highly recommend!

qQLPy3fN-TUg-UFzPQZ2pQ.text: I've been here twice now and there is so much to say about this place...   The parking- If you park in the valet by the sin city brewing you just take the escalator down and follow the tile/ no carpet portion of the floor through the casino right to their desk!   The service- Our waiter last night killed it... considering I took (4) 10 year old girls out for milkshakes, he was a saint! The hostess however was not so friendly and didn't take us seriously when we asked for table for 4 adults and 5 kids. She informed us it was an hour wait and when we said ok, she then asked if we wanted to sit inside or outside? I mean maybe there is an outside patio? Her tone made it seem more condescending then it needed to be. So we waited patiently... yes 5 children under the age of 10 at 7pm at night waited... I will yelp about their parent later lol   The food- (things we've/ I've ordered throughout the 2 visits):  The Texan burger- hands down the best.. cooked perfectly and large enough to share with fries   The truffle burger- well I tried and I still hate arugula. The burger was great but I just can't get past what texturally feels like a bunch of weeds in my mouth    Spicy Korean wings- my friend would not let me try them but damn they looked tasty   **we have ordered every shake**  The cake shake- by far the best deal, I mean you get a legit piece of cake slapped on the top. Plus the shake tastes similar to cereal milk from MilkBar.   The bam bam shake- omg it's an 8 years olds dream but I hate fruity pebbles so it didn't do much for me! I did enjoy the strawberry pop tart.   Cookies N Cream shake- if you like cookies n cream normally or your a fan of Oreos you'd love this shake.   Brooklyn Blackout shake- way to much chocolate in this bad boy but wasn't sure if the brownie was undercooked? Either way the brownie was delicious even though I thought we may get sick from raw egg.  Sour Power Shake- Total stomach ache... but a child's dream if they like sour. I could only stomach 2 bites before the laffy taffy did a number on my filling.   The cookie shake- very similar to the cookie N cream but made with chip ahoy like cookies instead of Oreos... waiter said it was his favorite so I went for it only to wish I had went with my gut and ordered the cake shake again.   Cotton Candy Shake- I could feel my blood sugar spiking and knew these 10 year old girls were about to go off the deep end on a sugar high! It was very pretty to look at but so damn sweet.   Sweet N Salty Shake- probably the favorite among the adults and if any one has a peanut allergy you don't have to share.. I know that's mean to joke about but it's a good balance of sweet and salt.

HRKdkeZR-yU7u0DUyVdezQ.text: I've been wanting to try this place & was in Vegas for LDW. Came on a Saturday evening. There was a line but decided to sit at the bar, seated right away. Service was quick at the bar. Ordered the cotton candy shake, the American burger & Korean spicy wings. Food & shake was delicious! Would definitely come back again.

TPE0n9zaUWpdMgd008ea7w.text: This is inside of the Venetian. A little hidden but it's worth it once you find it.  First, we were greeted and seated immediately. It looks like it wasn't busy from the outside (during lunch hour) but once you walk in, it is packed - always.  Customer service was awesome. The waitress was accommodating and very friendly. Got our drinks first then came back to get our orders immediately. The wait for the food was not very long either. Food was very good and plentiful. I barely finished my food and was hoping to have a little bit more room for their shakes (I'm a sucker for a good milk shake) but, alas, I was too darn full to order one. I was contemplating for awhile to order one even though I was full - didn't even finish all my fries coz I was that full. The burger itself was awesome. Juicy and very flavorful.  One thing that made me enjoy my first visit there was their music. It was a great mix of 90s hip hop from west to east coast style. I enjoyed it so much that I even asked the waitress if the playlist is available online but it wasn't. She said that it was the owners mix. So great taste LOL Overall, this place is awesome but leave room to actually get their milk shake.

i5cW90y4E6zs37gcprvKKA.text: Meh. Burger was fine. Nothing special about the place - there are better beers and better burgers on the strip. Beer selection was ok but nothing to write home about.

ZcV9QSteMbTVKOIPCUoNZQ.text: What an awesome experience, and so happy I finally got down here over the past weekend. Love the soundtrack. Whoever is in charge of music did a great job. Grabbed an All American Burger, and an appetizer of guacamole with chips. Ended the visit with the Cake Batter Crazy Shake. Food can make you happy, and this place is proof. Make sure to check this place out.

QRG_-dGIhWy15lYHv5yZQQ.text: These shakes are not only fun looking...but very tasty too! I visited with a party of four a Saturday around 9:30 pm and was immediately seated. We visited with the plan to only have the shakes since we already had dinner.   I ordered the cookies and cream milkshake and shared it with the hubby. The shakes are big enough to be shared with multiple people. The rim of the glass was covered with vanilla frosting and oreo crumbs. The milkshake also came with a big cookie ice cream and a tower of whipped cream and cookie crumbs.   Needless to say the shake was pretty amazing. It cost $15 for the big elaborate ones and $9 for the simpler ones. I think that if you are planning to share it the $15 shake is more than enough and fairly priced.   This is a place I intend to come back to!

4yauo7B1fz3JK4FbnHhmFA.text: You guys are absolutely amazing!! The waiter was freaking awesome!! Checked on us at the right times when I asked about milkshakes I asked what he would recommend, and I hate him for it but he mentioned 3 of his favorites in such detail that when we go back in a couple of days I'm getting all three!! Well played sir! The burgers are out of this world! The fries were to die for!! You guys knocked it out of the park! You guys are the reason I got yelp just wrote my first ever review!

V64jeZqQz6efw0UI3JlbgQ.text: We went to eat here and was taken care of by Miranda at the bar. She was very attentive the whole time and made a great michelada from their menu!! She kept checking back and offered some great options on the menu.

RmjwYlEmqlRGXzOQPuA_ZQ.text: Great customer service, really cool atmosphere, food was delicious and came out quick! The milkshakes were out of this world and something I'll never forget. I'm a Las Vegas resident and go more often then I should. Hands down one of my favorite restaurants on the strip! So worth the money :)

R1O_MzxZYHjxxZ4_0PPerg.text: My friends and I stayed at the Venetian over the weekend and ate here for the last night of our stay. The place is FANTASTIC! We ate on the patio which had a great view. Service was wonderful, and so was all the food. Portions were MASSIVE (photos for scale). We had the cookie shake and cookie n cream supreme, both with booze added. I had the American with onion rings, and my other two friends had the Mexico City and the bison burgers. The whole meal was awesome, save for the fact that the napkins and plates are all very tiny so things got a little messy. Definite recommend.

YtodII3WmlVSqefHqkmYSQ.text: This place is pretty awesome.  Our wait time wasn't too bad. We arrived when there was a long line and we thought we were going to be waiting over 30 min.  That wasn't the case and I think our wait time was about 15 min.  From the outside the place looked small hence why we thought it would be a long wait, but when you walk inside there were more tables in the back.  The decor is very upbeat and hip long with the music.  Server was pleasant.  Very honest in his opinion of the food and descriptive in explained some of the things on the menu.   Food was excellent.  I never thought I'd be one to order these crazy shakes but I did, we did.  My brother wanted to order the shakes first which I thought was crazy.  He ordered the Sweet n' Salty Peanut Butter Shake, my sister, The Cookie Shake Vanilla Cookie Shake, and I, Cookies n' Cream Supreme Oreo Shake.  It was insane.  So I pretty much had dessert first.  Mine had a big ol Oreo Cookie Ice Cream Sandwich on top!  It was a lot to handle but it was so good!  For our meal we ordered:   They Greg Norman $20 - waygu beef, house buttermilk dill, hold the blue cheese, arugula   The Old Fashioned $18 - prime burger, crimini mushrooms, swiss (I replaced with pepper jack),  caramelized onions, horseradish sauce    I ordered The Old Fashioned and I liked it!  I wasn't too sure about the horseradish sauce but I'm pretty open minded and I enjoyed it! Especially dipping my fries into it!  The burger meat itself was big and thick.  It looks like they're freshly made.  The taste was flavorful and the burger was nice and moist.  The horseradish did complement the burger well.  My brother said the Greg Norman burger was excellent.  One of the best burgers he's tasted.  So this experience was pretty good.  Im thinking the only bad thing I'd say (which isn't super bad)  is that the music is kind of loud but that could just be me.  I think music should be heard, but I also think you should be able to hear the people at your own table.  So with all that being said, Happy Eatings!

s87gj9aHtfdx_61u1z3WAg.text: For a restaurant that just opened at the Venetian, this place was a hot spot for many. To my surprise, there were people almost in every seat enjoying shakes and burgers. Yes, it was quite a busy day, but that didn't stop the swift service.   We were seated immediately with super friendly servers who frequently checked up on us.   Our meal:   $16 The All American Burger - This was the burger I got. I thought, you can't go wrong with a classic burger, right? And I didn't. But it wasn't impressive enough to merit a cost of $16. It reminded me of the burger from Ketchup at Planet Hollywood which was slightly cheaper and tasted just the same.   $19 The Mexico City - My girlfriend ordered this, but wasn't impressed. She came for the shake which was pleasing to her palate but as for this burger, not so much. I think the best word to describe it is lackluster. And for $19 a pop, I think we were pretty much disappointed because of the flavors.   $15 The Cookie Shake - One of the best most inventive shakes I've tasted. It was rich and creamy as it was filled with bursting flavors from the beginning to the end. I also loved the presentation of the shake which made the entire visit worthy and appetizing.   $15 Bam Bam Shake - This was the shake I never got to try because our friend ordered it but she definitely enjoyed it. It was colorful and appeared fruity. It's shakes like those that would probably keep us coming back again and again.   Fries - Not a fan. It was your standard, frozen fries that lacked salt or any surprise flavors. Very basic for what you're paying for.   Now, the boiling questions, would I come back? I think so. Just for dessert that is. Everything else could be acquired some place else.

Mjk_474PlTCtqEknHlTfCA.text: This is one of the most amazing burger places I've ever been too! The moment I came into this restaurant I was greeted with great service from the host. Love the way the restaurant decor is; very cultural great ambiance. I'm a very simple traditional girl when it comes to burgers so I went with the "All American Burger" cooked to medium temperature, it was amazingly delicious! Got their simple milkshake and it was bomb.com! I would most definitely be coming back to this place!

TPoO9b5fM45IFj2eoyv0ww.text: A very good beer and burger restaurant. Best part of our dining experience was sitting outdoors next to the gondolas. Unfortunately, our waitress disappeared leaving us with empty glasses, waiting for our bill, and disappointed.

iEdLg2HkY02KPy1cd9aFiA.text: Made a point to seek this place out inside the Venetian on our short trip to Vegas after seeing an Instagram post featuring the crazy milkshakes... 1. Milkshakes: Totally worth it. I got the BamBam shake which was covered in fruity pebbles. My childhood dreams came True! The shakes were surprisingly portioned well: we came with empty bellies in preparation & finished them without feeling uncomfortable. I like that they aren't HUGE. However, highly recommend sharing one if you grab a burger prior. 2. Service: They were slammed. We were told a 20 minute wait but since we weren't picky about where to sit we were seated in 10. The hostess was very sweet even when a large group of tourists came in and disregarded her completely when she tried to get their names on a list to wait like the rest of us. They ended up blocking the entire walkway of the bar area and demanded drinks from an unsuspecting waiter walking by (who later became ours) & he disappointingly obliged. I do wish the staff did not reward this rude behavior especially with a line of us waiting patiently right there. That group continued to be loud and entitled for the rest of the time we were there. It did put a damper on the experience for us and others around us. This prevented us from wanting to be there any longer- so we only ordered shakes. Our waiter was prompt despite how busy he was. He was flustered but handled it well. He ended up giving us the wrong change at the end of the night- giving us the total of our tab ($32- before tip) rather than our change ($68) but he quickly corrected himself and was apologetic when we brought it to his attention. Overall impressed by the shakes and would love to go back again to try some of the other food options! Management: please retrain your staff on how to handle unruly guests. I would absolutely be giving a 5 stars if that had been handled differently.

rvjZpNJyGlQYUGI6prZuqA.text: For starters this place is really hard to find. It was very loud inside you could barely hear each other talk. We were here for a friend's birthday dinner. My boyfriend and I were on a tab together, for 2 burgers and a milkshake it was $65. The burger was mediocre and the milkshake was not very good. A friend in our party received his food with a hair in it, it took over 5 mins to locate someone for him to only smerk and say oh I'm sorry very sarcastically. Save your money and time by eating somewhere else, it's definitely not worth it.

HNej9UJJaYlEWpQemA0z6Q.text: This place was really good. We had a group of 8 for bachelorette party and we all enjoyed our lunch. We had burgers, salads, and ate everything! Sweet potato fries were yummy too. We were amazed at the desserts shakes we saw walk by. Service was good. Cool environment and good music. I would recommend eating here at the Venetian.

S0_fyI6csWuNoKSdLzkQww.text: Like many things in Las Vegas this place gives the name craft a bad name. I had the American burger with sweet potato fries, The burger fell short of mediocre and when I asked for a side of mayo I got it and later found out that it was a dollar extra. On the upside the sweet potato fries were pretty good. I definitely will never go back.

aRlA0D6kYiYSIs3q2t9CIA.text: Burgers and fries were top notch and the shake as promised was Vegas style and "over the top"!  All in all yes it's pricey but worth the trip!  The service was great as well and yes water cups are small.

egx0xSJHIAN9mc9uElvznQ.text: 2 stars because the food was actually very good. Hassled repeatedly after asking to change seats to see a TV and the playoff game. The 1st guy after I moved "excuse me, but there's an order minimum to sit here." Was rather insulted by this since I ordered the most expensive burger that they had. Apparently he checked with the manager and it was ok for me to sit in the restaurant while I waited for the food I ordered. I regret not cancelling my order and leaving after the 1st guy, but then came the woman "hi, are you just sitting here to watch the game?" The manager came over immediately to tell me that I'm fine to sit there because at this point I'm pissed, standing up and asking if my sitting there is a problem. The food came out without further incident and was very good. Cooked perfectly. Since I felt so incredibly welcomed (sarcasm may not be fully evident here), I made it a point to ask for my check immediately, paid and left. If I ever get food there again, it'll be to go.

2xpr8-43DkRmiLNBo0NkqA.text: Food was okay but my husband and I requested to sit outside and we were told it was closed - however as we were leaving they were seating another party outside who requested to sit outside as well.  Was excited to try it but will not be back as we were treated unfairly and not sure why.

oHI9iMaFX-3aUGNeBKUAyQ.text: This place is a must try. The service was excellent (Ashley was very welcoming and attentive & John made us feel right at home!) and the place was super clean. I had the Mexico burger and an Oreo shake. Both were huge portions that were made to perfection. I also tried the queso dip which was delicious. Overall, I will definitely have to make my way back down to the strip to dine here again. There are so many things on the menu that I have to try! Plus the service was one of a kind! The staff truly made my experience a great one. Do yourselves a favor and try this place out!

zD3yKlD3UJ5hn8tvMQ-CfA.text: F'in delicious food.  Burger was definitely one of the best I've had.  Great char on the meat -- perfect flavor.  Also don't miss out on the Fried Chicken Sandwich either.  Honestly that was probably one of the best fried chicken sandwiches I've ever had also.

nv1Wd3PmljxLG8vUu2oWfA.text: What a great place to get a burger and a shake. Our great waitress Kendra was a delight to have with us today. I had the All American Burger and it was amazing and delicious. The patty was perfect and the bun held up perfectly with the burger. I also had the vanilla shake and it was crisp and delicious. Def going here again!

fqOgqL-wja0eXozpnAplBA.text: After seeing a ton of ads for Black Tap- I knew I wanted to try it out.  Hidden gem- located in The Venetian, known for its Burgers & insane shakes, so we were pretty excited to try it out.  As we arrived we were greeted by a not so motivated hostess, but impressed by the inside of the hip location with awesome music and cool servers. After waiting a couple minutes in line for a table - we were seated in Dominics section, who immediately greeted us. He brought us a water bottle which was served with mason jars, pretty neat idea. He then went over the menu with us and pointed out some of his favorites. He totally got me on the Wagyu Burger Salad. Also he was very accommodating- I'm not a big fan of arugula, so he made the suggestion to mix the salad with 50 arugula and 50 kale. Let me tell you, that guy knows what you are looking for and knows what his restaurant serves, very knowledgeable. Great service!!  Bussers were also on point. Never had a messy table.  The shakes are pretty epic, but to be honest- too much for one person. We were 3 girls and we could've easily shared a shake.  Overall great experience! Only negative star goes out to the not so welcoming front of the restaurant!  But- we will be returning! Tip: if you have an option to sit outside- do it! Most amazing views of the canal and the strip!

FkObE3HxyG8WYRGT7mAPrw.text: Funky, casual atmosphere. Burgers were excellent/high-quality. Our kids loved the milkshakes-definitely a highlight.   Restaurant recently opened so they were still trying to get their legs. Service quite slow, and they were out of the beer and wine we ordered.   Overall, solid place.

NEt8YY7KT8aCCd9SIXQCWA.text: Fun place. Great desserts definitely share. Burgers with no bun. We had a few hiccups with service but otherwise would definitely go back.

i1vYCmiatTgkwtW9N7kStQ.text: Best burger I've had. Large size right amount of toppings. Got the Texan with a salad. Husband got same with fries. We both shared with our adult daughter and cleaned plates with not a crumb left. Meat was perfectly cooked and toppings were fresh. Could work on their vinaigrette as it was completely separated- emulsified would have been better. Will definitely have to check out the one in NYC

nq0ANhMw-rhRjr-u6pZwRw.text: I wanted a good hamburger decided to come here. Hamburger was absolutely juicy also had a dessert and again not Disappointed. Definitely will be back.

6CbmlZGyNc0HJXkjnKg-3A.text: We had a party of 7 on a Tuesday night and everyone loved the food they got.  The burgers were amazing with each of us trying something a little different.  The fries weren't the most unique things I've ever had, but they were good nonetheless, and if fries aren't your thing, the side salad was delicious.  My only complaint was that we were neglected for extended periods of time with our beverages sitting empty for a long time.  We would probably have ordered a few more beers and wine, but we weren't ever asked.  I get some are busy and there may have been something else going on that I'm unaware of, so I'd still recommend the place if you're a burger and shake fan - it was truly great.

a6a2HTqxtJrSLY-lAUmJYg.text: We Decided to take my kids here for family Sunday just to try out they're famous shakes we have been seeing and hearing about. There we're six of us my husband and 4 kids and we decided to order 5 of the shakes. Our server was great she was friendly and attentive. No complain really about the shakes or the service, even though its $15 per shake which I think was overprice but heck its on the strip so I guess that is some what normal. Would we be back to try them again probably not. Its too overprice,you can get a somewhat similar shake at red robin for way cheaper. My problem was one even though we ordered just 5 shakes but since there was 4 kids with us they charged us an 18% service charge right away, If we ordered a full lunch entrees and all I guess I can understand but for 5 shakes i think its a little too much. Second was me and my husband split the bill which I clearly have the receipt for it, but for some reason they decided to charge my card full price even though I only signed $20 on mine the rest was on my husbands card. I tried calling the first time managers were all on in a meeting didn't get a call back,second day I called still managers were on a meeting again and asked for my number again! finally after seeing that the whole bill cleared my account and not pending I called again, they tried to give me the same excuse that the managers were in a meeting but I didn't budge I said I need to talk to one now, 2 minutes later finally a MANAGER! He told me he will look into it so hopefully they get back to me asap. Just be careful and make sure that you pay attention to the charges and keep the receipt. The shakes are big and I think its a little bit over whelming for one person, so its definitely shareable specially for the price. I ordered one each for my teenagers and they didn't even finish it because they got so overwhelmed with how much chocolate it has.I guess ill update this review once I get a reply from the manager hopefully they get my charges on my card fixed.

TDjst80SM4vTHkLqORXPxw.text: The only thing better than their shakes, is the customer service. Very impressed by the quality of their servers.  Would definitely go back

HVXjwTWD7E_GrGauQdZSrw.text: This place was phenomenal. The burgers,shakes and drinks I can't say it enough, phenomenal. It's a must try.

I3RTwxxJxag_dUzhBf4t2Q.text: Very nice for Burger and smoothie here. The restaurant is nice and also service is good and foods faster. About the price is not expensive for the restaurant inside Hotel on strip.

ALE0YNhWvCFDHS2DUNyZqg.text: Loved this place and the vibe! They play such great music they should have a dance floor in the middle area somewhere! Their veggie kale salad was good and their crazy cake shake dessert was crazy good!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

A1n0yE-y2OmmGqDwC9PLYQ.text: My husband and I wanted to grab a quick drink before heading back home to the Bay. Wish we knew about this place sooner! Bri was super helpful and wanted to make sure I found the right IPA that I "loved". Didn't order any food but the laid back atmosphere, tons of craft brews on draft, and great music was well worth the stop. Will definitely be back again when we visit LV! If you like craft beers and a chill spot to rest your feet, come by Black Tap!

pDQ_9vyqhX6OqrZhO7Gkmg.text: Disappointed.  We came in for my sister's birthday, looking forward to these amazing-looking milkshakes. The presentation was indeed great; we loved the rock candy and cotton candy much more than the shake itself. The shake we got, the "Cotton Candy" shake, was a strawberry milkshake with the weakest hint of strawberry I've ever tasted. It took effort to actually find the flavor. Realistically, I could have gotten a better quality (and larger) shake at Del Taco or Jack in the Box.  What especially irritated us was the pricing. In each description, you see you can add a supplement for $2. Expecting to pay $15 for each shake, we received the bill with $17 for each. It turns out, the awesome toppings that you see on the top of the shake aren't included in the base price; they charge $2 more. We wish we had known considering the waitress did nothing to inform us about this and the menu was stunningly vague about what a supplement is. (Seriously, who the hell calls a lollipop or a slice of cake a "supplement?")   I'm easily impressed by desserts and sweets, and for the $17 price, this shake might have been one of the most watered-down, worst shakes I've ever had.

09UkE6hoWpJ0sIm0t8UMSA.text: We came in with a big group of girls on a Friday, no reservation. They did their best to get us in a timely manner. Once we got seated, Jason was amazing! He was super attentive and made sure we always had everything we needed.

JqyFVdtKJfZ9q-sDVvqNiw.text: We went to a ton of great restaurants while we were in Vegas, but this was our favorite. It had a great vibe. The food was excellent. The crazy shakes were amazing. I thought the service was great. We sat at the bar. The bartenders were extremely friendly. We went back there some late at night as well, since the Dorsey was always packed, and TAO wasn't our jam.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sT3WPzaqZRxPPHD8cPHZzw.text: Came here for a friends birthday and it was okay. We had a group of 10-12 people and had called ahead to reserve a table and they said to just arrive 30 min early and they'd set it up instead of doing a reservation. About 6 of us showed up and the host was quite confused maybe new. She said they couldn't set up the table because the whole party wasn't there but the other host came and said they could do it. They then told us it was ready and put our group in two different booths?? So we obviously did not take that and asked if we could have a table. So they then re set up another one. This took about 25 min and very inconvenient. Maybe they need some customer service training.   Our server was Carlos who was actually great especially being frustrated from our arrival process. He was very nice, helpful, and attentive! I asked if they could sing for my friends birthday and he brought out the milk shake with a candle! So awesome.   I shared the turkey burger and cake milkshake with my friend and they were amazing! It's kind of pricy but worth the experience.

SCSZ0iLhSFFDXLt5alqEHg.text: SUCH a good burger. Omgggg. So filling too. I had the old fashioned, my group had the Mexico City and the chili one. They also loved theirs. Shakes were so gorgeous and definitely Instagram worthy. Tasty as well! Notched down a star because we were at lunch service and they already ran out of ingredients for the sour shake.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Dp7iZIXtmHvkXlKAMmXk0g.text: Wanted to have a staycation at the Venetian, and decided to have dinner here at Black Tap due to our positive previous visit for a family birthday. First let me say our waiter Luis was FANTASTIC!! Super friendly  and personable! He really added to our night! As someone who has been in the hospitality business, I would steal him away. The food was wonderful. We had the Bison burger, sweet potato fries with a side of the ginger broccoli..loved every bite...now the reason for 4 stars and not five..I was stunned to get my bill and find (not told) that I had been charged 1.00 for 1 small ramekin of Korean BBQ sauce.. sorry but that is plain wrong!! You have ketchup on the table  (I didnt use) and I'm charged 1.00 really ? Shame !! Thank goodness for Luis he saved the night!!..

I7Br6dLaI-C3gwidAcyQjA.text: This is the best place ever period. The service is great and the staff is so kind. They get your food to you quickly and efficiently. It is a great family and kid friendly place.Great music and cool interior designs. Great wide variety of food drinks and desert. One hundred percent recommend. Warning there may be a line to check in but it goes by very fast there were about 20 people and we got in within 2 minutes.

3UyvMeZZgKX_xbOOZZ-K4Q.text: This was the best food place ever !! The shakes were great & the customer service is excellent ! Work the prices also you will get really full off of the food

O_aSHIStzJZ_17Lg8uAgcw.text: It was alright.  The wings were incredibly meaty but only one sauce to choose from (spicy Korean). The sauce was alright but doused on.  Would be better to have choices of sauces.  The onion rings were cut too thick and the batter came off way too easy.

5RR_tHSBSTX5S_JD_RZmlw.text: The staff were all very friendly and accommodating! We loved this place and all we got was dessert....but let me just say I've been dreaming of that dessert ever since we left! It was amazing! We got the Chocolate Blackout shake, but we got it with vanilla milk shake instead of chocolate. Super yummy!  UPDATE- we went back for a second shake and one of the burger salads....sooooo good!!

I must say I wasn't ready for the portion sizes, they were plentiful, but I won't complain about them either. I'd like to come back when I have a bit more of an appetite to enjoy more of the menu.

119tI9HNhlQgz44Otmb2ZQ.text: Not sure why the great reviews. The fried mozzarella tasted freezer burned, and the cheese inside was stiff and not at all melty. The American burger was nothing special, and came well done instead of medium like i had ordered. Only redemption was their sauces - both the chipotle tomato and buttermilk dill were tasty.   Lots of other fantastic options. I would pass on this one.

P2CH0ddFtqNUICOIoF8usA.text: Went for the shakes and ended up loving the fries more! Over the top shakes but man they make them tough to eat or even take them to go as a left over. Price is right and place is very fun and inviting.

SYEm5xcrjBw6Ju_a4DiAHQ.text: The place is really cool but unfortunately the shakes are overrated. We had the cookie shake which was really not that great...

3xBZuRtbzKVDCFDfxFNcyg.text: Amazing! We didn't have to wait to indulge on our cheat day! We saw the awesome reviews and the giant shakes, and we knew we had to have one. Service was quick, the food was delicious and the shakes were out of this world! Can't wait to go back!

PB3GbfdzQMqF8J3BYi_5RQ.text: Went there twice on our recent trip to Vegas. The burgers were amazing!  I got the All-American and then on the second visit I tried the Texan burger. Both were cooked right and tasted great. I ordered the regular fries and there were great!  We ordered the fried pickles and they were delicious!  Only issue was on Saturday night they had a DJ playing and it was so loud you couldn't have a conversation. Our sever had to shout to us or lean in real close for us to hear. We saw two couples ask to be moved due to the loud music. Maybe just turn down the music a bit?  Overall I'll go back and try a different burger and maybe next time I'll have room for a shake.

a3EFwZR5v9WM6TKm3B7cwg.text: Not impressed with the food for the price that it was! Sangria was 15 bucks which was okay. I had the burger salad, but the burger was a little too salty for my liking. Also had the bam bam shake which was literally vanilla ice cream blended with fruity pebbles. Nothing that great!! We went for my birthday and all the waiter said was happy birthday. Don't go to get special treatment that's for sure. Also the seats are uncomfortable and the service isn't that speedy.

B-M20zGpd-NrZ7kTtfiShQ.text: Whoa, pretty fabulous place!!! My daughter loved the crazy milkshakes and I love love love the fries with truffle mayo. Would love to come back here next visit to Vegas

0j5fRRWl7nDPV50TMIeOVg.text: Labor Day weekend in Vegas. We decided to play tourist, so we went to the strip. We ended up at the Venetian and we were hungry, so we looked for a place we'd never been. While I was in the mood for a steak, but hubby wanted a burger, he saw the sign for Black Top and said let's try it. We should have taken it as a sign when we couldn't find the entrance to the restaurant. But, we persevered, found it and went in. We were told to wait for our table in a "que"...ummm....why wouldn't the hostesses offer the bar? Waiting in a que with kids in strollers wasn't where our head was at, so WE told the hostess that we would be at the bar. The bar was okay. Note to tourists: don't ask to eat outside, your servers disappear and you end up in a wasteland. I say the bar was okay, our drinks were acceptable but you can't transfer your bar tab to your table, annoying and inconvenient. So we get seated and we're given a menu. I don't remember what my husband got, I got the waygu Burger woth bacon and avocado. With those add-ons, your looking at a $30 Burger. I didn't finish it. It tasted funny, I've had Waygu before and this was funky. The fries were okay. But the burger was off. There were NO servers to be found. When our guy did finally come back I asked for the check. At that point I was annoyed and feeling a little nauseous. We paid a RIDICULOUS amount of money for what TRULY amounted to a McDonalds with a liquor license. Save your money. Don't bother. Go to Smashburger or In-n-Out, or if you're of the mind to spend the money, and you're at the Venetian, go to Canaletto or Grand Luxe.   Side note: remember I said the beef tasted funky? Yeah, well I got hella sick.

0YejZ--baW_3bIkM8UtUMA.text: So I wanted to check out Black Tap last year on my visit to the Venetian, but it was always packed. Went for a late lunch and ordered a burger and a shake. I knew the shakes were a bit over the top, but what I got was a bad shake with a piece of cake crammed on top of it. The actual shake itself was bland and disgusting. I'd like to review the burger, but after an hour wait, I never received it. The waiter, who was extremely inattentive and focused on both task vs purpose and interactions with other staff vs customers decided to go to break. Another polite, short haired blonde waitress took over and had the unfortunate pleasure of dealing with my lack of service.  I love the Venetian, but this place will unfortunately fix its own problems with complete lack of service. To any management reading this, your staff needs to focus on customers rather than tasks and socialization. It's apparent that you're presence is absent.

yh1Lm0ZAPyk8onuzAh1GcA.text: Very good service, shakes, and food. They have the best burgers. Definitely recommend getting the Brooklyn Blackout shake.

gkBMOzrtOY1zk1c-rywM8g.text: Lunch at Black Tap was good.  Not great.  Service attentive and friendly.  I ordered the Korean Crispy Chicken Sandwich with onion rings.  Sandwich ok but not much of Korean flair to it.  The onion rings were crispy light and yummy.  So the real reason we went was the crazy shakes. We ordered the Brooklyn Blackout Shake.  It took 20 min to be delivered to the table.  Way too long and it was melting all over the place.  I think it would have been better as a sundae.  Would we go back?  Probably not n

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Korean Crispy Sandwich.

3ENtyOrKxaE2WHSXT2JxGQ.text: What a fun and great place! Decided to have lunch and this place did not disappoint.  Great atmosphere, good decor and easy to access.  Place is busy to get there with enough time and they have seating at the bar.  They also have a  nice room in the back that is great for larger groups. So, we tried the All American Burger and The Mexico City Burger. Both were cooked to perfection and prepared just right. To top it all off we began with the AMAZING shakes! Sweet N' Salty is definitely for peanut butter lovers and full of flavor.  Sour Power  is a WOW! This one was just the right amount of sour and topped with whipped cream and nerds.  The Bam Bam Shake is the Fruity Pebbles shake can we say yummmmmo!  Finally the Cake Shake is the Cake Batter shake for those Funfetti cake lover.  If you are in Vegas or a local and need a fun place to have a good burger and some amazing. FYI if you love blue cheese try The Greg Norman.  I will be back to try the other burgers and shakes.

Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bam Bam Shake (Fruity Pebbles), The Cake Shake (Cake Batter Funfetti cake), Sweet N&#39; Salty(Peanut Butter)  &amp; Sour Power (Black Cherry)

Eel-YUJ1rx4euzr3ckzGiA.text: I went here with my boyfriend on a Saturday night. I love the old school hip-hop themed interior. There was a line out the door. Even though it was incredibly busy, the service was very quick, friendly, and attentive! Our burgers were perfectly cooked and delicious. The fries were nothing special. We ordered the Brooklyn Blackout shake to share. Even though it tasted amazing, we weren't able to finish it since it was pretty big. The music is pretty loud, but it's not a major turn off to me (even though it was hard to hear my boyfriend at times). I also ordered the strawberry lemonade, and it tasted very "off". Despite that, I would come back.
