zm0pU9rjSBTFVvgiNh-3oA.text: Best burger out here in Vegas. A little pricey but well worth the cost. Good service as well. Great atmosphere what can I say but I had a great meal. Hip hop hamburgers with art everywhere. You can't go wrong. Definitely worth 5stars

856iZ212j0DZIMeJH_MsFg.text: Burger just OK, Pickle's are gross and the service the worst.  The shakes are amazing but I wanted a beer/burger and waited 30mins for my beer after I order with no chance to get a second.  They have a small army of employees so I'm not sure why they can't ask if I wanted another round.  The beer was 16oz for $8.00.  Vegas is becoming overrated with high prices and horrible service.  Tap Out of Black Tap and waist your money somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8Qpj_G2InRkuNTdHb5NFVA.text: Absolutely delicious! My husband and I shared the Texas burger but with chicken. It was very very tasty!   We shared because we had to save room for the out of this world shake. I went with the chocolate one but with vanilla ice cream. The brownie was good. Our friends had the cake one and loved it as well!   There appeared to be a line when we got there but it went very fast and was well worth the 20-30 minutes we waited. Another must while in Vegas!!

bVGyT4Q87ClY-0LfibRyBg.text: This is I'll cover two visits: The first visit: This place is fun and has a great vibe. We've been here twice. We had burgers which are very filling. My husband had truffle burger and he would not stop talking about the meat melting in his mouth. The kids had the all American and I had the Mexico City which was really good. We also shared a cake batter shake. It was ok. Nothing to write home about.   Second visit: I tried the truffle burger and my husband was right it DOES melt in your mouth. The burger is fantastic. Not a single complaint about the burger. This time we had the Brooklyn blackout and it was better than the cake batter.   No complaints about this place. It's a great place to try. It's one of those places you can say you went at least once. Probably won't go back unless we have people visiting. Not because there's anything wrong with the place but because it's more of a novelty place.

xIboKmsGuIy6HxY0DjAtUw.text: Worth every penny.  The cake milkshake was over the top GOOD.  It was not overly sweet but rather the perfect mix of funfetti cake & a vanilla milkshake with sprinkle in it.  The Burgers were so juicy and flavorful. The texan was the best loved the big onion ring, paired with bacon, cheddar & BBQ so much excitement with this burger.  I also enjoyed the Mexican with the pickle jalepenos gave it a nice kick paired with the incredible chipotle sauce which we also dipped the sweet pot fries in, yummy.  The Swiss & mush burger was bland and my least favorite but the burger itself was still good.

qWIUTEAIoNB3jRZh26gv3w.text: Disappointed...not a great dining experience. We waited over half an hour to get our shakes with no warning that they were so backed up till we asked where theh. (Also...if you're consistently backed up because the shakes are so popular, why aren't you hiring more people to make them?) We ordered our food & beverages & were quickly forgotten about. Had to ask the bartender 5 minutes later if we could get our Cokes. The shakes themselves were decent though way over priced for what you get. I understand it's a novelty though. Based on service I probably wouldn't come back.   Update: we were contacted & given a great experience. Great food great service great atmosphere this time. Locals, this is a great reason to come to the strip.

vrsPYTUFJ65vjFyAwll85Q.text: I found this place on Pinterest, and the milkshakes do not disappoint. The one I picked had a homemade cookie sandwich with ice cream and icing holding it all together. Then the milkshake had vanilla ice cream and chocolate and it was so good...no shortcuts here!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

24Z-Ig0RHNmsYJkWhZnCQg.text: Great burger place- had the All-American with bacon, it was fantastic. The burgers were pretty thick, which I don't usually love, but this was cooked to perfection and very juicy/savory. The fries were average, and I did not love the onion rings- usually like the more heavily breaded ones.   The milkshakes were insane, and definitely worth getting. The cookies and cream was #1 by far, but enjoyed the cake shake too (the cake on top was very moist).

The Black Tap Mule was great. I def recommend it and will be back here and at their New York location. Had the honor of meeting the owner while here. Was very friendly and helpful with anything we needed.

aI3v0Qam-ZOYKzTn7UJaYg.text: It's all hype... and everyone will want to try hype at least once. That's exactly what we did. Ordered a Cookies N' Cream Supreme milkshake and The Greg Norman w/ onion rings to share.  The milkshake is great to look at, but as far as consuming goes - most of it will end up on the table or on your hand and napkins, just stick to the classic shake or the shake shot. The onion rings are huge and tasty, but the batter was easy to fall off.  The burger was the saving item of the entire meal.  Blue cheese and arugula made the burger taste amazing. Sadly, that was the only thing great about this place.  Prices are too high, atmosphere is too dingy, milkshakes are over-hyped, sides are mediocre and service was so-so.  I'm glad to have crossed this place off my list.

ZDNkBWBLZfAUWZ6yvHU_1w.text: We give this place a try on our last day but we were not impressed at all, the we order 3 shekes (shake-cake, cookies and cream, fruity pebble). Presentation was nice, but the shakes were watery and no flavor at all... maybe will be better next time.

6jKGsLIFTrfRW5W7E129Hw.text: Really good burger. We wanted a milkshake but couldn't couldn't get it down after the burger. But the milkshakes look great. A little pricey for what it is. That it is still really good.

jTmS5dPXIAArXAUgS03oFQ.text: We ordered a old fashioned burger, six piece of chicken wing and a milk shake. I would give 5 star for the burger but everything else was really below the expectation. Too salty or too sweet.

s1EPN3yqPA8YUm4FWpnKnQ.text: We got the American Burger w/ a fried egg & cake shake  The burger tasted amazing so did the fries & the shake!!!  The ONLY downside is the price is expensive HOWEVER since the meal can adequately feed 2 people.. I give this place 4.5 stars

nMyn93AlDNOYAwKOH9SYog.text: The only reason we give this place 2 stars is for their milkshakes. They are just as beautiful in person and very good. However, we didn't just go for dessert. We wanted to enjoy a nice dinner and the food was barely decent and extremely overpriced. They pride themselves on their gourmet burgers but they were dull in taste and not small in comparison topictures. Not to mention their $17 a pop, next to their $15 minimum price for drinks. The water they serve is warm of morning room temperature. Unhappy with the food, wouldn't go back and trek through the Venetian for it again.

Am2-108nTqGYiTXuEl9R6Q.text: I ate here for lunch during a conference, and had the Mexico City burger.  I ordered it because I love pickled jalapenos, and it was a great burger!!  I don't have much of a sweet tooth but the milkshakes looked awesome, they have a whole milkshake station in the middle of the place, pretty amazing.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7O8qRxMXTRykNwn-E6HYBw.text: For a place that calls itself a craft burger place, the burgers were a disappointment.  I ordered a wagyu burger salad and was told that they were out of wagyu... still paid the same price, though.  Three of us had burgers and we all ordered medium rare - all 3 burgers were bland hockey pucks without the slightest hint of pink to them.    Good thing we came for the crazy shakes!  I loved mine, but we did order a 2nd one and it never arrived, but by that point the person who ordered it didn't want it anymore, so all's well that ends well - but it's definitely a ball that got dropped.  I don't want to fault our server; he was very lovely.  The shake was fun, but note if you want them boozed, you have to get the liquor on the side.  (Holstein's doesn't seem to have this problem w/ their bamboozled shakes.)    So the shakes are good, but as far as burgers go, they fell far short of the mark.

fzhI75cPlOGmuqnN7JUxHQ.text: Good burgers, salads and wings.....reasonable selection of beer....overlooks the sports betting zone of the venetian casino....bar area is a good location or people watching....service could be more attentive....all and all a good place.

hl89KC4mp6yMtSOwA7thfg.text: One of the best burgers I've eaten.  Ordered with no bun and the meat (all grassfed) was so delicious!! Fun dessert that come with their own desserts on top.  Not a sugar person but they look amazing and the kids loved them.  But them burgers....yum.

lhn5hKZ9IZvaXQ4XXKcVEw.text: One of my new favorite burger places in town. Prices were a little more than I thought but way worth it. My girlfriend and I went here about a week ago for our anniversary and the staff was super nice. I got the Mexico City burger and she got the California burger. Both very good.         An to our surprises but delight we were gonna get a shake anyways; but got their special shake the Golden Knight Shake. It looked amazing and was 10 times better than it looked. With a cake puck standing on the outside of the milkshake. Overall experience there was great. Would definitely go back again !

Q8d4l9gBkcC6qfaiWcodVg.text: Great atmosphere...service...food portions are crazy big...must try the $15 milk shakes. Omg amazing..had to walk off lunch first.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You should see the one with a huge slice of cake/brownie...OMG
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black Tap Father&#39;s Day 2018 huge burger and craft beer $20
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Father&#39;s Day with my son Jeff. Oh yeah!

vacI_DlvhV3FH0W8ue6HyQ.text: We are locals to Las Vegas and heard many great things about this place. We checked it out last night and weren't disappointed. Their shakes are just as amazing as they look! Their burgers were top notch. The flavor of their hamburger patties were very tasty and cooked perfectly. My only complaint is once everything was cleared from our table after we were done, we waited and waited and the server never brought our check. We finally had to ask for it. Maybe she wasn't trying to rush us but I would have rather her drop it and say no rush.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i7RNqqtd9SQxMsqw7uf2cw.text: Workers of the restaurant are nice. The presentation of the burger plate looked great but once you ate the food I realized the pickle that came with the burger was stale had no flavor plus it wasn't cold, it felt warm at room temperature as if it had been sitting out for a couple of hours. The fries didn't have a flavor either. The lettuce tasted straight like plastic. We were a party of 4 all of our burgers, lettuce and fries just didn't taste right. The time we got seated at the restaurant was around 9pm even though it's late I don't see a reason why the food wasn't fresh especially for it being at the Venitian hotel in Vegas. Really disappointed that the next day we all woke up with stomach cramps and food poisoning. Our stay was from 6/30/19-7/3 it's sucks that during the entire stay we all felt sick during our vacation. AVOID this restaurant especially if you don't want food poisoning. $100 spent on four burgers was definitely not worth it! Not sure what all the hype of this place comes from maybe the shakes? Pretty bummed we didn't have a good food experience here.

3cz3iGCNpTl8ta-rLKh8TA.text: Went there for my daughter's birthday. Everything was great until we got our appetizers. After that we waited for a full hour before our order was brought to our table. Apparently, our order didn't "print" correctly. After being there 2.5 hours we we so rushed that we didn't even get to sing happy birthday to my daughter. Locals but definitely won't be going back.

Zsym_tRoPzJj797-YdaSdw.text: Awesome place to eat at the Venetian in Las Vegas. Extremely friendly staff. Sam, the district manage, Jose, the manager and the bartender, Connor were extremely friendly and made us feel right at home!! GREAT PLACE!!

0KUBtaLAlIB-NzTq-OOoHQ.text: Hands down best milk shake I've ever had must give these guys a try can't to much speak on the food side because I didn't order any just a min shake I will definitely be back before leaving town

Obq-ZPnRugB1hZhQPAlXFA.text: The shakes are exactly what they are cracked up to be! Beautifully made and delicious (according to my children). The food is good quality but nothing to write home about. I do recommend this place for a one time experience.

OjRTUHZSheUo-q6_yLibew.text: Get the Truffle Burger. No regrets. The flavor is incredible.  Also, the shakes are to die for - Cake Shake and Cookie Shakes were our picks. The Cake Shake is the best!

2Q8dYR8biMO4InpcTGWD7w.text: First time here, a friend wanted to try the cotton candy crazy shake. I ordered the All American burger. OMG amazing, the burger was big and juicy. I added bacon, so delicious. I wished it had mayo and regular mustard but it didn't. Still was good. I didn't care much for the fries or Arnold Palmer but the shake was good. We were seated outside, nice view and there were misters to keep u cool.  Our waitress was very friendly and knowledgeable! Definatly a must try.

bllEtwtCotT98fxyuPrOoA.text: We popped in for a quick beer and late-night snack, which they cheerfully provided. Even the sweet potato fries were good--and I don't even like sweet potato fries. The milkshakes were a little too intimidating for our state of mind at the time, but I would like to go back and try that some day. Don't know if I could avoid going all Vincent Vega on the price, but they did look good.

oJjkCH92HVIMUIqR9PCkSA.text: Wow! Outstanding place! Great decor and the most Amazing shake station you can ever see! You get to watch the Master create right before your eyes! Chili Burger is the Bomb! It was too chilly for the patio but I will be back! They have one of The Best patio dining spots on the Strip! Matt and Rachael took care of us at the bar...I LOVE being around people who Love what they do!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

KULER1W7LPZC5RkAwz54cQ.text: I was so impressed with the food and service. We took the kids, my son had the chili, daughter had the classic, both enjoyed their food (the chili is incredibly yummy!) I had the old fashioned, my husband had the Texan, both were delicious. I loved the horseradish spread that comes with the old fashioned and I ordered onion rings with mine which were giant, crispy, and delicious. We also ordered the fried pickles and fried mozzarella, the sauce for the mozzarella was a nice alternative to the standard marinara sauce, the fried pickles were also good, crispy, and light. We were so stuffed we didn't even get to the shakes, we will definitely be coming back.

90JJAimAjM9QFZnqBbs2lw.text: I've finally made it to Black Tap! I've waited for hours outside the Black Tap locations in NYC numerous times, and never actually made it inside. Imagine my surprise when I stumbled upon Black Tap inside The Venetian with no line at all! I was stuffed from my breakfast at Milk Bar, but I couldn't give up this chance for a milkshake!   I have one word: overrated. Also: disappointed.  Not worth the hype!   I ordered the Brooklyn Blackout milkshake with the cake batter milkshake Base. First of all, these milkshakes are much smaller than they look on Yelp or Instagram - they are the size of a standard milkshake, but heavy on top. Secondly, the brownies on the shake tasted like grocery store brownies. And my cake batter Base just tasted like vanilla milk.   Glad I finally got to try Black Tap, but won't be making plans to come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Blackout Milkshake - I asked for cake batter milkshake base
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Korean BBQ wings - better than the milkshakes
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brooklyn Blackout milkshake with brownies

bglJeDuHhsGY8TpOHSySTA.text: Decided to finally try Black Tap after being to several other burger spots in the strip.. the main reason was because my teens wanted the birthday cake shake, it was their birthday after all.. got there at 4:30, 5 min wait and our party of 5 was seated.  We waited 15 mins for our server to finally come and take drink orders. 15 mins later she came back with our drinks but not the shakes we ordered... umm ok. They were not overwhelmingly busy I will add.  We sat and watched tables seated AFTER us get their shakes, more important the BD Cake Shake we specifically came here for.. finally 30 mins later, food arrives, still NO shakes. I asked where they were? Servers response "oh... well... we are out of the bd cake shakes now, it's a long story, they screwed your order up." Yeah no kidding ..  So rather than her tell us oh 45 min earlier , and we saw people who came in after get the bd cake shake, she choose not to inform us earlier. My girls ordered different shakes , which like everyone said are 50% whip cream ..   If you want to over pay and have beyond terrible service come here. Holsteins has same food and great service and real shakes they don't "run" out of

ox-ZVRpi_mNe472MQi55Kw.text: Grateful we only got fries with our milkshakes. The fries were delicious and the ranch was groundbreaking. The milkshakes were well worth the detoured walk from Paris (will use the tram to get there next time). My husband and I will be sure to share a milkshake so we can order burgers next time around.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T0mnnMrmWIznqgowRIjG-Q.text: Skip the food and just get the shake! This is a spendy place for below average food. I ordered a burger and it was very dry and burnt on the outside. My boyfriend wasn't impressed with his meal either.  The shakes were good, our favorite was the cake shake.

j5atSiA9_WESEyMdS81AkQ.text: Only stopped in for a few drinks. Prices were fair considering the location, quality and quantity. Our bartender was awesome but he said he had put in his two weeks due to poor management and organization from the hostess stand. Just from watching, it didn't make sense to have people create a line and tell them there was a wait when their were plenty of tables open, inside and out on the patio and tons of waitstaff hanging around not looking very busy. Wish I had room for a milkshake! They looked awesome!

RIEUQoCOqTUA0JAuHWfE-Q.text: This Place is Perfect for KIDS and ADULTS!!! The FOOD ROCKS!  We celebrated my sons bday at the Vegas Black Tap. We had stopped by at lunch and the manager had given us a tip to come back early for dinner because of a dance convention.  Little did we know this advice was THE BEST ADVICE ever. We hd a peaceful 2 hour, leisurely dinner before the lines and the crowds came.   The food was amazing. The truffle burger is to die for. And the milkshakes are EPIC. The manager even let my son (bday boy) and his sister make their OWN milkshakes and showed them personally how they do it!  Level of service and manager are off the charts. I LOVE this place. Bravo.

Qm8cs9Cv8sYxh8OzFY0wng.text: Burgers and shakes were very good (5stars for the food). BUT our server, BRIAN, gave terrible service. Pretty much lied to us that we cannot do separate checks even though we heard another server ask the table beside us if they wanted separate checks. Then Brian, when separating the checks, made it seem so difficult. We had to manually count all the items ourselves when it could have easily been done on the computer. I feel like this guy has no idea what he was doing and made our first time at Black Tap irritating.

bHYCP3D53INi3Lgd4qdl5g.text: My friends and I visited this location twice on our current trip to Vegas. One night for dinner and the next for dessert. We all agreed that dinner was just okay and felt that we should come back another time to see how the milkshakes were.  My sister and I ordered the California burger and she said her turkey patty tasted like it had too much fennel, kind of like a sausage patty. I got mine with beef and found the truffle mayo to be way too rich and overpowering. The fries were great but onion rings weren't. A friend got the chicken sandwich and enjoyed it, minus the coleslaw which was overloaded with dill, as is their ranch. Their fresh pickles were refreshing. Another friend got the all American burger and said it tasted good, pretty basic...kind of like America.   The next night (tonight 7/10/18) we had milkshakes. We came in around 10:30 and were seated behind the milkshake bar. Our waiter was nice and present (at first) and recommended we share two milkshakes. He told us we should order the cake milkshake as it was going to probably sell out soon. He's good. Later, after delivery of said milkshakes, he fell off of the face of the earth. We had to ask someone else to find him for us.   THIS IS WHERE IT GETS UNCOMFORTABLE...  He returns with a wrinkly ass receipt that he for some reason does NOT want to hand over and just kind of holds it in front of us with a bs story about "you guys ordered basically the same thing as another table and I closed out their tab on accident and it's pretty much the same price so will you be paying in cash today?" We all looked at each other a little confused and flustered but he still wouldn't hand over the receipt. He tried giving us a rough price estimate of the milkshakes we got and how it was pretty much the same as theirs. Then we gave him cash and he just sat there saying "are we good?" Aka can I keep your change. Hate when waiters do that! He walks to another table after taking our change and puts it in his pocket. We were given no receipt, which would have been nice since we are here for work and would have liked to comp it. We're not dumb. We know what he was doing.   He was a hefty Caucasian man with a beard and a backwards hat. Maybe management would like to ask him about it sometime.

JY8Fb7_xBGibbZ_N3jbDGw.text: I came in on a Thursday night and this place was PACKED. We had to wait about 20-30 minutes for a table.  I got their sweet n' salty shake. This thing was decked out with M&Ms on the rim and had a decadent flavor of peanut butter with chocolate. I really liked it but there's no way I would've been able to finish it. It's a lot to handle.  I also had a side of onion rings with chipotle mayo. The sauce was excellent. I really liked the pairing.  The service was great. My server was very friendly and continually checked up on us during our dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MQmm0YDgYG-QMyuKJw5VOA.text: Really great burgers, salads, and chicken sandwiches. Fries were nothing special though. Cookie shake was delish and enough to share. Very loud, and the way the rooms and seating are it's like you're in a tunnel and the loudest echo. Good service. Will be back.

1PqM8s6LAZM66QB2lOsLgQ.text: Cool atmosphere and the drinks are vey insta worthy. But the drinks are way too sweet and the food isn't the best.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GjI5AD_yuugrX6IqeK9Prw.text: This was such a fun place to try! Kinda on the expensive side but so worth the experience. The shakes are so fun and SO sugary. We had a blast

54tqKHJ4FAjld0nDt31iBw.text: We visited this place on our last night around 8pm on a Saturday. There was line outside that had us like (insert wide emoji) but as luck would have it two seats opened up at the bar. We were helped quickly and with smiles which always makes me happy. The menu is straight to the point which is also a plus. I got the Mule which was just okay(more liquor please this is VEGAS!) and we ordered the All American and the Truffle burger. These burgers remind me of Shake Shack with the bun and accoutrements but they have way more beef so def a difference. The fries were hot and crispy and plentiful. We both ordered crazy shakes spiked. I got the birthday cake flavor and the bf got the Oreo cookie version. This was both exciting and a little bit of a let down. First they brought out a shake that did not have alcohol(which one of the servers discovered before I had a chance to taste it), then once I got the spiked shake it had a weird taste to it. We had agreed on vanilla Absolut but as it turned out someone added red berry Ciroc. Vanilla ice cream does not go well with red berry ciroc . Overall I think this place is cute and the food is good. There is music and televisions around the bar area. I would return and simply skip the alcohol in my dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cake Crazy Shake spiked

cJ_DC8RmokGVLIi2TGqZrg.text: Everything from the food to the staff was absolutely amazing! The fried pickles and the Korean chicken wings were the best I have and not to mention the amazing burgers! Special thanks to Cody who is the chef, thanks for the amazing service! Definitely recommend everyone to give this place a visit!

7Fhi-CdP_ZHkmqPcER3kIA.text: Friendly staff and great food. The portions are shareable. I ordered the Mexican Burger, Mozzarella sticks and an Oreo shake.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

OMvm99Vg-lK12l5bVxjIEw.text: My husband saw a video of the birthday cake shake on fb and didn't stop talking about it for months. We finally had a Sunday free and stopped at Black Tap for lunch. My husband and daughter had the Birthday Cake shake and we're not disappointed! They were sweet and sugar overload! We had the western burger and onion rings. The burgers were great. The onion rings were huge and hard to eat. Large for shock value I imagine. Won't order them next time. $90 lunch was a bit expensive but we had a good time.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Xe7vtNmfzI6ImO1UjqDaDw.text: Nice place! Delicious and fresh food! Friendly and super helpful staff! I sat outside with my wife so that we can look at the Canal! It was beautiful!

Zus0PRwTlTV0c04tFUjBLg.text: Had such a great experience here. Hanging out and waiting for a friend who was playing and I was starving. Staff is AWESOME! Everyone goes out of their way to take care of you, make sure your food is perfect and that you are having the best time. This is always my stop here while I'm at the Venetian. I will always come back!

nx4hxFV7GY8Hp7wsiXSfMQ.text: We went here for the Oreo shake! It is worth the experience. But wasn't that great to make me want to go back, the only thing I would go back is to try the food instead of the dessert. This place is one of those must come to Vegas and get an experience in. Service was amazing tho we sat at the bar!

Y8xsRnwFScRJvNIH6_cg-A.text: It was good.  The burger and the shake were both really good but wow were they expensive.  I know it's the strip so its not going to be cheap but unless you're in the mood to drop some money, steer clear.

AhGi5pMCs5Ikho9_NRX6rw.text: We were here for the world of concrete convention with a few of our friends in January. We were seated quickly even though the place was busy. I had asked our server for a sweet cocktail and he brought over the Elderflower Froze. AMAZING! We asked for two milkshakes something fun, and something chocolate. He brought over the Cake shake and the Brooklyn Blackout. MINDBLOWING. I also noticed that he was bussing other people's tables and helping everyone out. Our servers name was Josh. He was great! He had amazing recommendations, and always had a smile. We all had a spectacular experience and will be returning next time we are in town.

kepblacYzS5BCWTiWTfLNw.text: Many mixed reviews here. Our experience was very good. Bailey was our server and her customer service was excellent. Our burgers and sweet potato fries also very good. The fancy shake which is not really my thing but it's the experience. Everyone else enjoyed theirs. We will return.

mxTNkUSdXASxXv1KnFvcmA.text: Wow oh wow.... I would like to say it's the worst $30 burger I've had... But it was just the worst, hands down. So we had the fried pickles and fried mozzarella both of which were good. The burger is where things went vastly wrong!! The Buns was completely soaked and soggy on all four of my groups hamburgers. The fries were good and a generous portion as well, but no one wants to eat fries alone as a meal! So as we ALL ate our burgers bun less with knife and fork, we noticed other patrons doing the same. We then asked for a side of ranch and BBQ, which came in tiny, quarter full cups, that we were charged $1 each for. Would have berm nice for the server to mention this. In addition, the menu Says gluten free Buns are a $2 substitution which is fine because one of us has a gluten allergy but they charged us $4. In After this our server never seemed to return to check on us, refill drinks or take our desert order (restaurant weeks prefix menu) I had the Mexico city burger, done medium. The meat itself was fine, flavorless, but fine, but was paired with soggy (like the bun, notice a theme here?) onion rings and pickled japenos that had no spice but still tasted strongly of vinegar, almost as if the pickling process was not finished. A friend had the BBQ bacon with what appeared to be uncooked onion rings, but likely just soggy. After 30 minutes of asking around for our server, we were able to order our shakes.... Black cherry, coffee, cookies and cream....which all tasted like VANILLA, with minimal distinction in color difference. A fourth shake was not ordered because they have no gluten free shakes, a substitute was not offered. As we all began tasting each others confused as to why the black cherry and coffee ice cream looked and tasted the same... Both like vanilla!! And we were so  ready to leave. I realize server's live off tips so we still left 15% but truly I wanted to leave nothing. I will never return and encourage others not to try. Go to the burger bar instead, it's delightful!

KsMaYeJuM6mS0ZHGVQqWgA.text: We ate at this place 2 times and ordered 'to go' one time during our 2 day stay at the Venetian this summer.  I live for a good burger and this was one of the best I've ever had. I ordered sweet potato fries to eat in my room one afternoon to snack on and I can't even describe these fries; perfectly crisp on the outside, moist and flavorful inside; huge... fries! The shake was more of a fun experience but it was tasty as well. We ordered the shake with peanut butter cups on it and pretzels sticking in it; it also had a sugar daddy sucker stuck in it.  So much fun and such a wonderful memory.  We will definitely be back to the Black Tap during our Vegas stay next summer.  No sense of trying to top these burgers shakes and fries... This is the best!

8o1DclsKCTzMbQCiPAVYMA.text: Bad service, server didnt inform us of any extra charges in our order, food took too long to arrive and was overcooked, someone who i assume was the manager came out to say sorry but that was it, no discount or anything offered for the bad experience, wont be coming back.

P6Rbicv9LxV5pZA45tQJTw.text: We don't go to the Strip usually with the family but tried the food at a booth at Uncorked. It started off with us sitting in a line for an hour, because they don't take reservations. We were a party of six so we kept getting passed up by groups of four, who happened to be placed in booths that could handle six (two adults, two tweens, and two babies). It felt like we were inconveniencing the hostesses. When we finally got seated we realized that there was nothing to order for the kids. The Yelp site says kid friendly but we had to purchase an adult hamburger as the only thing that made sense for children. There is nothing specific for kids and the waiter made it seem like this was a common issue. The deserts looked amazing and we ended up purchasing several adult sizes to share because there was nothing child size. The overall service was very much lacking but the burger and deserts were delicious. As a local we will never come back nor recommend this to visitors, because an hour wait for poor service and good food at Strip prices doesn't make sense. Unfortunate, because we came specifically because of Uncorked.

99sK59F7-9u3Hvqa9cp9yQ.text: Really good beer . Friendly servers and the falafel burger hit the spot. Nice music as well

2pdcdftPwKUecfYyaxhIDw.text: New to Yelp, and wanted to post this a few weeks ago but have been traveling. I'm in Las Vegas quite a bit for work, and generally try to stay off the tourist track but agreed to go when a childhood friend who lives in town suggested it. I must admit, this place is the perfect Vegas spot for good, affordable food, and surprisingly, even though kid friendly, an edgy vibe. We started off with Wings, and then had the All American Burgers, which were OUTSTANDING! Not the cheapest burgers in town but they were very good. Also semi surprisingly was the beer choices. Some really solid draft beers to go along with the food. Then, when we were about to throw in the towel, the GM, a NY transplant named JP, sold us on a couple of shakes that, while a bit too much for one person, were absolutely the best shakes you'll ever have. Overall, a great experience. Good music (maybe a bit loud), service was pretty good and JP kept coming around, making sure we were having a good time, which to me is how a place should work. Lots of choices out there but I'm back next time I'm in Vegas. Bravo Black Tap.

h3x8jhR4FNSOoV3eaFIGxQ.text: I was so excited to try this restaurant out, mainly for their milkshakes! I have seen their milkshakes on instagram for a while now and they are huge and look so tasty! We went on a weekend and there was NO wait which is amazing for a strip property restaurant. For our appetizer we ordered the mozzarella sticks... it was the best sticks we've ever had! The mozzarella sticks tasted so fresh and the dip complimented it very well. We ordered for our main meal two chicken sandwiches for about $18 dollars each with two sides of sweet potato fries. The chicken sandwiches were so basic and there was no wow factor. For dessert they had a special going on for Chinese New Year that we got and it tasted so basic too, vanilla ice cream with a sugar cookie and golden chocolate coins. We came for the milkshakes and were very disappointed. Our bill came to over $120 and we left un satisfied and we won't be back. :(

1z7XRB-a7ZV7z5AQOYZDrQ.text: Came here for the crazy milkshake.  I got the oreo one.  I shared it with my bf. Three shake looked and treated awesome.  Well worth the experience.

cBZ6w6ZzMGdl6qbLR2EHhg.text: I had dinner here the other night after seeing it open for some time. I have been to a few other burger places around town (Gordon Ramsey, Holsteins, etc.) and this is my new favorite on the Strip. I went with the 'Greg Norman' Wagyu beef burger. It was outstanding! Perfectly cooked and very flavorful. The fries were awesome as well. I was happy I didn't get a milkshake as I could barely finish the meal. So damn full!! The only surprise are the prices but it is right on the Strip so it is right on par with other similar restaurants. The best part of the meal was a visit by the manager John! He stopped by to make sure everything was up to standard. He was very personable and takes pride in the restaurant. As usual, it was crazy busy in the restaurant and for me it means a lot when someone take the time to ensure you are pleased with the food, especially at restaurants on the strip. It was a great experience! Next time I come back I will get a milkshake! They look ridiculous!!

etkDKQBEaryjaSmSZXAErw.text: I live in NY and have been to Black Tap here. The shakes look the same but in NY they are much better tasting. They weren't bad in Vegas but if you're in NY check out Black Tap there.

lnunwZsyMxBXjujXzUunyQ.text: Had such a good time at Black Tap with my girlfriends. We were seated outside which had an amazing view of the Las Vegas strip over looking the Gondola canal. Nathan was awesome. Came over to our table to greet us upon arrival and sent drinks to the table. We tried their specialty Mule, highly recommended. Also recommend the fried pickles and Texan burger. Service was excellent. Very attentive. We were able to try every milkshake on the menu. WOW! The presentation and detail of these desserts are unexplainable, not to mention super yummy! We had a great time. Black Tap did not disappoint. Will definitely be back. Thank you!

MmUIUS7S0d15pdG2Vq7OJg.text: I went here last week for my birthday with my daughter and brother . The server was really sweet and attentive she was young with glasses . Anyways I ordered some drink with ginger in it , something mule ? It was horrible and really overpowering . I returned the drink and the waitress was really understanding and took it back . Little did the bartender know I was a table right next to the bar. I heard her complaining about this was her second drink sent back , saying duhhh it comes with that, tasting the drink with a straw and being a little insensitive , but that's okay , I understand everyone has bad days . She did seem to be more interested with the buss boys who she was all touchy with , which was a little awkward for me to watch next to my 3 year old daughter . Fast forward to the burgers , I ordered the truffle burger and I thought it was super good , a little pricey for what I received but I can't complain , I did enjoy it . Now to the shakes , I got the cake batter one which was absolutely amazing! My brother got the chocolate shake and I have to say, that was the best part of the meal and I have no problem paying $15 dollars  per shake. the restaurant it's self was clean and had a cool ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ZVHnWgfDDBbmy-KDZ7y0RA.text: I was super excited to try this place I've seen videos of their shakes/burgers at their NY location and was happy to see it coming here! When I arrived I waited about five minutes when a hostess came up and offered a countertop type seating which was fine bc it's across the sports book so we could at least watch the game while eating. We ordered queso dip to start, and each our own burgers. 20/25 minutes later our burgers came but no appetizer, we informed our server and she said they've been having kitchen mess-ups so she would check on it. We decided we would cancel I.T since our meal was pretty filling, I.T came out as soon as we informed her but they gave I.T to us and took I.T off our bill. All in all, burger was good, good amount of fries I.T totaled out to $46 (including one iced tea, we got special sauce for fries $1 charge for each) cool atmosphere but I can't justify the price when you can get the same quality burgers at five guys for a cheaper price! Nonetheless great place for a casual date night!

pbOzx2eXBQkSZ3M1_GmaEw.text: 10/10 reccomend the chili cheese burger. Satisfied every bit of my cravings. The cotton candy shake too was perfecto. Had a great time with family and an excellent server to start until he had to switch and someone else took over. Besides the menu being pricey (which is normal for eating just about ANYWHERE on the strip) and the sauces costing an extra dollar each I overall had a great experience from meal to atmosphere. Came on a Thursday evening around 5:00. Very friendly staff and had a booth ready when we came in. Would love to come back again soon.

-uaRLF7mvDMBwkWgANAKUw.text: My boyfriend and I have visited black tap twice and they are constantly amazing. The food and service is always on point. This last time we ate at the bar with Leo and he made the experience so memorable. If visiting or looking for a great place to eat in Vegas black tap is a must!

HOiwCExD1J55MfleaqHr-A.text: Only came here because my wife went to the one in NYC, went there for the shakes and it was amazing, it has a nice view of the front of the Venetian and the Gondolas, and shakes were awesome.

3GMNG8vz7plNAMf3nZ14_Q.text: I was very disappointed in this place. I'm local so wanted to try out the food. Saw it on our local channel.  Well the service was horrible.  They screwed up our order completely.  Charged us for the wrong sauce for our burger (They brought the correct one. But charged us for their mistake). Charged fir extra dressing on the salad!! The burgers were ok, nothing like the picture on the menu, or what I saw on TV,  that they presented. Honestly not a great burger at all. Had to wait forever for our food. There are so many great burger places in Vegas. But not here. We won't go back or recommend this place to our friends and family who visit.

E1ClmsTdPThh56gd0D1DxQ.text: Terrible food and service. Seated at bar. Had to wait until area was clear of dishes and wiped down. Many spots open but not cleared. Ordered burger salad  - never asked how I would like burger cooked. Came out raw and cold. So disappointing!

LDheAKyGtLA3i5KIvg79ug.text: I came, I saw, I ate the cotton candy milkshake. It was super sweet and worth the purchase! Definitely recommend sharing it because it was too large to eat by myself. The waiter was sweet enough (get it? Lol) to change the base flavor of the shake to something I liked. Plus it was an Instagram worthy pic to boot!

5PNR6sZOfATEhLsrxJTxGQ.text: Went here specifically for the milkshakes because i saw the tempting signs during my entire stay at the Venetian! My husband and I split the vanilla cookie shake. It was delish! It came with tons of whipped cream and several real chocolate chip cookies. Once we finally got down to the shake portion it was filled with creamy vanilla once cream. Definitely worth the $15 dollars!

nHM8YY2FBUmEVfB3wj8zAQ.text: Located inside of the Venetian hotel right by the sports book. A hidden gem. Vegan/Vegetarian options.. an extensive alcohol menu & don't forget plenty of giant shakes to choose from!! Music here is typically great. Seating is nice, definitely a 'must' here on the strip. Love this place!! The ovAnother bonus is the Venetian is one of the hotels still offering free parking!

WSXTjjymJ22zGcMuhfXXFg.text: The service wasn't awesome but we had a blast sitting outside and enjoying our Saturday night. Recommend it just off the environment. A place to take your friends and eat great burgers and drink fun shakes.

QdsmWw7hQGMBsE5ud-Pbhw.text: Read about this place and their crazy milkshakes online so had to check it out one night. After debating a few options on the menu, we went with the cookies 'n cream shake and an order of onion rings (sweet and salty, right??). The shake was overall monsterous and looked just like I'd seen it depicted in so many pictures. It was a delicious mix of Oreos, whipped cream, ice cream, and a cookie-wich. The biggest complaint would be the ratio of whipped cream to milkshake - I needed more shake in my life. The onion rings were crispy and piping hot, but super thick cut with a batter that kept falling off. I liked how light the batter was and the sauces that came with the rings, but kind of a mess to eat sitting at the bar! Definitely worth stopping by to share a shake with a friend or loved one - I wouldn't recommend trying to eat it all on your own!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Oreo milkshake

MztZRT0q_NaJBZ_JcKcEVQ.text: Plant-based review, no meat burger or dairy shake ordered. Although this place is known for their unique fun shakes or tasty meat burgers, I didn't order either and still had a pretty good experience here.   ORDERED * Vegan Burger & Quinoa Bowl (black bean patty, kale, cucumber, avocado, salsa verde, cilantro, lemon dressing, pickled onions) * Crispy Brussels Sprouts (sesame-tahini sauce)  PROS  + Both items ordered were absolutely delicious + Fun, atmosphere and it being inside The Venetian is a huge plus + Entertaining to watch the barista create the funky shakes   CONS - A bit pricey in my opinion. I think it was around $16 for the salad and $10 for the appetizer but then again this is on the Las Vegas strip - I asked for an extra dressing to-go and they charged me $1 - Waitress overcharged us on accident so we had to wait an extra 15 - 20  minutes for her to resolve the issue  Being a Vegas local I typically eat off the strip since there are so many amazing places to choose from. The food here was very tasty but I don't think I would go out of my way to dine here again since their vegan options are extremely limited.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brussel sprouts - perfect amount of crisp and seasoning

9urCbPnCiVGLTLvylXjwHQ.text: So so flavorless burger. When you order the Mexican burger you think you would have some spice. Very bland. The pepper jack cheese (I'm not sure if that's what I got) provided nothing. Chipotle mayo....nothing. Disappointing. Also, all burgers come medium or well done. I ordered well done and got medium. I did have a tasty beer and the shakes look amazing but I will eat elsewhere.

RDdDJdQZYhr86It1TBilrA.text: My husband and I stopped in for lunch here on our trip, we had already been to a nearby competitor with a similar concept so we kind of knew what to expect. I had the falafel burger and hubby had the pizza burger. He didn't love the pizza burger's sauce, he said it tasted like tomato paste but the burger was good. My falafel burger had a little bit of a burnt aftertaste and the feta was very dry (not flavorful and moist like I'm used to).   We also ordered a cookie shake and Oreo shake, the cookie chipwich that was included was way too hard to eat as the cookies are bagged ones that get hard when they touch cold. Not very desirable. They also overdo it on the whipped cream, which is pretty but hard to get to the actual shake..  We wouldn't necessarily rush back honestly. It was decent but not excellent

GnUlL3nGK2TZt6BWbYGTIg.text: Ummmmm yum is all I can say.   I ended up here because of the ridiculous milkshakes I saw on their IG and the hotel menu.   One thing I will say is don't go during the busy times or you will stand in the "club line". Lol. It's literally a roped line you stand in outside of the restaurant until it's your turn to come in like the club.   The place is small and quaint and has a nice patio area.   The food was really good and fairly priced for the portions. ($80 for an order of onion rings which were phenomenal, a salad, burger, and milkshake) And I love the fact that they serve Wagyu Beef.   The only reason I did not give this place 5 stars was because of my milkshake. Even though it was good it did not quite look like all the pics. Which was kind of disappointing.   But it was ok because it was still good, my food was good, and the service was great. So I can overlook the fact that I didn't get an IG pic milkshake.    Try it out though. You won't be disappointed.

qTYueIbMqSpxSrviXFV5eA.text: So good as anticipated. Texan bbq burger cooked to perfection with sweet potato fries. Oreo Scream Milkshake was to die for till last drop. Service was on point. Would go again and again on another Vegas vacation!

5tGKpljgz_XtTCGTJkK3lw.text: Poor service and mediocre food.  Our server was barely there even when he was standing in front of us.   If you try to order food for a kid... they'll charge $9 to melt some cheese on a hamburger bun and call it a grilled cheese. The best part is when they hand the plate to your 5 year old and it has a sharp knife on the plate.  Luckily I was quicker than him and was able to grab it first.    Lastly, the shakes are purely for fun. Don't expect them to taste good. They're a runny mess. The only really good thing about my meal was the sweet potato fries.  At $100 to feed 3 adults and one little boy... choose anywhere else. Definitely not worth the money.

3QEZr6j8aV8cwOQ7gjE1LQ.text: First visit and I started with a cakeshake. If you like funfetti birthday cake you'll absolutely love this shake! It's a shake that tastes just like cake batter with a slice of funfetti cake sitting on top. It was like a birthday party in my mouth.  I ordered the Texan burger cooked medium and fries. The burger was flavorful with a side of sweet baby rays bbq sauce. The fries were crispy but soft, pretty perfect if you ask me. I personally didn't care much for the pickle but the onion ring was really good.  Did I mention the shake?!?! OH M GEEEE!!  Service was good. Our server was pleasant and personable. A few people stopped by to check on us which was nice.  I'm only giving 4 stars because my beer wasn't all that cold. I got the Firestone 805 blonde but I wish it were colder.  I wish they would put one of these away from the strip, like Henderson or Town Square.

e36rhHMrc70f21oYnPKgtg.text: Oh my word! The shakes here were delectable! They come out Instagram worthy and are super delicious. I recommend sharing the shake with someone though. It is way too much sugar for one person. I had a burger salad too and it was tasty as well. It is a popular spot so you may have to wait for a seat, but I would say it is worth the wait.

BG48GhGVIG_Qwx1GQkVt2w.text: We chose to sit at the bar. There were two bar stools towards the left end which gave us a nice view of the restaurant.  It was busy with people coming in and out, waiters and waitresses busily moving about and a barista who was multitasking like a boss!  Black Tap is located in The Venetian Hotel.  The amazing, beautifully designed Venetian hotel. It's a great place to have dinner and dessert. They cater to meat lovers, vegetarians, and vegans.  They specialize in alcoholic beverages that are uniquely named and described which helps you to know exactly what you're getting yourself in to.   I ordered the House-Made Falafel Burger salad which is a falafel patty that sits on top of a bed of lettuce, cucumber chunks, tomatoes, kalamata olives, hummus, feta, pickled onions, and a hearty drizzle of tahini dressing.  I also added a side of avocado because salads for me aren't complete without them.  This salad was big enough to share between two men with hungry appetites. It was huge. Definitely worth the price. The dressing was amazing. The taste of the falafel, however, was a little disappointing. It was a bit dry and tasteless and the feta overpowered the salad.  Next time I'll know to ask for the feta on the side.  My Idaho fries with their truffle mayo dip were delicious! I devoured those.  With all of the drinks to choose from I was overwhelmed so I let hubby choose for me.  He ordered a ginger, pineapple drink that was non-alcoholic.  It was really tasty, smooth and refreshing.    Their shake bar is out of this world!  If you love shakes you'll do yourself a favor by checking out their menu before you go so you'll know what shake you're going to fill your belly with.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yum!
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love how fresh the avocado was.
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Falafel burger salad.

nqVG_vUA9wF_2cpH78RxFw.text: Was coming back down the strip, and made a pitstop into the Venetian for a quick bite to eat. But where should you eat when you're at the Venetian?  Came across black tap and recognized that this was the Burger Mecca that I have been in search of! On the menu are over 20 burgers, some of Las Vegas's best french fries, onion rings and fried pickles, and don't get me started on a 2,000+ calorie milkshake.  But let's go there... Black Tap has some of the best looking milkshakes ever (and I've seen some pretty awesome places with some pretty awesome milkshakes!) They're a bit pricey at almost $20 a shake, so know this much... your burger is going to cost you about $20 and a milkshake will set you back $20, so with tip you're probably looking at $50 per person which isn't inexpensive for a hamburger and a milkshake. But this is no burger shack or Shake Shack for that matter, the burgers are awesome!  Had The au poivre hamburger with some French fries (I'm all in France  , you here me?!?) Also sampled the all American... both out of this world. So if your looking for an awesome burger... Welcome home!  Only DISAPPOINTMENT was the lousy napkins that are in a cheap diner style on table top dispenser. For $20 a burger, you could/should get cloth napkins!!!  Here's the rundown:  Satisfied? Yes  Return? Yes  Advocate? Yes

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crappy napkins... Seriously, for $20 a burger can we get cloth napkins? Everything is awesome @ Black Tap (except these crappy napkins!!!)
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice assortment of condiments... Make your own Sriracha ketchup
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The au poivre hamburger and fries... awesome!

MOTk4jVKbWwJfLOGJdNtVw.text: We had the Cookie and the Cookies & Cream shake. We stood in line for 30 minutes to be seated.  The music was bumping and loud.   The shakes were tasty and big. My son and wife really liked the shakes. I thought they were very good and fresh. We only ordered the shakes, but we will return for more.

p3SsL3D9FZBO2zhdwReu2Q.text: Decided to try this place for a friend's birthday, we were all very excited to go after hearing about the crazy milkshakes and the decadent burgers.  Pros:  -We went after 9pm so we were able to bypass any long lines on a Friday night (they don't take reservations) -The outdoor seating has a beautiful view, the weather was nice and there were misters. -The shake was picture perfect and really good to share with a group of 4($15, $8 for an extra shot added) -Nice large assortment of beers and cocktails  Cons: -Service wasn't great, waited an unreasonable amount of time for the check at the end of our meal  -Pretty expensive, while the burgers were just ok ($17-22, we ordered the pizza burger, the falafel burger, the texan burger, and the chicken sandwich)

wcZHZ9ejXUt1pC3pYN8i3Q.text: "That Shake Cray..."  No surprise I had to try this informal 90's hip hop vibes restaurant for lunch after numerous Facebook ads!   The tables are pretty close together so I opted for a seat at the bar for extra elbow space. The playlist is epic! You can't help but rock out to some Biz Markie, Nas etc.   Vegan Black Bean Burger $16 was a lot better than I anticipated and I'm grateful restaurants are more accommodating!   Cookies & Cream Supreme Shake $15 This playful shake is overdressed with whip cream and the remainder of the glass is a "liquid like" consistency! The overall taste was okay but the crushed Oreos around the glass taste like refrigeration. This shake has potential but definitely needs some work!! (Holsteins shakes at The Cosmo are by far one of the best shakes on the strip!)

Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Helpful Tip: Across from sports-book and poker room
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Craft Vegan Black Bean Burger $16

9k4zHdzDNi5-twM5LD-SiA.text: This is a "must"!  We stopped after dinner (and "O"... also a must) so sadly I had to pass on the Cake Shake. Saw others digging in .... oh, my word!  They said it was great, and it certainly looked that way. Had the coffee shake (as if that in some way showed restraint) and it was the creamiest ever.  The coffee flavor was perfection. My husband said the cookie shake was great also. The man next to us had a burger (I'm vegetarian so can't comment on that) and the most impressive onion rings I've ever seen.   Service was great. Friendly atmosphere. One word:  GO!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Coffee and cookie shakes.

dXPmjfxDLym3LDT-gA8Gwg.text: Finally got to try this place! For an appetizer we shared wings and brussel sprouts! For dinner I got the crispy chicken sandwich (Korean bbq sauce) with onion rings instead of fries and a Churro Choco Taco shake for dessert!!  All of it was absolutely delicious! I can't wait to go back and try some of their more adventurous menu items

Xga4Z8a19xCmh4o4qYwk6A.text: Located in the Venetian, it was a good time to visit bringing an out of town guest.  We arrived early for lunch so there was no wait to be seated. Since the weather was perfect, we chose to sit in the patio dining area.  It's shaded with umbrella's to keep you comfortable.  The patio is also great to view the strip and watch the gondola's float by.    My friend and I shared the Bison Burger as well as the Baja Grilled Chicken Sandwich.   The bison was fantastic.  It's topped with fresh mozzarella, pesto mayo, arugula, shaved parmesan and roasted tomatoes.  I would not hesitate to order this again.    The chicken sandwich did not disappoint.  The chicken has a cajun season and then topped with avocado, salsa, bacon, pepper jack and chipotle mayo.  Tons of flavor and totally satisfying.  Each sandwich is served with an abundant amount of fries.  The sandwich plates could really be shared especially if you plan on ordering one of their signature shakes!  Speaking of shakes, wow.  Get ready to be floored by the amount of ingredients they can fit into one shake.  I was already stuffed from lunch but I couldn't pass up trying the Sweet N Salty shake. They frost the rim with chocolate so M&M's can be stuck to it.  The peanut butter shake has pretzel rods, a sugar daddy, whipped cream and chocolate drizzle.  There are 8 Crazyshakes which they feature on the menu but also have an additional shake for the month.  It's a splurge that is completely worth the calories.    Thanks Blacktap for showing us how Vegas does it!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Bison Burger
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baja Grilled Chicken Sandwich W/sweet potato fries
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet N Salty

ohxsBNbY_l-zEnHaRDwiyg.text: My friends and I were at Palazzo/Venetian for Restaurant Week at Delmonico's. One of our friends had mentioned Black Tap for huge shakes. We had decided to come check it out after lunch. There was a small line waiting outside the poker area. We had walked up to ask how to wait was and it was quoted to be around 15 minutes. We were called in maybe less than 5 minutes and were sat in the back in a booth. The booth was a bit squished for 6 people. Not really squished in length, but space between seat and table. Not for the fluffy. HAHA   Since we were pretty full, we decided to get 1-2 shakes to share between the 6 of us. Especially since we were told they were HUGEEE (quoting a friend... "2-3x the size of steak & shakes").... yeah it isnt LOL fyi !  We had ordered "The Cakeshake" and a "Brooklyn Blackout"  The "Brooklyn Blackout" is a chocolate shake w/ chocolate frosted rim w/ mini chocolate chips topped w/ two chocolate brownies, whipped cream, and chocolate drizzle.   HOLY CHOCOLATE ! AND INSTA-DIABETES ! SO SWEET ! And the brownies were as hard as a rock !   "The Cakeshake" is a cake batter shake w/ vanilla frosted rim w/ rainbow sprinkles topped w/ a funfetti cake slice, whipped cream, rainbow sprinkles, and a cherry.   The cake on here was MUCH better than the brownies on the brooklyn blackout, but it was just as sweet  Overall, REALLLLY sweet place. Yeah its a dessert. Its supposed to be sweet. But damn.... Even between the 6 of us, we barely finished 1/2 of each shake. Even on the way out, I did NOT see a single shake finished. Most at best, 1/2 done as well with the "cake topping" 1/2 done too...   Oh, about the size, they are definitely NOT huge. same size as steak and shake, in terms of amount of milkshake, if not even less. its only "HUGE" in terms of size, because of the "cake topping".   The shakes are definitely "FOR THE GRAM" and that's about it. LOL Thank god for the water they give you. OH they use these cute little small mason jars for water cups. But anyway, thank god for the water.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cakeshake and brooklyn blackout

hMwWVo1ZFbQKMIQn2IuP0g.text: This was our second trip to Black Tap and our first time getting one of their famous milkshakes.  With this being my wife's birthday, she really wanted to take advantage of us playing hookie from work we went and had lunch.   I believe because it was a Monday and we got there after the lunch hour, we were able to walk in. The greeter staff was very nice and laid back. We sat next to the bar were some folks were hanging out. The dessert bar is the center piece of the layout where you have a front row seat to see your milkshake masterpiece being built.  The decor is great, there are booth, tables and even a few enclaves for seating.  Food, so amazing!!!!, my advice is if your going to get a milkshake, share!!!! I promise you will not leave hungry.   The restaurant has a DJ booth so on weekend it looks like a late night place to hang. There is seating outside on the strip and being located at the Venetian, there is great people watching and activity to see.   In the end, I think for the amount you pay for the the amount you get, Black Tap is a great value and a cool unique place to have some time out of the Vegas sun and hang out.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Vo5N8Pe8zSt88vyiCDpJvg.text: Really extravagant, delicious milkshake. A must try when you're in vegas!!  We got the birthday cake milkshake but they all looked delicious. We were not disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday cake milkshake. Amazing

9Y6ctXoe27Q7s2gEf-SKjA.text: came with a big group and they were able to take us for dinner before a show. The service is friendly (they let us split the check into 4 different bills as it was a mom and daughter weekend and there were 6 sets of us).   burgers are great... juicy and big. there are a lot of options, so it was a little hard to decide. The fries that come with it are nice too.  The star is the freak milkshake, I got the cake shake and the cake was really good (surprisingly) and the milkshake was delectable, delicious, and decadent. Ice cream is my weakness and while I had a few bites of the cake and shared with the rest of the group, I finished that milkshake with no problems. It was the star!

rUTpMuSWR6IlF6Srh91tvg.text: Loved the vibe of the place!  Saw this place on my Instagram so when in Vegas I had to try it. Mostly for the shakes and boy were we not disappointed. That's one of the things this place is famous for. They have many options and average at $15 a shake. You could definitely share one they are huge! I loved the art throughout the restaurant. They have a bar and an outside patio. We didn't try the food but it looked just as good. There was a wait but it wasn't bad. Would definitely recommend during your trip to Vegas. It is located in the Venetian hotel.

Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churro Choco Taco shake and Cookies &amp; Cream Supreme Shake
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bar

PZTGfz0UT8z7NXTCKz5f1g.text: Nothing more disappointing than waiting a whole year to try this place and finally coming here and it was basic!!! I followed their Instagram page and obsessed over how amazing everything looks and now I'm just disappointed.   Ordered the fried chicken sandwich and the cookie shake. My friend ordered the churro shake and a burger.  Both of us can agree the fries were soggy. Our whole group of 4 people didn't finish it. The chicken sandwich was probably one of the worst I've ever tried and I'm a huge chicken sandwich person. Had no taste, very bland.  The churros on the shake were super hard. My friends couldn't even eat them. The chocolate taco that comes on it was soggy af. The cookie shake was a complete joke. Presentation was amazing but the shake was the most bland and basic thing I've ever tried. I'd honestly get a shake from McDonald's than ever come back here.  Let's not even mention the prices. Good lord 15 dollars for a shit shake. Maybe if the shake was actually delicious but the shake was soooo bland. Literally don't understand why the price is so high.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soggy taco and hard churros
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not as good as it looks, fried chicken
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Looks good but tastes like nothing

eGSCHtcKusCxZenuCiJndw.text: This restaurant was recommended by one of the servers at a previous restaurant we ate at. Black Tap is known for their burgers, beers, and crazy shakes.  It is located on the casino floor of The Venetian by the poker tables.   The line was long when we got here, but it is first come first serve seating at the bar which is where we ended up at.  They have a fully stocked bar with two TVs and you can see the kitchen from where you sit.  They have specialty burgers (see pic for menu). I tried the Truffle Burger with onion rings. A bit oily but flavorful. The onion in the onion ring was sweet and the coating crisp (it was messy to eat though).  They have two individual stall restrooms inside the restaurant which was nice since you didn't have to go into the casino to find a restroom. And, the toilet paper is soft too which is always a plus.  Staff was friendly, food good, and establishment clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Truffle Burger
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Another shake
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All American Burger

mK5Wxm2AeHcztwR2_MJmSA.text: Fun place with many burger options and crazy shakes.  It is very loud.  Mostly 80's music ... lots of Beastie Boys. Good for family with kids that are a little older.  Fries are yummy.  Hate that they charge a $1 for mayo.  Crazy shakes approx $15, reg shakes $9.  Lots of options, I had black cherry.  Enjoy!!

bJxRWn6o5yEZCHfXqJXXhQ.text: Dorothy, our server, is one of the things that made this place great. She was attentive and friendly! The food was great too-we just did a house salad and chips and queso and fries. The house salad was surprisingly fresh and large. Most house salads are not very fresh but this one was. The fries were crispy and the chips were yummy. We are so glad that we stopped in for some apps and drinks!

fTorI4COAh6M13kY3qizYA.text: I was influenced by FB with all the great photos of the crazy shakes at Black Tap that I had to stop by here. Since I was staying at The Venetian Hotel, I made time to taste one of the shakes and I ordered wings and fries. Great photo op.  We ordered the Brooklyn Blackout.  The wings and fries are also just alright. Nothing really stood out other than the beautiful shake. When the shake is served to you, make sure you take your photos quickly as it will start melting in 5 minutes. I wasn't a fan of the shake but maybe I just need to order a different one.  There is a line to dine here but you can sit at the bar as it is open seating. The bartenders were all nice. Overall, I would return when there's no line.

tQODYNF58JHpVIv3a2wdxw.text: The shake looks great, but easily falls apart. My waitress had an attitude when I asked her for a extra spoon, which highly irritated me and made me not want to spend my money there. They tried to sit us right next to other people when their were other seat around, why would I not want my own space? Not being table to table.  Probably won't be back because of the waitress honestly

VxpziKtSTTvQE9rrYwzzuQ.text: Definitely overhyped!  The shakes are awesome for photos and instagram but taste-wise, it was nothing special.  The ice cream sandwich tasted like the ones your would get from the freezer section at the grocery store. I can eat desserts without feeling sick but these milkshakes are beyond sugary. My sister and I felt sick and couldn't even finish a third of ours.  We also ordered the truffle burger and upgraded the side to their broccoli. The side was extremely small for paying an extra $2 and the burger was very mediocre.  I personally was disappointed by Black Top.

Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The cookie shake
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Teriyaki broccoli $2 more for this tiny thing.

lI9DFitpuxbz8__j6d-TQQ.text: All this hyper for a mediocre shakeI don't know what went wrong. The food or the service  I don't like leaving bad reviews BUT, I review all the places I go in Vegas. It was not a busy day for them at all. We walked in and passed the bar where they make all the "cool" shakes. I took a moment to embrace that area in and the vibe. You would think someone, would greet me and maybe do some small talk. NOPE  The bar looked a little bland with the ingredients and array of candy. Everything looked rather light and not fresh when it came to the candy. When you go to these type of candy shake places, always pay attention to this. You'll see why...  We sat in the beautiful patio and it was a lovely day outside. I was rather excited to review the menu and see what all the hype was about.   It was simple. VERY, simple. I was like, whaaat? Okay, I'll give it a shot. We ordered a birthday cake shake and it was small. The cake which was the centerpiece was a bit dry. The shake just vanilla ice-cream swirled with sprinkles. The hype is just to make it look pretty. Like half the shake you normally get from restaurants. The salads are basic. Don't get this at all. The burgers were small and the only part that was good were the fries. So, do fries and try a shake to experience it for yourself  To top it off... our waiter must have been having a bad day. The most sarcastic waiter I've ever met. This was the sour cherry to dining here.   If you have questions or have a better experience let me know. I wouldn't mind giving it another shot. Vegas experiences always change.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Too much hype for just plain food. The shakes are pretty but, be aware they are small.

UNOTRNzx8Au-tq4Cqf304A.text: AMAZING!!!! First time here and Black Taop has a return custom! Our server Ashley was awesome and the best server we've had this weekend!!! Hope to get her again when we come back!!! Food was amazing! We got the Greg Norman, Crispy chicken sandwich, and the bbq wings. FYI portion sizes are big

My husband and I stayed a night at The Venetian and just had to try a shake at the Black Tap Craft Burger! We didn't eat a burger though.  My husband and I shared a chocolate shake. It had two huge brownies and it was delicious for the first 5 minutes, then it became too sweet. K It was a fun experience

HtbfDNqe1CTwPLoIPfuRGQ.text: Hubby and I visited this place twice while on our very short trip. So we obviously enjoyed ourselves. Both nights were around 9p - first a Sunday and then a Monday. The first time it was just us and our infant. The second we were a party of four adults and 4 kids. Botha times they were able to seat us immediately and comfortably. Hubby and I were happy to have a two too where our stroller could sit next to us without being in anyone's way. When we returned with friends we were happy to be seated on the patio where the kids had space to roam and there was some kind of game table set up. Not to mention a beautiful view of the water and the strip.   Both times we just went for milk shakes. While my experience at a Black Tap in New York had very slow service (pretty sure we waited at least 25 minutes for just two milk shakes), this place got them out in no time!   Their current special Shake was a Churro Shake. We loved it so much the first time that we got it again on the second night. I thought that over all, this milkshake simply had the boldest and most delicious flavor. But the Cinnamon Toast Crunch on the outside of the glass didn't hurt! Not to mentioned the ice cream soaked churros stuck on top!! Mmmm!  On the first night we got the salty and sweet. This peanut butter milkshake didn't taste quite as flavorful as the Churro. But I was happy to eat all of the m&m's off the side along with the Reese's and pretzel sticks. Lol.   The next night, we ordered the salty and sweet but asked the the milkshake he fruity pebbles instead of peanut butter. Yup. Weird combo. Lol. If you super love Fruit my Pebbles, this is the milkshake for you. My husband loved it.   Over all, this is a great place to get a crazy topped milkshake. The milkshakes themselves are nothing different from anywhere else. But the service was great and accommodations were even better. We're happy campers!

iiAF1lPYLpUi3rxk2ayY7g.text: We ate here for my birthday a year ago and the food was to die for.  Recently we visited again and it was really hard to eat the food.  The quality and taste just wasn't the same.  The shakes are always AMAZING, the burgers not so much.

CesME-EbWbpbrWNPi925Rg.text: This place is delish!! We had the chicken sandwich and the Oreo crazyshake and both were so amazing! Some really good food and topped off with really good service by Ashley, she was really helpful in deciding what to get and how to handle the milkshake the right way!!!

KMxoOVea0ZSDCUt_6Thbvg.text: This is the best burger place in Las Vegas! The milk shakes are amazing and tastes so delicious! Our waiter was so nice and polite. My burger was so good and they have the best gluten-free buns. This should be on everyone's bucket list!

FEfGioLOtCUL2dQHeuoSUw.text: Great food and even better service. Our waitress Carolina was very hospitable and attentive to our every need. Side salads are big enough to be considered an entree. Everything was fresh and delicious. Didn't get to save any room for dessert, but their shakes look worth coming back for.

diG5zGwQ_Qw3Rgu_YG9gzA.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE This place is amazing I love the shakes and service never fails. Daniel was awesome and  had great recommendations! The Choco shake was amazing!!!

A-FTmShD-UqsCdT9trTd_A.text: The most amazing milkshakes hands down! Tasteful and flavorful food. I had the mozzarella, the fried pickles and chips and guacamole which were amazing. Tried the Mexico City and the Truffle burger which both were also amazing. Id suggest eating outside on the balcony, that view is to die for

TbO_yBOmq43-MPD6eA02fA.text: Its in a spot that is its third burger rendition.  The staff is kind of standoffish at first but they warmed up.    It was across from the poker room and many people came in smoking or to ask questions which was annoying.  The food was good, but not worth the trip if you aren't already stumbling upon it.  Desserts were pretty fun.

jtOWFoUgcF00pbfbnK4_kQ.text: If I only counted my first experience at Black Tap, the restaurant would be a solid three. Just another over-hyped, over-priced burger joint in Vegas with bad pickles and a "crazy shake" on the menu to draw in the tourists with their kids. Nothing exceptional, but not the worst place I've ever eaten. Unfortunately, in the Vegas spirit, I pressed my luck and tried it again.   Admittedly it was approaching closing time when we arrived at 11:30pm-ish on a Sunday for a couple of milkshakes. Sure enough, as soon as we got close, I could see the "Sorry We're Closed" sign complete with rope and bollards and a handful of people still finishing their meal inside the restaurant.  I worked in food service before, and I respect the "no seating tables 30 minutes before closing time" rule that some restaurants seem to follow.  I chalked it up to bad timing on my part and headed back to the hotel, thinking I'd try again tomorrow on my way back from the show at the RIO.   As soon as the show was over, we ran to catch an Uber, rushed back to the hotel and began the hike to the black tap. We had the Black Tap in our sights by 11:00 pm a full hour before they are scheduled to close. A schedule, that I confirmed with the waitress at the restaurant, the concierge at the Venetian, and the checkout desk at the Palazzo.  Sure enough, there were the rope and bollards, and the "Sorry We're Closed" sign a full hour ahead of the time they list on every web page, menu, etc. that they close. I went to the hostess and asked her what the deal was, and she claimed that from time to time they would close early if business was slow. I might've believed her if she wasn't standing in front of a restaurant still crawling with people. Then she claimed the milkshake machine was blocked off. So no shakes could be made anyway. I left frustrated.   This restaurant suffers from poor or judging by the other reviews inconsistent management. If the terrible pickles (and I mean the worst I've ever had - how do you screw up a pickle?) didn't give it away, the closing AN HOUR BEFORE THE SCHEDULED TIME certainly did. What manager in their right mind closes an hour early and in Vegas of all places?     The next morning when we were checking out, I mentioned this incident to the desk clerk at the Pallazzo, and he said, without missing a beat "Oh you should have tried Holsteins Shakes and Buns in the Cosmopolitan, way better than the Black Tap."   Next time I'm in Vegas I think I'll take that advice and I'd recommend you do the same.  PS. About these pickles, I want you to imagine one of those conversion vans from the 80-90s that had plush carpet in the back. Imagine you bought one of those with about 200k miles on it, that had been used to ferry kids animals and lumber around for the last 30 years with only the occasional spot vacuuming. Now imagine cutting a small piece of fabric from that carpet and eating it. This is the best approximation for what their pickles taste like.   Also, their onion rings are too thick, but at this point, that's just splitting hairs.

IWmMuygRzvUNH2GTsGFDpQ.text: If your Instagram feed is lacking then this is the place to go, but if you want food that looks as good as it tastes you're at the wrong place. $150 for pretty much visually appealing trash. I mean honestly save yourself the money and go to In n Out Burger.
