GGrSu7bSbGoXkeNFAGYU6A.text: Finally made it to this hotspot. I'm a local here in Vegas so it takes something special to get me down to the strip. I took my friend there for her birthday lunch. We decided to share since I read reviews that portions are good sized. We ordered the Texan burger with fries and a side Caesar salad. The burger was cooked perfectly and the bacon was on point. For just a side salad that was also amazing with a gracious amount of cheese and fantastic dressing. We shared the birthday cake shake and the shake was good but the cake was the best part so moist and great flavor. Our server Jason was very accommodating and showed us all the different shakes as he was running them to other tables. He made our visit a 5 star experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday cake shake
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Birthday cake shake

xyintmlIAMixWJhWUgaRrA.text: We were a party of 8. The won't take reservations. There was a 45 minute wait for a table. They offered outside (in extreme heat) for immediate seating. Took 20 minutes to seat us. Claimed they had to prepare table although the outside was nearly empty. Service was bad. We ordered onion rings. They brought the dressing without a utensil and we had to ask for small plates. Finally they brought forks. For dressing?  Burgers were good not great.  They did a poor job of busing and replenishing water and drinks. Ice tea came in a small glass and they charged for refills. The service was included in check--lucky for them or it would have been zero.  When I paid the check, the dishes from the onion rings were still on the table. So if you really want their exotic shakes (and they are great, although the monkey dishes they serve them on don't catch the droppings and there are many) bad enough to endure way below average everything else - then do it.

NZkNHsHh2ZlbwmN40VIFSg.text: Nice place but a little dysfunctional to hosting. Hostess didn't seem friendly nor welcoming to guests coming up to the front counter. One of the hostess turned away a party of three and told them we don't have seating for three. No apologize just rude. However, we did get sat and our waiter was friendly. The waiting to be seated was out of view of the hostess counter and meaningless.

9Ir4glVPCYBX4KbDi0FUmQ.text: Epic fail! I had such high hopes for this place. Not sure if we just caught them too early upon opening. Our waiter had ZERO personality and literally could not have messed up our order any more. My husband had an egg on his burger, but it came out so raw and runny. He asked for a cooked egg and about 30 minutes later an egg gets delivered to the table next to us. Was he supposed to let his burger sit there getting cold? Just awful and they had the nerve to charge for the egg after we told him that obviously the burger was eaten while waiting for the friggin egg. My burger would have been decent if they hadn't charred it into a hockey puck. I asked for medium! I was so hungry that I couldn't bear to wait for another one. Then the table next to us gets a crazy shake they didn't order. When we ordered our shakes, it came out a completely melted messy disaster. A shake is supposed to be thick, not like water. If you want a good shake and burger, head over to the Cosmopolitan to Holstein's where they know how to cook food.

MILXvnjX_PEiIQWvPdc6mA.text: had the confetti cake milkshake it was awesome but the wait to get in took 45 mins on a Monday night

mZZDbfD7-DDjftvfT6I8nQ.text: I had the pleasure of eating at Black Tap Las Vegas inside the Venetian today.  To say everything was amazing would be an understatement!  It was great from beginning to end.  The hostess was very welcoming, and she seated us on the patio which had a great view of the gondola rides and the Las Vegas Strip.  There were a few of us dining together so we ordered several items on the menu from appetizers to entrees and ended with their crazy milkshakes.  The food was mouth watering and full of flavor.  Our server was extremely knowledgeable about the menu and offered helpful suggestions on what to order.  This place is a must try for locals and tourists alike.  It was not just a meal, it was a dining experience which is what going out to eat should be.  Black Tap is also perfect for corporate events and venue buyouts or for any social occasion.  Ask for the special events manager, Jose Saenz!

nDhu-iIdAHE0Teqq1N7Qig.text: Can we just say food heaven? The burger was juicy and delicious and my shake changed my life. The service was also stellar as well. It's located in the Venetian and pretty damn awesome.

Jl9kcrYpXfH7zuN_e5dr7Q.text: Possible the best burger I have ever eaten anywhere. I had the Mexico City.   Get the onion rings instead of fries.  Shakes are like nothing you have ever had

y93GR4PL1DZSHI9eFTCm_A.text: Great food and awesome crazy shakes!  A True treasure.  Just watch out that your crazy shake doesn't wilt and ooze whipped cream all over the table while you are trying to get pictures.  The chicken sandwich was sooo good.

8Aq1YS77qZ-oviKHJPc7Zw.text: I was really looking forward to trying this place, but it was honestly a let down.   The shake was amazing, but I can always get a cheaper shake at Jack in the Box, for the same great taste.   The burger was mediocre, and they messed up my order. I ordered the truffle burger and they gave me the Texas burger, which I waited for my new burger for 30-45 minutes. I get that people make mistakes, we're human, so I tried to act polite about it, because I used to work with customers too, so I get it. Once the waiter brought out the correct burger, he then said, "is this the right one?" with such a bad attitude, at that point I was over this place. I just wanted to leave. Then once we got the bill, my burger wasn't even discounted let alone free, because at that point, with his bad attitude, it should've been at least discounted, but of course not, since this restaurant is in Vegas. I didn't voice my opinion, I didn't want to make things worse for our group.   The waiter had the nerve to add 18% gratuity to our receipt because we were a big group, which I understand, but with the service he gave us, he didn't deserve it.   So to wrap it up: save your money and just go to In-n-Out.

9LcdXiExCvWtR5iDAf9AjQ.text: Today was one of the best experiences I've ever had at a restaurant. The Greg Norman burger (wagyu beef, buttermilk-dill, blue cheese & arugula) was one of the best hamburgers I've ever eaten! A million thanks to manager John A.!  As a manager of Davidoff I have to say that John A. is an excellent manager, super accommodating, and attentive. I'll definitely be back many times!

jRFO5Btfr_EkMNTIVrzqjg.text: Had a great time. We sat at the bar and Leo was our bartender. He was amazing and gave us great recommendations. We shared a burger and a shake (just do it, you know you want to). We tried the chocolate black out and want to go back for the birthday cake. The food was yummy and the staff was super cool.

GzskbzcfWGZmkPcgJfpsDw.text: One of the best places to grab a burger ! My burger was huge and it was so delicious, I finished it all! Their milkshakes are also a treat. Our server was nice as well.

f2POKHBehSYy6gMq_g0RMQ.text: I just went here with my boyfriend, I do not recall our server name. The grill went out as soon and we sat down, we were only allowed to order fried food & waited 30 minutes for the grill to get back up. I was clearly upset and the serve did nothing about it, the service was horrible. Please don't go here

4wLdANm9W021iJSkucoNSg.text: Loved our hamburger which very juicy and flavorful, the atmosphere was awesome as well. Will definitely go back in September! The shakes looked amazing but we were full from the hamburgers. The service was good as well.

X2ho4Gt1wSiSc2ER6ElrUQ.text: I've been to 2 Black Taps in NYC, and the LV location didn't disappoint. I love how the shake area is on display. The staff was super duper nice. My crazy shake was delicious.

x7U40jV8POsOB9guhmO_pw.text: Blacktop is a great new spot in town! It is definitely busy. We had a group of 7 girls; no reservation. They sat us as quick as they could, and as soon as we were seated the server was super attentive. Jason was amazing. He was patient and explained various different menu items, since it was our fist time visiting! The customer service speaks volumes about this restaurant! Love having a black tap in Vegas

gfYUF5_GM4CZk6Se8s3jGw.text: Awesome restaurant. Great service and the manager, JP, was the best came and checked on us a couple of times. Josh our server was also great. Beat burgers and shakes.

y0buu1WCyvUELmgA5-nW_w.text: It was a nice day to sit outside with a view of the gondolas and the LV strip but first annoyance is that the table was wobbly. This place hasn't been open for very long so that means they bought cheap tables that wobble. Of course we had to order the infamous $15 shake, tried the chocolate chip cookie shake. It was good, but was brought out at the same time as our appetizer which I guess is ok but would have preferred to be asked when I want my shake. Burger was good, fries were too salty . The most outrageous part of the bill was a dollar charge for each side of ranch. I've never heard of a charge for ranch EVER! I hate restaurants that upcharge without letting the customer know. Very sneaky and leaves a bad taste. Probably will not be back.

rfk45P1kYhNBdPDyUbqI2w.text: Didn't think these couldn't be as good as they looked but SURPRISE they were! Sat outside with a beautiful view, the server was sweet, and the shake was sweeter!

sNpZLQBfBlFMgG_VvZYhLA.text: Great food, amazing service, and good beer! Rachel is spot on with the recommendations. Just don't order the water (it's fine, but with all the other beverage offerings you'd be a fool).

U44EUVVD2KhmMN688ed_Vg.text: Our group of 10 came in to try their crazy, fun looking shakes. Unfortunately, that's all we could say about their shakes. Take away the fun, outrageous toppings, the shakes were just not good. You can get a way better milkshake at In-and-Out or Steak and Shake.

gsXqk02E2haAjIV9QA2NUw.text: Jenny our server and Adrian the manager really truly care about the customer and mission. Kudos to them!! Corporate should definitely take a look at their business philosophy and use them as a model

q7k5evbZpseLw7akyH98QA.text: Some people find the crazy shake price of $12-$15 spendy, but it feeds at least 2-3 people if you share it, so it's not so bad. I absolutely LOVE the Korean BBQ Chicken Sandwich--it's one of the best chicken sandwiches I have ever had. EVER!

ZQYOYVr5KqmHfBUxdoogDQ.text: Omg, we had an amazing time. The shakes were incredibly good, the ranch dill sauce to die for. And the service by our Adrian was excellent.  All of my grandkids were extremely satisfied and full. Will definitely come back again and again and create more memorable times.

E7_cGtkoRJt8P-r5K7crQA.text: Black Tap has the best atmosphere. We didn't try their food but we did get their cookie shake. It was AMAZING. We will be coming back every time we are in Vegas!

aO7cqjdEmU9P4GfgxorQqA.text: It's a great hangout spot inside of the Venetian Casino and Resort. The BlackTap brought in some old school hip-hop vibes along with the 80/90's pop art. They "Don't Sweat the Technique" when making the best craft milkshakes I've seen and tasted. I believe their Crazy Shakes is what makes their bar/restaurant stand out aside from the furnished designs. I love that I could sit anywhere and it's a different theme to vibe from. You could even take a step out into the patio and enjoy the view of Las Vegas' replica of Venice and the Gondola rides. The All American Burgers, fries, beer and Shakes sure did brought new attention the the Venetian! Prices are fair considering it's on the Strip, so expect to pay double digits for their items.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

CeftyzshvnugWRYpij3PXg.text: After a long and stressful day at the Airport trying to make it out to Vegas before the "Bomb Cyclone" I am grateful that Black Tap is now in The Venetian. As soon as I got checked in and got to my room, my best friend recommended we run down to Black Tap since we were starving and needed food before getting into more stereotypical Vegas fun.   I ordered the Chili Cheeseburger and watched in fear as I saw what they are famous for being prepared. These huge milkshake mountains are insane and they have a ton of variety in terms of what kind you can order. I went with one covered in Fruity Pebbles and candy and whipped cream and cherries and everything and sugar and you get the point. Needless to say my tummy was feeling a bit bloated after the fact but it was my own decision and I stand by it.   Definitely give this place a try if you are near it and if you love burgers, fries and massive milkshakes that could probably solve a lot of the World's problems.

48yb-RcOG9L49fR9wzzZCQ.text: Perfect burger! Nice place with sharp service... I wish I had space to try one of those beautiful shakes I saw... will return just for that.

hqGkXkJB-0ZWVMt7f5p19g.text: Fun place from nyc   Been waiting for them to arrive in Las Vegas.  The shakes and burgers are very good.  Overall a really good experience that will definitely get better.  The Texan burger was terrific.  Juicy and flavorful.  Very helpful and knowledgeable staff.  Looking forward to going back. Sent some colleagues over before a show. They had to get the shakes to go. They said even deconstructed it was delicious

haW1BPEt8Kb_iLW2sPfsGg.text: Came here while I was doing a stay-cation with my mom and little brother. My mom hyped up the milkshakes, so I knew we had to go! I LOVE the ambiance/decor of Black Tap. It's so much fun to look at the bar from all the crazy  milkshake ingredients! We decided to sit outside (we're from Vegas.. we can take the heat.. right?) haha. It wasn't too bad because it was shaded. Our server was awesome, super informative it being our first time and he showed us a new limited time milkshake for 4th of July. Now, let's get to the food! The menu has a wide variety of appetizers, entrees, and desserts (milkshakes!!!). The prices were pretty high, even though the food still sounded delicious. We opted to try for a few different appetizers rather than individual entrees since we wanted to try more items/my mom basically only eats chicken tenders lol. I got roasted Brussels sprouts (crazy delicious, and a nice portion since no one wanted to share). My mom liked her chicken fingers, and my little brother ordered a kids cheese pizza. He ate most of it, so we'll take that as a good sign! Finally, the milkshakes! We went back and forth on which one to choose since we were all going to share. Finally decided on the Cotton Candy Milkshake. If you have a sweet tooth, you'll devour this whole thing. For me, it's just a lot going on, but I still enjoyed a few bites. I would love to try the cookies and cream one next time! All in all, enjoyed my experience and would recommend to people by the Venetian for sure. Hey it's free parking too! I'd probably return just for the milkshakes though if I'm just by myself. If you're ready to try the most extravagant milkshake you've experienced, come on down!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cotton Candy Milkshake

x2eD1imxU0Eg-degIKqkew.text: The service sucked, food was alright & the shake was good... Staff was unprofessional (petty attitude over splitting a check). THE RANCH DIP IS NOT RANCH!!!!!! It tastes like tartar sauce.  the burger was good but bun was soaked in grease. Do yourself a favor and eat somewhere else, then go here for their shakes. That's the only thing worth it. $15 per shake.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3lGjFdGcXOtqZDefizWu0w.text: I really researched this place as I love New York and wanted to see if it held up to the hype. It truly did. We came in with a big party of course.  The atmosphere very trendy,  the staff was real chill especially because it was about 1am..And this Crazy Milkshakes didn't disappoint at all.  The menu is real fun especially the drink side. I walked away satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at this food porn....It satisfies whatever cravings you may have. And yes, it actually tastes as good as it looks....
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OMG Cake Shake Brooklyn Blast I am in food love

Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza Burger w/ amazing fries, marinara  is on the side so you can add a little or allot, grated mozzarella on the tomatoes &amp; lettuce.

HpuDl6oJc6MCxfTbIflCnQ.text: How can you charge $22 bucks for a burger and not have the ability to cook it to the right temperature what a disappointment ... how an experienced cook takes a burger to well done when I asked for medium rare hoping for medium (worse case scenario) and on top of that there menu says all burger cooked to medium (fake news) My mom and son were happy with their food  Never tasted the burger my motto is you get one time to get it right ... fried pickles and onions rings were ok And is it possible to have the server pour your water ..: this place is way over priced for the service or lack there of .....not a happy camper

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. OVERCOOKED truffle waygu burger
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion rings

teDGWJWGjQZcCwsytmdxoQ.text: Food was amazing! The shakes of course were the best. I didn't have the highest hopes that the cake on top would be moist. But it was! My 5yr old is a picky eater and he ate half of an entire bbq burger. I was shocked. It was well worth the money.

e1PfUD2j1fY39ZXbzUl8MQ.text: 5 stars for the experience. There is a great atmosphere and the staff is really nice.   That being said, I was soooooo excited to try this place, and while the shake was good it wasn't something I'd rave about. I got the cookie shake, but asked for the shake to be chocolate instead of vanilla. I wish I would have kept it vanilla because all I could taste was chocolate syrup. Not sure why they couldn't just use chocolate ice cream?? But okay.  The cookies are the hard cookies, not soft like you'd expect (or at least what I would expect). The best part of the shake was the cookiewich, even if the cookies were hard, and I put the frosting from the rim of the glass on it and it was very good!   For $15 I expected a little bit higher quality, but it wasn't awful. If I lived in Vegas I'd come back to try the other ones.

L0CV_TB_A5cMpkxZENK9iw.text: AMAZING!!! I went in with super high expectations because it's Vegas, duh! And they were met! Our waiter Carlos and staff were great! The milk shakes were over the top, so delish and creamy!! I ordered the crispy chicken sandwich and it was killer. My sister ordered the Californian burger and devoured it so it must've been good, my mom ordered the Baja grilled chicken sandwich also a winner in her book!! I would 100% recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

w8XVWeWXSYx13PLlKYlgGA.text: We took our kids here for their birthday.  And they loved it!  $15 milkshakes.  Check.  Worth every penny!  Burger au poivre ----one of the best burgers I've ever had!  We are locals and the only reason for 4 vs 5 stars is service.   They really don't care as they think you're a tourist.   But given the food and shakes we'd ignore the service level and go back.

qBDtmCdNUBKt8d-5W3KKFA.text: Burgers were dry, over salted, and over cooked. The Fries and appetizers were decent at best. Milkshakes lived up to the hype. Overall a very mediocre dining experience, great if you want to clout chase with a social media post of the milkshake. Besides that I would stay clear and spend your money elsewhere.

NnULrz0Q7yxCDDsj3km01g.text: Good selection of burgers well-cooked and presented, but the real stars are obviously the rediculous shakes. Great experience all-around.

JHI2zmhN42hn2Ft4bZeQxQ.text: This adventure started with a 2mi walk to dinner and about 15 minutes of wandering after dinner for dessert. So, if you find this place, hidden amongst the gaming areas of the Venetian, ask for Viv! She was STELLAR!! Super sweet and perfectly attentive. I was a single guest among a bar of men visiting for a Gun Show or the World of Concrete expo. Viv made me feel comfortable and kept a close eye.  I visited because of a post I saw on Instagram about the Crazy Milkshakes. Could not have been happier! Viv suggested the Blackout before pointing out the secondary favorites, all of which I was debating. She pinpointed exactly the ones I was back and forth on. So, since great minds think alike, I took her advice for the blackout milkshake. Always listen to Viv! She told me that the brownies were the best she'd ever had and knowing how most brownie sundaes go, I didn't expect much. Totally shocked! Sweet but not over powering. Rich but well paired with a traditional chocolate shake.  After seeing me attack this thing alone, three guys at the end of the bar, tested fate. Let's just say, they couldn't hold their own to a kiddie cup! Each one hardly finished half. They ordered the cookie version, birthday cake and Oreo. Not a trophy they'll hold anytime soon! If you're craving something sweet, it's a must. The food looked great too but I was on a mission. Try this place, you'll be glad you did!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JnrU7k_PQilPwN6qD49hfg.text: We tried this place out for our double date on Saturday night. My friend had been there before, and suggested we go here for a good time.   The restaurant was somewhat difficult to find so give yourself some time to locate it. There was also a 40-45minute wait. I'm not sure if they take reservations though.   Once we got seated, our server was super cool and upbeat. We ordered Mozzarella sticks, and fried pickles to start. Which were delicious! Then, my friends ordered salads while my wife and I shared the Vegan Burger which was also delicious. For dessert, of course we ordered their famous shakes. We had the Sweet & Salty and our friends had the Cookies and cream. Both were Instagram worthy lol and of course delicious!   I took off a star because we had asked our server to cut our burger in half for us to share with an extra plate, but when it came out it wasn't done. Also, my friend didn't like the dressing they had put on the salad.   Overall, I do recommend. It's s fun and delicious place with a DJ too. His choice of music was on point!

4wGVyfoOUuA3wj6Pb3We7g.text: I came hear after seeing an advertisement for there milkshakes. We visited after seeing a concert and there was no wait to sit down. They had music playing and everyone there seemed to be enjoying themselves. I order the cotton candy and my friend ordered the cake shake, we also order a side of fries. The shakes were delicious and not a bad price $15 considering everything that comes on them. It's worth a visit when your visiting Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cL7bX1iTLGnco_WJ9qISrg.text: So I've been here a few times.  I take someone new each time.  I recently came with my boyfriend. He's a burger skeptic. But he ordered the burger with the onion rings and onion rings on the side and he loved it! I had a mushroom burger and it was delicious. And of course we had to get a shake. This time we got the cookies and cream shake and he thought it was amazing. Me too the Oreo ice cream sandwich attached to it was the bomb. All definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

426F-VhOR2V9AvHR_Y49OQ.text: Good quality food, friendly staff and clean open environment! They don't take reservations so make sure you plan ahead if you're going on a weekend. Bar as well as outside patio seating available. Kid friendly too and great old school pop music!   Plan for about $50/person (with tip) if you have a burger and shake

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1F_PIWBAlzt0DCKPW_aPAA.text: The desserts look really good but they were out of 2 of the beers on tap I wanted. You are on Vegas strip, how do you run out of beer??

7ZRZ6IqB9EQGnqTPIeB32A.text: We ate here recently and truly enjoyed it!  We placed our orders with a very courteous and professional server.  The order took a long time but, when we received the order, all of the burgers were cooked to perfection.  Burgers were very thick but were well done without burning and they were seasoned just right. I give this restaurant an 11 on a scale of ten!!!

t-h7uISOdCdJvFmhwgKb_g.text: My daughter was looking forward to coming here for her 18th Birthday. We had a great dinner and a fantastically sugary cotton candy milkshake! Jason was our waiter and he was attentive and courteous! We are locals and will definitely be back!

VVBBSA6MrZKf_-tbXQEszw.text: Black top is on top! Their milkshakes are absolutely AMAZING!!!  The milkshakes will spark conversations Beyond this world. Before you can dive in and begin drinking your milkshake you first must eat your way from the outer portion of the milkshake from all of the toppings and candies glued and stuck to the outside of the ice cream Tang makes getting to the center of the milkshake even that much more enjoyable. Most people will wait to grab a milkshake as their dessert but my suggestion is that you grab the milkshakes first in order to enjoy it throughout your visit because it will take you that long to get it completed. Now the milkshake Shirley aim to please however their burgers are great too. Their burgers are cooked as requested and with tons of flavor however if a hamburger is at your thing they do have great salads listed on the menu for you to try to which come in a very generous size as well. However, upon my return I will definitely be back for their milkshakes again because they were that great. That's known for their drinks and their milkshakes

iW_QNwXdZ2guQhqMKfJ97A.text: After a bumpy first visit we decided to give it another go.  We went back on a Saturday night.  The place was full and hip hop music was popping. The drinks were great (Aces High and Black Tap Mule).  Both were excellent and not overly sweet.  I ordered the Truffle Burger and my boyfriend ordered the  The Old Fashioned.  Cooked and seasoned perfectly.  Get the crispy Brussels sprouts!  Believe it or not they were amazing (I'm craving them now).  The service was excellent, our waiter was having fun and very attentive.  We ended the night with a Sweet and Salty Shake and that hit the spot (drool).  I'm glad we gave it another shot and it's very apparent they care about their customers.  Can't wait to bring more people when they come into town!  Cheers!

b9wPPaNEu1STWw1hCTBDZg.text: If you're looking for a picture of a cool looking milkshake to post on Instagram, then this is your place. If you're looking for anything else... you'll be very disappointed. Gotta be honest our group only came here for desert because we ate dinner elsewhere so we just ordered the milkshakes. We had the birthday cake shake, the cookie shake, and just a plain chocolate milkshake. Everybody took pictures but nobody finished they're warm disappointing milkshake. I'd rather go to sonic 4 times in a row than to spend the same price here again. I do not recommend.

hMNy6PJaW2KgXU1mKVKdcg.text: Very tasty burgers and milkshakes. While traveling for business, I ate at the bar and had great service (and menu recommendations) from the staff. Settled on the American Burger and ordered the Vanilla Cookie 'crazyshake'. Bring your appetite and sweet tooth if you expect to finish a crazyshake alone. Best for sharing There's outdoor seating as well. Would come back here with a group next time I'm in town.

yWK_i9gzR5kHxkK4-zQTtQ.text: I had the chance to visit Black Tap over the weekend while visiting a friend in Vegas. The food was absolutely delicious. We split the Texan Burger and wings... soooo good! Our waiter Buddy was so attentive and polite. Awesome experience. I will absolutely be back for their famous milkshakes... I was too full to indulge!

aDHogFuYMrtvL_d_F7g2Lg.text: They totally messed up my order and the burger was such a nasty mess I had to send it back.  I never send food back.  Literally only a hand full of times in my life.

0lfiGwW1AuuBxY5rPZss1Q.text: This place is a very fun and enjoyable experience.  Me, my wife and my brother took my mom there for Mother's Day.  Try to give her something completely different for dinner.  Great vibes, even better music and the service was on point.  At the end we all got those huge shakes to top the night off.  We all had a great time.  The only down fall to me was the place was a little too pricey for burgers, fries and shakes.  That being said I would definitely go back again cause the experience was a GREAT ONE!!!

183-VLZVhg--dZD_5jWoMg.text: We stumbled upon this place on a Sunday afternoon. It was busy but we only waited about 10 minutes. We weren't expecting a lot as far as food but the burgers were excellent and cooked perfectly. Cesar was friendly and accommodated is moving to another table when the guys next to us were loud and obnoxious. That's not the Vegas norm!

s2YCri1V3z4Z7a2CG_rUgw.text: Scored some seats at the bar and were served promptly.  Decided on some Korean wings as an app and they were very good.  My man got the basic burger and I chose the one with mushrooms and horseradish. My burger was tasty. The basic burger was lacking flavor. I upgraded my side to homemade onion rings. Well, when we received them, they were cold and soggy. The bartender happily got us some fresh, hot rings. They are breaded in a light flour, but they aren't as crunchy as they should be. Maybe they need a cornstarch or rice flour dusting instead.  In all, we were a bit underwhelmed with our visit here. We've had better burgers, fries, and o-rings elsewhere. I should have just had a giant milkshake and appetizer.

l8-IfCrFP0YekgJFHmFqYQ.text: they close at 2 . got there at 1 and they told me that they were closed. they closed early because "it was slow". wtf does that have to do with me?! this america or am I in a their world? I drove far and walked all the way through this big ass hotel to be sent to grand luxe . I wanted a MILK SHAKE GAT DAMMIT!

xmZpdVw7pJyMjfZpcAXUpQ.text: Last weekend my husband and I went to Las Vegas to celebrate a long time friend 50th birthday. We wanted a quick bite to eat before we hit the Strip. Nothing heavy just something to hold our liquor down...lol. We all went to  Black Tap (inside Venetian Hotel) and there was a line outside the door. (I don't like lines) I went and spoke to the hostess, (Kat and ummm, dang it I forgot the other young lady name...sorry). I explained to them why we were there and we needed to get seated quickly so we could get a jump start on the 50th birthday shenanigans! The hostesses were SUPER SUPER nice and very accommodating. We ended up sitting at the bar (which was perfectly fine with us) and met the BOMB ASS mixologist Joanna. OMG when I tell you that home girl was sooo cool and friendly. She was really on top of her game while taking care of us and her other patrons. She went above and beyond to make sure that we had a really good experience at the restaurant. Truthfully, I don't really remember our main meal (like I said it was last weekend) but I do remember that BOMB ASS birthday cake and those shots that Joanna was serving us!!! LOL  Thanks Black Tap for your GREAT service! My crew and I will be going back to Las Vegas to get "Black Tap'd" again! Ha Ha Ha

ExLKo0IisKR11OEBKt5DLg.text: I don't understand what all of the hype is about. The service was awful and the food was not edible.  The only upside part was the Crazy Shake.   While our intent was to only order a shake, we decided to start out with some snacks.  That was an epic mistake and a total disaster.   We ordered the mozzarella sticks and they didn't have any cheese in it. They were empty!!   Then we decided to order the wings and they were raw.  Completely raw! The only part that looked cooked was the outside.   We came for the Cake Shake and it was outstanding!! I liked how they put the icing on the outside of the cup and put sprinkles on it. The cake on top was delicious and the shake itself was amazing.  We did have a great booth because we were right next to where they make the shakes and it was cool to watch them prep and make the shakes.  The service. Was not very good either.   We had dirty plates on our table for 15 minutes and dozens of employees just walked by completely ignoring them.   The waitress was pushing us to get our shake before we were ready and was really worried after our food mishap, as she should be.  The most comical part was when she told us that the cheese evaporated from our cheese sticks.     I know that I won't be going back to that place.   While the shake was good, Las Vegas offers much better options for dining and desserts with better service.

O8fued9_OKa84G0Po4ZtMw.text: As a local there are tons of better spots off the strip. We wanted to try this place based on the hype and the huge milkshakes. The milkshake is decent, but about the same quality as sonic and way over rated. The food was pretty terrible. We got burgers, very salted and over cooked patty. It was very tall and greasy. The grease soaked through the bun really quickly and it was inedible. Fell apart in my hand. I'd say skip this place. It isn't worth your time, even the bar has a huge menu in front of the tv. Why have a tv if you can't see it? The only thing I can say is that the early 90s music is probably the best part.

_kHvh0JpI3oFVq48eZV3MQ.text: Took my bf for his birthday and plus we've been wanting to try this place out. The food was honestly mediocre nothing special. We ordered the fried pickles and they were really bland no type of flavor at all. The burgers were good but they were more on the "done" side then "medium" which is what we ordered but they were still okay. The milkshakes were really pretty, we ordered the cookies n cream and it was tasty but the look of it was really the reason I wanted it lol  Overall this place was decent but nothing I would go and drive for

C2gh6oyIopkLyhHlSEEKIA.text: I really wanted to like this place a lot since they have one in New York that I wanted to go to every time I'm there. I was excited when they opened here. It's located inside the Venetian Hotel. It's really cool the way they have it decorated inside and it's trendy and hip. Now the food wasn't that great I don't think they're meant to be a restaurant I think they should just be a shake and bar place. I ordered a vegan burger, it was so soggy and just spilled out everywhere I couldn't enjoy it. I ordered onion rings and they were the large cut onion rings I mean large it was unnecessary. The fries were the thick cut not wedges but steak fries and I don't like thick I think thin ones taste so much better. The ooh ahh factor were the shakes of course but in all honesty who can eat all of that with all the toppings. It looks so cute and pretty you don't wanna mess it up. The shakes were like $14-$18, very high-priced I don't know if it's worth it , maybe to say you had one but is that really worth it? We left there hungry. The service was great, the music was great 80s and 90s :). but I don't know if I would come back there again the food just didn't do it for me or the people I was with. We spent $190 on my burger and onion rings, 2 small salads, side of fries, 3 shakes and a mini one. We could've eaten at yard house for less. (I love yard house food, always consistent)

Cucevt5oMzBc1ZmHa1OTIw.text: I have seen ads for their shakes all over Instagram and Facebook so we decided to take our friend for her birthday.  I think we were all too full because the four of us barely ate the two we ordered but they were still amazing! Fun for photos, fun selection to choose from and although they are $15 each it's pretty normal Vegas pricing seeing as how Johnny Rocket's charges $9 for a regular milkshake. I can't say how the food is since we only went for the shakes but I'd recommend this place based on the shakes.

U4J1vBSyJQAn6_JWwsy7Ug.text: burger was cooked the way i wanted it (medium rare) and the fries were plentiful and crisp. the oreo milkshake was a bit overwhelming to eat but delicious. we sat outside with a nice view. our waitress checked on us frequently and always asked if we needed anything. i really wanted to jump into the water where the canal boat singers were at.

kwpSH7yj3SvKHoGY3BfTew.text: The burgers are fantastic and earned the fifth star. My only advice I would give them is to move the TV in the bar. It's completely obstructed by an overhang so you can't actually watch anything which I found oddly overlooked.

0RT-s2c0qb4lXz4E2_dLQA.text: I give this place 2 star due to the lack of service.  As we waited 20 min for a table we had a drink  at the bar and looked at our dinner options.  Bar was friendly and helpful and I cashed out giving 20%tip.  We were seated at a table close to the desert station and since it was my first time I was super excited to see all the shakes made. Our waiter came up and never introduced himself and started asking us what we wanted and if we just sat ourselves.  We were a stunned that he was questioning us instead of welcoming us to this awesome establishment.  After the misconfusion we ordered drinks and we split a burger.  No refills were ever giving and he was super inattentive.  We then ordered 2 shakes. I asked which one was best the cake or the oreo he said oreo.  I ordered oreo and friend ordered churro.  Only one shake came and we didn't want to eat one with out the other it took him about 10 min to ask is if everything was ok.  I said I'm waiting for my shake and he said oh u wanted 2 and I said yes he ordered churro and I asked u which is better cake or oreo and u said oreo and I said ok I'll have the oreo did you forget?? He said calm down it will take to seconds to come out and I said well I wanted to take a pic of both and now this ones melting.  He said hang on and left.  While gone I asked busser to pre buss the ta le and please give us refills on our drinks.  The food was amazing and the shakes were fun but the service was horrendous.  I will recommend this place but with caution and I will be back for the cake :)

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Churrochocotaco and cookies&#39;n&#39;creamsupreme

FtHGVGGVCcZPoiaBunjG6Q.text: I ate at this burger place on the strip yesterday with my boyfriend and it has very delicious food and very expensive.Be prepared to spend a lot of money here and not surprised since it is on the Strip.I love the hamburger I had ordered "The Old Fashioned"and the hamburger meat was delicious,fresh and mouth watering.I have not eaten at other burger places before that was this good.The hamburger meat is fresh,kinda sweet tasting and made the overall hamburger taste more wonderful.I like the sauteed mushrooms a lot and the pickle that came with the hamburger was very good too.It tasted very fresh not like pickles that you eat from a pickle jar.I asked the waiter where they get their pickles and they get them here locally!The hamburgers are special kind and they get a supply from New York where the main headquarters are.I also tried "the cakeshake" and thought it tasted very good and very sweet also.I had to eat it slowly because it was very sweet the cake part at least.It is a vanilla shake that includes a vanilla cake as well on top of the shake.It has vanilla frosting,rainbow sprinkles on the cake and cherry one top of cake.Also the shake has rainbow sprinkles on the rim of the shake cup.It looks very fancy and pretty and yummy looking as well.It attracted me so much that I had to order this and try it.The shake is very sweet,but the cake is even more sweeter.I really love the frosting with rainbow sprinkles and it tasted good with shake.If you love very sweet desserts this would be perfect for you.I didn't think it would be that sweet but it is.I liked it a lot and it looked like a pretty dessert from a magazine.I also tried the fried pickles and it tasted very good too with ranch dressing.I added tobasco with the ranch dressing and that made it taste even more better and delicious.I like the crispyness of the pickle and this is first time trying fried pickles.It reminds me of fried tempura.Everyone was friendly and nice and the employees were all very helpful and attentive.They checked on us and would answer questions we have about the food.Also the manager would check on us and see how everything is.I love eating and dining at this place and the food was very good and surpassed my expectations.It looked very appetizing and tasted delicious and desserts are pretty looking and sweet.I would come back in the future and recommend this place to friends and family.

hxYBH6KdiIUYZMPAA-LnpQ.text: We have been bombarded by ads from black tap and went there for the over the top shakes.  We got a sweet and salt shake a cake shake and another one plus a $22 hamburger for the son. The burger must have been good since it disappeared before anyone could notice.  The shakes were good but the frosting cake and candy made the shakes appealing.  I do not know if it was worth the price to do twice but it was worth a one time deal on vacation.   Worth the cause to get off the bucket list

fgY8yt_k8R3z7Gm-mxJ5bg.text: I was extremely excited to hit this place up during my most recent trip to Vegas. We showed up at 5:30 on a Sunday with a group of 7. Service was quick, the taplist is extensive, and the shakes are insane. Unfortunately 3 of the orders came out wrong (over cooked, undercooked, and another with a wrong side). These things happen and it's not a big deal, however it took over 35 minutes and replacement burgers were not brought out. The manager came by 20 minutes into the delay to say it was on the house and they'd be right out, however it took vastly longer. Everyone else at the table was done eating and the burgers still hadn't arrived while numerous other tables had been served in the interim. Our group will never return and I'll happily tell anyone whole cares to hear that this place isn't worth the trouble.  Overall the food was good, however the price and service did not match.

iVW3zyzdWn1UaChvOyfrTg.text: Milkshakes here are out of this world. Quite expensive but these are not an average milkshake! They are big enough for at least two people to share. It's all about the toppings, there's something to suit every taste and they will accommodate a special request. We both had chicken burgers and they were soooo tasty,one of the best we've had. Portions were large too. Service was ok, but it was late and had the feeling the staff were ready to go home, they were not that attentive. The decor was very retro and trendy, lots to look at and they have a huge outdoor area which sits on to the canal so you can watch the gondolas go by.  If this place looks busy, the outdoor area is huge and you can't see it from the front so don't walk passed it, definitely check it out if not just for a milkshake!

VTqQA8WWJBLsTRZiihWDyg.text: We had an awesome experience at Black Tap Vegas. The food was incredible; I had the crispy chicken sandwich with onion rings. Our server Luis, who had recently come back from a vacation of his own with no rest straight from the airport went above and beyond with everything from recommendations to mindful service with an excellent personality. I highly recommend Black Tap Vegas as a must try while visiting.

0Z_doJtpSqYLyt-RzPOUeA.text: Ok..I don't know where to start except....THIS PLACE IS AMAZING!!!!! I am so sorry I cant remember my waiters name. It started with an N. He was awesome best waiter I have had in a long time...we ate at the Bellogio Buffett yesterday and it was the BIGGEST disappointment but this made it all better..

EfP3UoVDH8kYAdfu0EM-IQ.text: Good service, fresh and tasty food, a varied menu (we have food allergies but were able to find several things to order). The falafel salad had a huge falafel sitting in the center of a big salad. The greens were fresh and the tahini dressing was yummy. The restaurant is known for its shakes which look indulgent but we were too full from our lunch entrees.  We would definitely return here!

OIkBuketHMmMQWGJYgjHxQ.text: Burgers are perfect and the milkshakes are so much fun!  I will warn you that getting both can be a little over filling but other wise it was great

XqDA1JehgAxmQZYO3pcuUg.text: The best gluten free (bun) burger ever!!! The food came out hot and fresh as I requested. Casual and cool vibe. Great service and awesome "Crazy Shake".

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shake bar...kind of dope

nArNMH7MPH3V_mLVnb6d7w.text: Soooooooooo I've been dying to go here as I follow #blacktap on IG. The shakes are what pulled me in! So I made it my business to stop in since I was in the area. The wait was about 45 mins, the line was super long. Luckily we found seating at the bar because I was starving! Staff was very friendly, and prompt. The Korean wings! I'm telling you those were fire!!! The right amount of spice, crispy, flavor was on point! I almost chewed my fingers off!! The burger was so so...I think it could use a bigger bun, but...and for the main event that oreo shake! I have no words but simply divine! So worth the trip! Definitely a go to if your in Vegas! I'll be back for sure!

zxloAcAk6HExxDG9fd2bIA.text: Shakes were good but was charged an additional $15 a shake for the shots that we assumed would come with it. Holsteins is a way better deal!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Go to Holsteins!! Shakes were good but $70 later. We were charged an additional $15 a piece for the alcohol in the shakes

kbNeVnUwsvRW_a8jJzdYgw.text: Soo Black Tap inside the Venetian is probably one of the best places I've been to of it caliber. Great service, friendly atmosphere, only the best music, and to top it off phenomenal food. I've been twice now. From their monstrous shakes, almost perfect poured beers to a perfectly cooked burger. Guacamole you can eat by itself I just can't explain it you just have to go there!!  However, with all its deliciousness be sure to spend money. $15 shakes and $20 burgers, but you only live once and great food should be a must.  Going to NY next month to try the original Black Tap...to be continued...

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jdzQFEvypUdpbt6cN1uO-Q.text: This was our first stop when we arrived into town. We read the reviews and thought it sounded perfect. However we were not impressed.   The restraunt was pretty empty but we were sat at a tiny table in between two other parties, one which was a very loud bachelorette group. Our server was ok, but seemed annoyed that we weren't ordering more food.   We had the fried pickles and they were extremely heavy so we didn't want much for our main course. I didn't really like my burger but my husband said it was "so so". The fries were bland.   The desserts looked really fun but after a heavy meal we werent interested in any more food. We were disappointed that this was the first experience of our trip.

IXqPqXOfwlk1VvddZBwrlg.text: Win.  I eat here at least once (usually twice) every time I come to Las Vegas.  This place is amazing.  The burgers are very good.  The fries and onion rings are also very solid.  I come for the shakes.  If you get the obnoxiously large ones ($20), you're gonna need to have a buddy to help you finish.  I've never had a bad shake here.  This location is on point.  The servers are nice and polite and friendly.  Inversely, I live in NYC and when I visit the Black Tap on 55th Street...I'm having to beg for customer service.    Black Tap at the Venetian...go for it, you won't be upset with your decision.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This guy did terrible things to that shake.

psIv-1dGlPlwRVEmAvwVyA.text: Definitely order the Birthday Shake! I have to say the place is a fun spot on The Strip but for some reason their burgers didn't blow my mind. Their burgers were just okay-- I really loved their sweet potato fries along with their mozzarella sticks. The only reason I would go back is for the shakes of course and because they are so massive, make sure you bring friends to share with.  Overall, spot is nice and service was good!

KZR8iABQZXrOl-WesgfRDg.text: Curiosity and a sweet tooth led us in.     Over priced "specialty" shakes.   Inedible and cheap candy theatrics.    More whip cream than ice cream.    Bummer.  The place was half full and there was a small line of people waiting to be seated.  We walked in and asked how long the wait was and it was 15 min.    Asked if we could sit anywhere in the bar area.  Said we could.  So we did.  I ended up having to get my own menu.  Decided on the elderflower slush and a $15 Peanut Butter Shake.  This shake was no $15 shake.   It was a $4 at the most.   I have had better shakes from Sonic.    Waitress asked how everything was and I told her how disappointed I was with the shake.   A real let down.  She sort of apologized, I get it, it's not her fault.  Not even a comp and take away.  The shakes commit dessert fraud.  They pointlessly roll the glass in chocolate and candy, shove a couple of tasteless pretzel sticks in there, cram mini peanut butter cups on the rim...and stick a WRAPPED sugar daddy lollipop on the whip cream that gives these shakes their height.   I dug down into the glass hoping to find that $15 bite but it never happened.   It was melted peanut butter ice cream soup.   I can confidently say I won't be back or recommend this place.     There are better options

rP-3IvrWHy_ackKnT_JxsQ.text: Pros: Free Venetian Parking Great atmosphere  Cool photo opportunities Crazy cool looking shakes  Friendly servers   Cons: Pricey Shakes may fall apart fast because they're stacked so high! Take pictures fast   We were seated right away on a Friday night around 5:45PM. Not as crowded as I thought it'd be! Very nice servers, checking in on us. We came for the shakes and didn't order the burgers, I've heard both good and bad things about them. Maybe some other time we'll try! We split the Sweet N' Salty shake and it just looked so cool. Definitely more of a photo op, but the shake was good! It's a $15 shake for the appearance, because the shake itself wasn't something crazy amazing. But definitely a must-try place with a cool vibe and great location!

6Ao0y4xxCTdwpzEmvmPqBw.text: I had been looking forward to trying a crazy shake from the Black Tap for about 6 months. I spent my 21st birthday in Vegas this week and made it a point to visit The Black Tap.   Upon arrival, we were seated across from the bar. After at least 15 minutes, we hadn't had a server approach us. So, my boyfriend walked over to the bar tender and asked for assistance and she said "Oh, just go let the host know thats where you've decided to sit and they will send a server over." Mind you, the host sat us. And we were in plane view of the hostess stand where they could clearly see we hadn't been helped. I thought that it was very strange that somehow is was OUR job to alert a server we were there and not the host. As we waited frustratingly, the hostesses kept throwing dirty look after dirty look our way as well.    Once our server finally showed up, we ordered a shake. The Bam Bam Shake to be exact. When it came out, I was so, so disappointed. The frosting around the rim was rock solid and obviously old. There was less than half of a pop tart sticking out of it, a plain Kellogg's Rice Krispie treat, and a laffy taffy stick, topped off with way too much whipped cream.   And the shake portion was an absolute joke. It was plain vanilla ice cream with fruity pebble cereal mixed in. So boring and not impressive at all. I didn't even come close to finishing it because it wasn't even good. It made me feel sick and honestly nauseas because it was so gross.   All in all, it was the most overpriced and oversold shake I've ever had. I would have been more satisfied with a Frosty from Wendy's. My shake was nothing as advertised. It was supposed to have a nerds rope, a full sized pop tart, and a fruity pebbles rice krispy treat.   The service was horrible, the employees were unfriendly and my whole experience was horrendous from start to finish.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The worst shake I have ever had.

WSyRlp6GY6fUVUB_gbHepw.text: The cookies and cream milk shake was insane. It had a giant Oreo ice cream sandwich, on top of the shake! The overall Oreo flavor was top notch, and the portion was huge. The burger was also quite good, but I promise you... the milk shake is what you need to get!

8xhDY-Oe4PXVYIzQNhr5LQ.text: Man we were really wanting to like this place after waiting so long to sit down... everyone who got food was not happy with the temperature of the food. The chicken sandwich was cold to the touch and the burgers were over cooked and cool as well. Only thing that was hot was the fry's.   Also, bathrooms were horrible sink, floor and toilet were nasty in both of the unisex bathrooms. All while a employee sat outside the bathroom on their phone.

PG-5DHSTtm2eY7UqsH0ktg.text: Came during lunch. Place was pretty empty. We get seated right away and get water. Waitress took our order shortly after. Place is very nice and trendy. I ordered the truffle burger with sweet potatoes fries and truffle mayo. My husband BBQ Burger with onion rings. Waitress never comes back for us to order a coke. We end up finding the waitress from across us to place the order. Our waitress was busy making shakes. Burgers are really good! We order n oreo shake. It was amazing. Wish the service was a little better than it was especially since it was not busy.

Hmbrp1tjiqnVll4HwWIvxA.text: Our server Chris was AWESOME  I had the truffle burger and the quality of waygu was stellar. A few bites were incredibly salty, But this was still a delicious meal.  The milkshake I had was certainly diabetes in a cup, but it was an out of this world Experience, and that you should probably only drink once in your life, unless you are striving for morbid obesity and spiked blood sugar.  One of the most notable and enjoyable parts of the meal is the fantastic view you will have if you sit outside. The gondolas in Vegas are a landmark site, and provide some really fantastic people watching, if you're into that. You can see the reflection of the light on the water, and hear some gondoliers belting out tunes.   Check this place out for a unique dining experience

ESKDO3FQTxr_b-91ryNzhA.text: Great burgers and shakes that are worth a trip to The Strip. I've had this spot on my list for awhile and I'm glad I was finally able to give it a try.   On a Saturday afternoon my husband and I were seated right away. We were seated in a cool cave like booth right off of the bar. The vibe of the restaurant is fun and playful which added to the experience.   Our waitress was attentive and friendly. She asked if we wanted our shake after our burgers and I'm so glad that she did. The shake would have been a melted, unenjoyable mess if it had arrived with our burgers.   So many fun burgers and even some chicken sandwiches and salads on the menu. The Mexico City Burger was delicious. The actual burger had a great flavor and the medium preparation was perfect. The toppings and sauce accented the flavor with a perfect amount of each. My husband loved The Pizza Burger too. The Onion Rings were tasty, but they fell apart quickly making them hard to enjoy. Next time I'd go with French Fries because those were crispy and deliciously seasoned. Eat quickly because everything is messy. Once you pick the burger up and have it under control you won't want to set it down again.  Delicious burgers are only part of the fun. I've seen enough of the shakes on social media to know that my husband and I would be splitting one shake. Good thing we did since The Cake Shake was two full desserts. There was a full shake plus an entire piece of cake on top. Both were very good.   We'll definitely be back. This would be a fun spot to bring friends and family when they are in town.

2H68gPTuoZVVeceZdEL9Mw.text: I was really excited to go here and get a Crazy shake.  The shake was pretty good, but I was disappointed with the restaurant itself.  We came here specifically for the shake, so we came at an odd time so we'd be hungry.  It was like 2:00 in the afternoon, it wasn't very busy, so we got a table.  We sat down, and our waiter came and asked if we wanted any drinks.  The person I was with ordered a drink, but I said I didn't need one because I'd just be getting a shake.  He seemed pretty put off by that, but it's a $15 shake!!! That's almost the price of a burger or whatever else you'd get!  I really did not like that, and then he made me feel bad.  However, like 5 minutes after that, a couple sat down next to us, and they only ordered shakes, too.  That made me feel better about it.  He made me feel like it was weird when I only came here for a shake in the first place.  So, he brought us water and I ordered the Cookie N Cream Supreme Oreo shake.  The water was brought in a bottle for the table, and it was warm, which we thought was odd.  But oh well, I didn't say anything about it.  My shake came out a little while later, and I took several pictures of it, lol.  The shake is worth getting just for it's Instagram worthyness. :)  So, I start to eat/drink this shake.  I took the cookie ice cream sandwich off first.  That was actually not an "Oreo" ice cream sandwich, which I was surprised by since Oreo is in the name.  If you've ever had an Oreo ice cream sandwich, they're really good, and the cookie part is different from a regular ice cream sandwich.  This was just a round ice cream sandwich, so I just ate a bite of it and left the rest, so that was disappointing.  There was a lot of whipped cream on the top, which I like, so that was ok by me.  I got some of the Oreos off the side of the glass and ate it with my shake.  For the people that complain it's small, I couldn't finish it.  I ate most of the cookie part off the side, but I had like a quarter of the glass of shake left and I didn't eat the ice cream sandwich, so it was large enough in mind.  In terms of the restaurant, we were seated with a table right next to us, and I got up to go to the bathroom, and it was actually hard to get out without hitting the people sitting next to us.  That is a little too close for comfort for me.  The bathroom was also strange, and was a one person bathroom with a locking door.  There were two of them, but it still was small for the size of the restaurant.  We both waited in line to use the restroom in the short time we were there.  We were also seated right in front of neon pink lighted lips.  Ordinarily this wouldn't have bothered me, but I needed to take pictures of this epic shake I was about to have, and they all have a pink glow because of the sign behind us.  With a little editing I managed to get a perfect picture of my shake though, so don't worry. :)  Overall, I got my shake and posted it to Yelp and Instagram and all the other places, and that was what I wanted to do, so it served it's purpose for me.  But, with all the great desserts you can have in Vegas, I doubt I'd do it again.  I definitely wouldn't go out of my way for it, which I did this time.  If I did go back, I was torn between the Cookies and Cream and the Cookie shake.  I'd go for the Cookie one next time.  I think the cookie sandwich would have been better than the "Oreo" one.  I think the Cotton Candy one is the prettiest one, but I don't like strawberry shakes or cotton candy, so that one is out for me, lol.  Instagram wise though, I think that's the winner.

-sI-DV-BPVCrZtKy0f70lA.text: We decided to check this place out. Shortly after being seated we realized it was a mistake. We should have left, but figured we'd give the place a chance. Maybe the food would make it all better.  The place is really loud. They squeeze you in so tight you're right next to your fellow diners.  When the waiter took our neighboring diners order he had to squeeze between us so his ass was right in my face.  When we ordered our burgers I asked if I could have mine medium well. I was told they don't do medium well because it's too difficult to judge. WTF?? That's the first time I've ever heard that.  We had a milkshake and although some of them are decorative they were very bland.  The burgers were average burger. And average isn't a good thing for what you pay at this place.  Overall very unimpressed. As a lifelong resident of Vegas this is just another typical tourist trap.   If you've somehow been coerced into dining here. I'm sorry. There are so many other better places to check out in Vegas.

V9mvS9r58GXKfwA2H8f7iw.text: Burger was over cooked, waitstaff was inattentive, many of the key menus items were unavailable.

4qqbKaQ88_NO4nAePj7iLg.text: Our bartender was great, there were about 10 of us. I had the bison burger for the first time and it did not disappoint! a lot of flavor and great taste. The rest of the party enjoyed their burgers & wings. Next time I'll try one of their crazy shakes. Great customer service, great food, definitely a place to come back to.

ZKZlzdTxWkgLK28DBq6yGg.text: Burger and shake restaurant located on the casino level inside the Venetian.  We came here on a Friday night. We did not have a reservation and waited about 30 minutes. While we waited we ordered drinks at the bar. I tried the Smoke on the Water. It was a watermelon flavored drink and perfect for the hot Las Vegas night.  We were finally seated at an inside table. I was impressed with the unusual decor of the restaurant. We were also seated near the large milkshake station so I got to enjoy watching workers make the over the top milkshakes.  My only complaint was that the service was slow and our food took over an hour to get to us. I had one of the burgers and it was delicious. Not many restaurants can cook medium rare to perfection but Black Tap did.  I wish I would have had room for a decadent milkshake, but I will definitely be back to try one and sit outside when the weather is cooler.

eIEIxAumGCa63Nqw_ZeFvA.text: -I'm not a huge burger fan but this is an exception. I found this place through an IG ad because they are known by their amazing shakes!  PROS: -HUGE burgers & great shakes :) -Friendly & fast service -Very hip & modern restaurant. I adore the decor -OMG THE MUSIC, it was bomb. I was honestly jamming to their playlist (they were playing Notorious Big)  FOOD 5/5: -The old fashioned ($18): Prime burger, mushrooms, swiss cheese, & horseradish sauce. & I got this with sweet potato fries ($2 extra). This was delicious. All the burgers are HUGE! You can honestly share it with another person.  DESSERT 5/5: -Cakeshake ($17): This was AMAZING!  I LOVED EVERYTHING ABOUT IT. The slice of cake is on top of the shake, and the cake is delicious! There was 4 of us eating it, and we still couldn't finish it because our burgers was so filling.   TIPS: -Located in the Venetian; ask for outdoor seating because you get the view of the gondola rides & strip; IG worthy! -I went @ 10pm on a Friday night & it wasn't busy so that was nice :D

mTLh4RqSX_MAqGHRq-EIOQ.text: So here's what was happening. I was so excited to eat this ish. I was basically in tears when I was walking closer to this place. I was with a group of friends and we ordered SO much stuff. Here's what I definitely recommend: the truffle burger. It was so delicious I kinda wanted another one. We also got the chicken wings, but they were a little dry. I mean I still ate it cause it was still good. But now onto the main focus: the milkshakes. I got the birthday cake milkshake. My worries were that the cake would be dry, but I had no reason to worry. The cake was actually so moist. However, the frosting was a little too sweet for my taste. The milkshake itself was also a little sweet, but I realized these milkshakes are more for show, so I was still generally impressed. Aight hope this helped!

kwMnL7P8vCiQt1dYKL8Ifg.text: Just your average burger and shake spot?? NOPE! EVEN BETTER!!!  Black Tap is a unique family friendly restaurant located inside The Venetian Hotel and Casino. This restaurant showcases a retro feel combined with a creative spin to a traditional burger food menu that'll easily make any guest fall absolutely in love with this place. I'm not going to lie, I feel in love with Black Tap the minute I walked in the door and I cannot wait to come back!  The staff at this restaurant were absolutely wonderful in accommodating our group and making sure our food and drinks were served promptly. We had a few rounds of beers, some delicious appetizers (including the fried pickles & chips with guacamole which was the best guac I had ever tasted!) along with a delicious burger, and then topped it off with one of Black Taps infamous shakes-The Cookies and Cream Supreme!! Let me just tell you, this shake was absolutely massive!! My eyes lit up the minute I saw it! They truly know how to make a supremely delicious shake, one that is large enough to split with three to four guests (or if your up for the challenge, indulge in entirely on your own!)  Thank you to the wonderful staff at Black Tap who made us have a wonderful experience. Can't wait to come back again soon!!   To the business owner: I only have one request. Please bring back your Golden Knights themed shake!! I'm dying to try it!! Thank you!!

i7n_vN0JvGg2Pz3gWULUWw.text: We visited the Black Tap about midnight after the Janet Jackson concert, the line to be seated was fairly short, however, we opted for the bar seat that overlooks the hotel to people watch. Our waiter, Nigel, was amaze balls!  He gave us great recommendations and checked back often. My friend and I both ordered the Baja Grilled Chicken Sandwich, I opted for the onion rings. The sandwich was very good with a little kick to it. I had the Cakeshake for my milkshake and it did not disappoint. The cake on top was moist and the overflow of sprinkles were right up my alley. If you're in Vegas and not staying at the Venetian venture over like we did, the music is great (heard lots of classic r&b songs while we ate, so a plus for me).

qkO9PnVv0Yv_W44dTivikA.text: The burgers and shakes are absolutely yummy. I had the Texan and my boyfriend had the all American burger. I loved all of the decor. I for sure must visit.

90cAvk_vPI-snt4dv8I97g.text: I'd been wanting to try this place out and I'm so glad I did - the burgers were amazing! Huge, quality, flavorful burgers are served in several different styles and accompaniments. I had the Truffle Burger - it was rich and indulgent...it was almost ridiculous. These burgers are big and will definitely leave anyone satisfied. I have to say the Milkshakes were a disappointment - while they look crazy and incredible, it seems to be all show. I'm pretty sure they use vanilla soft serve and add different syrup flavors to get chocolate, strawberry, etc...they were very sweet - on top of that they put some additional things like cake and candy which add to the aesthetic of a crazy, Instagram-worthy shake, but they really lack in quality and flavor.  The vibe in the restaurant is lively and fun and really suits the Vegas atmosphere. The service was friendly and attentive. Since the portions are huge, I probably wouldn't take children here, but this place is perfect for teens and adults.  I'd definitely go back for those amazing burgers and skip the shakes.

11L3780DTcm305EzLca6tw.text: My coworkers and I were hungry after an event so we decided to have a late dinner here.  The place actually had a line at 9pm but we were able to get 6 seats at the end of the bar area.    I had the THE TRUFFLE BURGER - wagyu beef, smoked gouda (I cut this), baby arugula, truffle-yuzu vinaigrette, black truffle mayo.  My burger was so tasty.  Loved the truffle flavor and bitter arugula.  Nicely cooked meat - good flavor.  Fries were tasty too.  Crisp outside and soft inside.  My coworkers all loved their burgers too.    The bartender was great.  Friendly and helpful.  Came by often even though he was preparing drinks for the restaurant.  Refilled drinks regularly.  Overall a super meal.  Loved sitting at the bar.

A_LkRYtEfAZioloYQpqoLg.text: Updated Review: tldr 4.5 stars overall (disclaimer: may be due to adult beverages)  Burgers: 4 stars Fries: 5 stars Shakes: 4.5 stars Adult Beverage: 4.5 stars Service: 4 stars Price: can't really comment since it's Vegas where everything is expensive  I decided to gave this place another try because my friend Amy T was visiting Vegas, so just had to bring her here for their crazy shakes! We ordered the following: truffle burgers, Cookie Shake and Agave Picante ( tequila based cocktail shaker).   Burger: we both ordered the same truffle wagyu burger medium rare to see if there was any difference than last time. And this time around, it wasnt dry or well done at all! It was more like a medium well, but we both still enjoyed it and devoured the whole thing within minutes :)  Fries: were excellent as usual. I have to say it's def one of my favorite fries around! Maybe I will try their other burger add ons next time.   Shakes: we ordered the Cookie Shake this time, but I must say Cookies N Creme Supreme is definitely superior to this one taste wise. I'm biased because I Iove oreo flavored things. I didn't really enjoy the cookie ice cream sandwich on the Cookie shake, but the one on Cookies n Creme Supreme is yum. Regardless, all of them look so awesome that I had to make one my yelp profile pic haha... Also one on my dating profile as a great conversation starter - they always ask me where I got it from :P  Adult Beverages: they have great selection from craft beers to cocktails. We decided to share the Agave Picante (tequila, fresh strawberry, fresh jalapeno and lime) which is a shaker that is supposed to serve 4-6 people. Serving size wise, it was just enough for two people - it comes out to around 5-6 shot glasses worth of liquid. 5 if you receive a broken shaker like we did and end up spilling some on your table. However, we really enjoyed the taste and the slight kick to it.  Overall, we enjoyed our time here :), but still had room for more food. Next time, Brooklyn Blackout and Sweet n Salty shakes are on the list try!

It was still good and sugary but was a little bummed it wasn't all cotton candy. Food was good and the atmosphere was nice. My fiance and I sat in a cute little booth and had a awesome date night. I would come back because I want to try the Bam Bam shake!! Great customer service too!!

WNg-SyevTlH05bUtHpCUyw.text: Found this through an Instagram food blogger in NY because they are famous for their crazy, mouth watering milkshakes. I decided to celebrate my birthday here with the family. We came in around 12 noon and it's already packed. We were greeted as soon as we came in but server qouted to wait about 20 minutes to get us a table outdoors because everyone wants to eat outside with a perfect view of the Strip and the Gondola rides. Indoor sitting has plenty of tables and booths or you can also seat in the bar. Hip-hop/retro themed interior with great music but it was a bit loud inside. They have great selections of craft burgers and salads which comes with a side of fries. Extra $2 if you want to upgrade it with onion rings or sweet potato fries. Here's what we ordered: All American burger with fries, Californian Burger with Onion rings , and Texan Burger medium rare with fries (exactly what I ordered). Burgers were huge, savory and cooked in perfection. Onion rings were thick and crispy. Great service with fast, attentive and friendly servers (Thanks Carlos!) My mom wanted to order the Brooklyn Blackout (which me and my bf ordered on the first visit) but since it's my birthday we decided to get the Birthday Cake milkshake. Both shakes are delicious and a literal cake slice or a brownie on top of the shake but a diabetis in a cup! It's Pricey but you get what you payed for. Thank you BlackTap for an awesome birthday experience, we all left satisfied!  Check this place out, gonna be worth your trip in the strip. :D

w_smcQUWB6e8G4RxwZZaFQ.text: Burgers nice and big. Super flavorful. The sweet potato fries are way good, I like them better than the regular fries. SW7KY61CpV0HLFVmisGgRA.text: We came just for the spiked milkshakes. Late, about 30 minutes to close which I felt bad about because it was obvious the bar was getting ready to leave. They We're pretty nice about it but a little annoyed. I understand after working years as a server but I also think it's Vegas and this should be expected at a resort. They wouldn't only allow us to sit at the bar even though everyone else was sitting at tables with food. The seats for bar were so high, uncomfortable for us. The shakes were so tasty and unique, great birthday treat after dinner. I have the cake shake with an entire slice of fun-getting cake on top! My boyfriend has the candy bar sweet and salty shake and loved it too. Over the top but perfect for Vegas. They don't really advertise liquor you can add to it but it's $8 extra. The only one they could suggest was Baileys, basic and went perfectly but I was also thinking vanilla or sweet liquors could work too. They should advertise this with more options. Easy way to bring in more money on over priced alcohol in Vegas. We rushed eating/drinking our shakes since we felt a little rushed and the seating was uncomfortable. If we are ever back would love to try a burger or sit outside earlier. Nice concept and fun shakes.

DOpN_bka2dU3ICDcjSYbTg.text: I was at that place for late night dinner. The burger was amazing on dessert a shake was crazy delicious. The service was really good. The waiter are here for you. The ambiance is really nice and the decor on that place is beautiful. Highly recommended.
