nN74irmmCPfOwh0Dmm1QgQ.text: It's a rocking Aloha Friday (thank Karen for this name) and what better way to celebrate than with fabulous designer milk shakes.   This was the twins selection for my special birthday dinner from them. The thought process was a little by design too! Where else can one have,(no wrong word) experiences baby; the cuisine like Black Tap!  I know no other. The food is exceptional breathtaking. Yes, I used breath taking; since you will be gasping for air when you leave! The shakes are orgasmic (or one might come close)! Screams upon trying the shakes are recommended!  If one is seeking burgers that will make you think of other tingling thoughts and experiences than look now further than Black Tap! Plus the milk shakes are a wonderful bonus along side your butterflies they make at first glance!  We were seated immediately and as we made our way to the table wow the eye candy from the decor at each glance is amazingly grabbing! Then the tunes are so rocking. The music here will take your senses on a beautiful trip of those years when popular rap music was decent. Such-classics as Beasties, Bell Biv Devoe, and TLC! As you sit and eat your glorious glamorous milk shake you cannot stop dancing in your seat!!  The service here is impeccable and they are so friendly! The smile the waiter delivered was enough to put anyone in such a fantastic mood. Plus how can one not celebrate here when all that surrounds thee is funtastic treats that are so dazzling and beautiful; you probably will not want to destroy it! I'll have to shatter those thoughts since the "shakes" that I'm speaking of will melt if you do not eat them!  After the server explained the menu to us; this sadly being our first trip we ordered. We had the sweet and sour glamour milk shake! It is black cherry flavored. Being so hard to choose one; I used my favorite soda flavor to decide. It in its own right needs a freezer to be displayed for all to see; but we settled on eating it instead! The lovely candy decorating the cup is put on gently with frosting. You are able to drink and eat the candy display all at once. Slow and steady to the last drop this amazing masterpiece is!  The menu was constructed in a very simplistic manner! Burgers seem to be the main flavor! I enjoy a great burger once in awhile even though I lead a primarily vegetarian diet. I partake of meat to keep those bones nice and healthy. The menu here at the Tap has many choices to choose from if you just enjoy salad or something light. But the main reason most visit is for the glam shakes, cocktails, and burgers!   With so many amazing choices I was in a sweet and spicy mood when we visited, so I went with something bbq. One can never go wrong with the sweet and spice of a great bbq burger. The bbq burgers comes with huge onion rings and I ordered the bbq on the side. Of course I smothered the bbq sauce all over that burger. With the burger properly equipped to eat and the bbq sauce running down the side of the bun dripping on the plate now it's time to eat! That first bite will go down in the records as a score. The bacon on the burger was mesmerizing and is so thick. Before eating the burger I had to sample that bacon that was just beaconing to be taken! After regaining my breath from the first three bites speech returned and I finished that whole burger inch by inch until it was all gone.  The twins decided to share a burger and since they would rather have something that is common went with the regular cheeseburger for them. It comes with secret sauce which I believe is a thousand island dressing type of flavor. I of course had to sample their burger too. It was really good too. The bbq was the better of the two. Anything bbq is self explanatory!   While they offer dining outside on the patio this is a poor choice for LAs Vegas. The temperatures can reach over 105 degrees on a good day. No thanks, a side of heat exhaustion with my food kills my appetite. It also melts ice cream faster. We sat in the ac of the restaurant.   The lobby and dinning area is so unique and funtastic. It has beautiful vibrant colors splashed all over the walls. It has that early 1990s cool, mode attitude where all are welcome, but don't be hating! There are interesting seating choices all over the restaurant too. Your next trip to Vegas this place needs to be on the list of things to absolutely do!   Now that you know where to find burgers that will take your breath away and milk shakes that look like the beautiful members of Poison or Motley Crue now you know where to come! There is one downfall of this fantastic restaurant, ready prepare yourself; they do not take reservations; unless the party is at least 10 plus or more! The wait on a busy can be high I have been told! I did not experience a wait; but just wanted you to know.   What are you waiting for go get that glamorous dazzling milkshake and decide if you will dive into temptation like we did!

kWrvLSpfHKafhmRkff2imA.text: We went to this place on a busy Saturday evening. We were told we had to wait in line for about 30 minutes to get a table. But since this place was so hyped up we decided to go for it and wait. When we entered the restaurant and were shown to our seats, we realized that it was right by where they made the milkshakes. It was a bit annoying because it was kinda loud and there were so many people coming and going from there. When our server came we ordered right away because we knew that it was gonna take a while for our food to come and it did. We ordered two burgers, one old fashioned burger $18 and one truffle burger $22. we are huge lovers of truffle so thought why not splurge on a truffle burger. When the food arrived we tried it and it was awful... The meat was overcooked, the charr on the outside was so strong that we couldn't taste much else, and the worst part is that the truffle burger did not taste like truffle at all... and honestly, if I am paying $22 for a burger it better be amazing. the fries and the tartar sauce were the best part of the meal alongside the teriyaki broccoli. I don't know if their shakes are that amazing either so I will have to come back just for that...

4JmABbfx0cR_UHv0krTtvg.text: This review is solely based off the milkshake.   I absolutely loved the decor. It feels like a hipster type restaurant. The artwork in the back was awesome. It just gives us the nice vibe without the fancy. It's a pretty casual restaurant.   We came on an empty stomach cuz I figured milkshake might be too filling. I shared the milkshake I ordered with my boyfriend.   The shake we got was the cookies and cream supreme. The milkshake itself was BOMB! Now, I hate extremely sweet milkshakes. I can't stand it.   Their milkshake was the perfect amount of sweetness. The rim parts tho, I avoided all of that. I took a bite off it and it was just too sweet so don't do it if you're picky. But the milkshake was the right amount of sweetness. Even the ice cream sandwich that was stuck in the milkshake was not extremely sweet so they got it down!  I'd like to come back and try the food here too next time. The milkshake was a bit pricey at 15 bucks but I mean that portion!!! Our service was also really fast considering it's the week of CES.

gTD3A3KvrWVRJnRfOoQPaA.text: In all fairness, I didn't try the burgers here. My other half and I stopped in for an afternoon snack and decided to get an order of onion rings and split a minty milkshake (I can't recall the name). The milkshake was good, though quite frilly. I don't get the whole frills of milkshakes. It reminds me of being 5 and loading up your ice cream bowl with every topping imaginable, only to pick at it and not eat the actual ice cream. The actual ice cream was good, but I could do without the extras. The onion rings I was not impressed with at all. While the rings themselves were huge (which was cool), the breading was bland and kept falling off altogether and making it awkward to eat the actual rings.

bMhJu1g-Y_3OVYQmtC9T1g.text: After our experience, Samantha promptly emailed me back to resolve the matter. She happened to be visiting the Las Vegas location the next week and set up a convenient time for myself and my boyfriend to come in and meet her and have dinner on her.   We arrived at 7pm and we were sat once again outside in the patio area, by our request. (Side note: the family of ducks wandering around is beyond adorable!) Samantha assured we had an attentive server. I wish I caught his name because his service was phenomenal. He greeted us in a timely manner, took our order, and quickly delivered our drinks to the table.   We ordered the Crispy Chicken Sandwich once again and the Greg Norman burger with raw onion and bacon. We specified we would like the burger cooked medium. We chose fries as both of the sides.   Samantha came out shortly after to chat with us about our previous experience. She mentioned how that does not reflect the service they hope to provide their guests. She was super sweet and apologetic and even ordered a few appetizers for us to try out. She ordered the Teriyaki Broccoli and Fried Moz, which both were delicious. My boyfriend and myself particularly liked the Teriyaki Broccoli the most!   Our food eventually made it out and our burger was perfectly cooked medium! Hallelujah! The Greg Norman burger stole the show. I'm not even kidding.. the burger was so delicious and juicy. It was by far the best thing we ate that night. This is what I had been expecting my first time! This burger finally lived up to the hype and the price. Of course, the Crispy Chicken Sandwich tasted amazing. The Korean BBQ sauce that is served on the side is delicious.   I would like to mention our server was extremely attentive with filling our drinks and clearing plates during our whole meal. Silent service is important to me and he was AWESOME! Once we were finished with dinner, we went ahead and ordered the Cookie Shake. Samantha joined us to ask us how dinner was and to let us know she had ordered another surprise shake for us.   Both shakes made it out and they look incredible and Instagram-ready! The Cookie Shake was totally my jam as it was the perfect balance between vanilla and cookie and also wasn't too thick. The surprise shake was the Golden Knights Shake, in honor of the Las Vegas hockey team making it to the Stanley Cup; my boyfriend loved that shake!   Thank you SO much to Samantha for making this right. Our experience this night was exactly what we were hoping for the first time around. The service was incredible and the food was delicious. Overall, Samantha went above and beyond for us and I'm truly grateful for that.

Yfb_QzaezE9E3wZ_TxOiFA.text: We had seen the posters for this place and knew one day we would try it. But fate had it that after a poor experience elsewhere we'd end up here at Black Tap LV. This place has a dope atmosphere and we couldn't believe the flows of True Hip Hop - old school and new - that flowed through this place. But then - we saw one of these insane hand-crafted Milkshakes at a table next to us and we had to at least try one. My boyfriend had the "Bam-Bam" which was a fruity pebbles lover's dream!! And after some amazing burgers came my dulce de leche  dream! It had churros, Cinnamon Toast Crunch and a choco-Taco!! Add the Carmel sauce that topped it off and I was in heaven!! And if you're a pickle lover you have to try their in-house made pickles that aren't focused on your typical dill flavor - this pickle tastes more like cucumber and it was soo good! Speaking of good - can I just take a moment to recognize Luis?! Our service from him was amazing - i trusted him to order a shake for me and he didn't disappoint and his energy is addicting!! Also - the Manager on duty was attentive and gave us some background on the concepts and history of Black Tap (don't worry we asked for this info because we started looking into who Joe Isidori was because we couldn't get enough of the art and music and food he has created along with another famous chef) and we enjoyed his conversation and he made us feel so welcomed! I believe his name is Eric but I could be wrong - not because he isn't memorable it's because my memory is not the best. But I'll never forget how the staff made us feel because it's exactly part of the reason we will be back now that we live in Vegas and we will travel to experience Black Tap NY!! Thank you Black Tap LV for this experience - see you soon!!

8355GOLYzGsrOjLyk572FA.text: Awesome milkshakes and the food was awesome. Definitely would recommend to anyone looking for good food in Vegas.

i7fcjq2MpXHRrVv_YmAjlg.text: Excellent food, selection, and most importantly, the service. As a local, who works on the Strip, there's only a few places I'm willing to come visit on my night off, and Black Tap is one of them. Sat at the bar on Saturday night, Leo, did an amazing job from beginning to end. Let me sample a couple of stouts to make sure I was happy with my choice, and made some great recommendations. My wife had a crazy shake, I had the Fried Mozz, wings, and some beers. Can't wait to come back and grab a burger. Thanks again, Leo.

A_fgN_0JQgKxFrEN7V92JA.text: I sat directly at the bar and the service was decent, although I did specifically go there for the cotton candy shake and the bartender tried to talk me out of it. I appreciate his honest opinion, but I needed to try it. The food fell very short of expectations. My burger was nice and pinkish red on the inside, but extremely charred on the outside, which made it very dry and IMO inedible. I only had 3 bites and couldn't eat any more. The fried pickle chips were extremely salty. I believe it was in the batter because the sliced pickle I got on the side of the burger was not salty at all, in fact it hardly had any flavor. My cotton candy shake was awesome to look at. It was simply a strawberry shake with cotton candy and other bits of candy all over as decoration. The strawberry shake itself was good. I did enjoy the candy, but nothing creative on the flavor profile. Over all, I would probably never go back.

Undercooked and falling apart from the batter.  Fries came out cold as well.  They apologized but did nothing to accommodate and did not even take off the upgrade charges when we had to change the order.  Bummer because I went here because of the reviews.

jbNpcBeLlK2AJOH8bmoLgA.text: My experience at Black Tap was not good. We waited an 1 hour to be seated. After we were seated we gave our drink order which were a couple Strawberry Lemonades and a couple alcoholic beverages. NOT ONE of our drinks was good it worth keeping. They all tasted like water with a splash of whatever it was supposed to be. The lemonades were not sweet at all and the alcohol tasted like liquor and water. After the drinks the food was just mediocre, I had the pizza burger and I can honestly say I've had better burger patties at fast food places especially for a burger to be $15 I'd rather have gone and gotten a $5 burger. Also we went for a birthday and the birthday girl couldn't receive a milkshake because they ran out of supplies. Our meal was so disappointing we asked to speak to the manager and he was aggressive and not really concerned about our bad experience.

mC4HNjVf-35m4rdeNIQX2A.text: We went to try this place because we wanted to go somewhere  different. So me and my friends went and it was right on the strip .So we get there and they say there is a waiting time and then we we're seated immediately and then we decided to sit outside and since it was on the strip we had a great view. We all ordered something small so there was chili and a cesar salad and queso  dip with chips all of these was a really good price .If you like big milkshakes then this is the right place for you . I ordered the cookies and creme  milkshake and it came with a giant oreo ice cream cookie . It was so delicious. The queso dip was one of the best dips I have ever had they give you a lot of chips . I would definitely  go back and take more of my friends you won't be disappointed.

lmsqBbMCsJUS7TbX4ag4Ig.text: Service was horrible.   Lots of staff wondering around.   We had to call waiter over multiple times to ask him where our food was.   As I write this I've been waiting an hour for my food @4pm  with a half empty restaurant.    Avoid this place.

RGIcJy9byoV69D9uYp2Ovw.text: This place is the bomb.com! I'm not a big burger person, but I thought their burgers were pretty legit. 4 of the people in our party got the crazy shakes and they were definitely worth the money! 1600 calories per shake is a bit much for me though lol. NOT a fan of their lemonade....unless you just happen to like super watered down lemonade, then it's perfect. The decor and ambience was great...just wish that there was more guidance on how to get to the restaurant since it's within the Venetian....which is huge.....it's near/next to the poker room. Parking is free! :)

ayAzq5j3X8DCgbVDa9Vc1g.text: Ordered the Mexico City burger. It was delicious. Got the Cake Shake. It was super sweet but very good too. Thanks Cesar for being a great server.

tJfEEoes-du_txSbWN7ThA.text: We were really excite to try this place but we were very disappointed. The food is okay and the shakes are good but my bill was 93.00$ for two burgers, two shakes, and two iced teas that were so watered down it was like drinking water.  I think it is a great concept but  we won't be back for the price.

cSBA_OeElT1PhRK4uCr0gA.text: Had a very tasty turkey burger with sweet potato fries here! Nice spot for a faster meal, though this was definitely much nicer than a typical bar. Great Moscow mules, as well!

PpmB7hNDXwIl7Q92wQxiUQ.text: I had the sirloin burger and my wife had the truffle burger. We ordered take out but hung out at the bar while waiting. They had a nice selection of beer on tap and the setting was casual. The staff was friendly and polite. My wife said the truffle burger had a really good, unique taste to it. She ordered hers well done, as always she emphasized well done. When it came time to eat there was some pink in the burger. Not a huge deal but she would've preferred no pink. My burger was ordered medium and came out as such. It was very tender and flavorful. We both went with fries for a side and they were crispy and very tasty. We thought about going back later during our stay but opted for a new place.

rMjLngx6uFyG40BjK6CEYg.text: Amazing bar! Good Drinks ! Bri is the best bartender, she's going to give great suggestions

uSILELcXn3hmbiOvyzzL0A.text: Best burger I had in Vegas. I would recommend this place to everybody. The bar service was friendly and quick!

FzVROxy6Wz90TCQcfb2_XA.text: Texas Burger!!! Nice and juicy perfectly cooked. I sat outside beautiful view of the gondola rides and part of the strip. And my milkshake WOW. I wish I would have taken a picture of it.

M1Qa3d86OVOj1blJHkI4sg.text: My salad was a 5 Star (Waygu salad... yum!) but here's where this restaurant lost points with me:  You can only order your meats Medium OR Well Done. I like mine well done so it's okay but the rest of my family was disappointed.  The bathroom was very untidy and looked like it hadn't been serviced in awhile. Restaurant wasn't busy (we didn't have to wait for a table) so I feel like they should've been more on top of this.  The crazy shakes (a main draw for them) are served on a tiny little plate and everything kept falling off the sides and hitting the table... gross! EVERYONE around us was experiencing this... Just serve it on a bigger plate, duh! Our server: didn't bring refills on water or iced tea unless you asked for it... which we had to keep doing! You'd think she would've gotten a clue eventually to keep an eye out for that but no:( She didn't clear away the empty plates as we finished and generally she had no personality.  Not sure I'd go back for the $15 milkshake and mediocre service.

V5F6corJJO8j0_X7PN1wOQ.text: All I heard is about these crazy milkshakes that this place has so I figured I need to get down here to check it out. I had a buddy in town so I throttled would be the perfect time.  We went in it was around 10:30pm on a Friday place was busy but not overly crowded, so we sat at the bar. Waited for about 5 min before the bartender came over with her miserable look on her face to start us off with water and then walk away. Unfortunately it wasn't the way my buddy wanted to start his trip to Vegas so we left. I've talked to others with the same experience so obviously they need to change something. Let me know when it's fixed so we can try one of those amazing looking shakes.

m3sAbFz0VPPuKBNja4Dvxg.text: Isn't worth it overpriced and seem like poor quality all around. Shakes look amazing but it stops there.

sAvWC3Ck9bOPQPiHJq4YSg.text: Service with attitude.   The location on yelp isn't accurate and the restaurant just opened so it isn't on the directory yet. It's in the Venetian near Noodle Asia.  So we got to the restaurant and we stood in line to be seated. There were about 4 people ahead of us and no one behind us. The people in front of us got seated and the hostess came out and asked how many were in our party. We said four. The line to wait got longer. Maybe about 15 minutes later, the hostess walks past me and covers half her face with the menus and told me to not notice what she was about to do. She skips us and goes to the group behind us because they were her "friends". I overheard her say "where is the rest of the party? I can't seat you guys if you guys aren't here. I'll get in trouble." No you'll get in trouble for the poor customer service you've provided and catering to your friends first. So instead of tending to us and seating us since we were first in line she stood behind us and starts chatting away with her friends in line. The other hostess comes out and asked us if we had two in our party and we corrected her and said four and she argues with us and said "no you told me two." How about instead of arguing with your customers, you actually treat them decently and seat the people according to who got there first instead of catering to your friends. The attitude doesn't stop there. When we finally got seated (which there were many booths that could seat four available so I don't know why it took 25 minutes to stand in line and wait), we asked for more forks since there weren't any left in the jar. Instead of just saying "sure I'll get some more for you", the server smirks back "aren't there some next to you?" And we had to tell her there are no more. Our server walked by five times and never refilled our water until the end. When we were ready to order the shakes and tried to catch her attention she just walked past by.   Overall, our experience dining here was very unpleasant because of the staff. The food was quite pricey and very salty. We would not come back and would rather go to another place with better service. One that doesn't come with so much attitude.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cookie shake and Oreo and cookie supreme

KAT-y-cvPopKuBEO50Clng.text: OMG. Where do I start? I discovered this place on Instagram, where I saw their crazy milkshakes and I just had to try one. The Crazyshakes are $15 but are well worth it. I tried their Cake Batter Crazyshake, which was AWESOME. It's a cake batter milkshake with clumps of actual cake batter inside it, decorated with a thick rainbow sprinkle rim, an actual slice of cake on top, also topped with icing, whipped cream, and a cherry. The service was great as well. I only stopped in for dessert, but from what I saw on the other customers' tables, I am definitely coming back for food and another milkshake.

tBLa0GtwosBNFsVvpom8bA.text: I was anticipating my birthday to be another boring one until I was invited to dinner at Black Tap! My last experience prior to this dinner was superb and I went in with high expectations, which were fulfilled, once again, to the fullest. I recognized the manager John from last time, and he remembered us too. He got us the best booth in the house, and went out of his way to take care of us! Our food was brought out quickly and was excellently presented. We had a few orders of the onion rings (best in town), and I had the Baja Chicken Sandwich as my entree. I'm picky with my chicken sandwiches, but it was everything I could ever want. Tried one of their specialty cocktails that John suggested, and it was amazing as well! John singlehandedly made my birthday one worth remembering, and I couldn't be more thankful. Thank you Black Tap for being such a well organized and fun establishment. I can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mkJCaukKcLzAXelifVrElw.text: sort of torn about black tap! I think it has a lot of hype because of the shakes and cool environment but I'm not sure I would go again. The shake was yummy but I have had much better and the service was less than average. The burgers were decent as well! I think it's a place you need to experience but only once!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_WylXHfgvlR36RwPkCQTSQ.text: My wife & I wanted to give this little joint a walk-in and see what all the rave was about. As soon as you walk in, you are invested in a very artistic and colorful resturant with upbeat music, and chatter all around, whilst still being a fun and relaxing atmosphere. The selection of foods aren't very vast, especially if you're Vegetarian or Vegan. We began with ordering what is called "Fried Mozz" as an appetizer and it was presented with sprinkled cheese on top of the fried mozzarella, served with a delicious dipping, immensely savory and tasty! After, I had a Falafel Burger, along with fried and full sized onion rings, while my wife ordered the Black Bean Burger with French Fries. The food itself was delicious, filled with flavor but nothing spectacular. After we ordered what was anticipated, one of their over the top "Crazy-shakes". We got the "THE CAKE SHAKE / CAKE BATTER SHAKE" It was just as delicious as people say! Defenitly worth it, a bit more pricey than other places, but it's for the expirience & the expirience was a great one.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THE FALAFEL BURGER
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. THE CAKE SHAKE x CAKE BATTER SHAKE

aAPOKu9wy2MBYrMtp7kRqA.text: Went on a Friday night, there wasn't much of a wait at all. Maybe 10 minutes tops. Food was great. I had the fried pickles (which I loved) and the Californian which was also amazing. But the best part of course was the bam bam milkshake and the service. Will definitely back!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

av8DrRyGoIO352bwKriGxQ.text: The food was decent. Atmosphere is cool but it is noisy. The milkshakes are good but for the price could be better.

2C1ySoYjZ1roY-1oJE0b-A.text: Would highly recommend the cake shake milkshake it is amazing. I my self am from New Jersey I will be attending the one in New York City very soon.

nW2KXskVTsJCyordEsjX8Q.text: The food was good, our waiter was very friendly. But.... the service and wait time was VERY SLOW. We won't eat here again, also it was pretty expensive for a burger. We will choose another place next time.

DKZpUNHmXM1j3K9W7LTLgA.text: Got here when they had just opened and the place was full. Behind the sports book a little hard to find but worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great burger with sweet potato fries

lE-nHiSjo0JIcwqh6nv-lw.text: First and foremost, this review is solely based on the shakes, service and ambience. It was a bit of a journey to locate this place but it was worth the walk. Located across from the race and sports book, makes it an excellent choice when gathering with a group of friends and to catch the latest game. Upon entering this restaurant and bar, you'll notice the place has a semi-dark vibe but it was well lit with a cool neon light artwork in front that reminded me the 90s. It was kinda like if the show Living In Color collaborated with Yard House and Sweet Factory to create a hipster style restaurant.   Our main purpose of this visit was the popular crazy milkshakes. Friends from work, Instagram and various media outlets drawn us to try them out. We decided to sit at the bar and it was a perfect setting for people watching and photo opt. Raymond, our server was friendly and attentive. He kinda knew that we wanted their shakes and immediately took our order. Everything came out in a timely manner and when the actual shakes were place in front of us. A good amount of the patrons were staring at the shakes in amazement. They were all from Europe and gave us that...these Crazy Americans look, Lol.   My sisters and I got 3 different shakes and we should've got only 1 or 2, but we got excited and greedy and went with 3 different shakes. Ended up with the Bam Bam Shake, Cookie Shake and Cake Shake. All three were delicious! The Bam Bam Shake is a fruity pebbles shake with a pop tart and laffy taffy candy. This instantly reminded us of our childhood while watching Saturday morning cartoons. It was sweet but balanced in flavor. Cake shake had a good consistent flavor with the actual cake piece on top complimented the whole experience. Cookie shake was really good, especially the ice cream cookie. The actual cookie was soft and chewy and paired well with the ice cream. We all agreed that actual ice cream used was creamy and flavorful. If I wanted to have a cheat day, this place would be on my top 5 based on the shakes. I will have to come back and try their food but this review was based on the shakes, service and ambience.  2018 Yelp Review #9

SMySD5KtcSft_PwOTkTbeg.text: Worth every penny! The burger and milkshake were delicious. It definitely lived up to the hype.

OugTY40AdEsaN4gARVRz7A.text: This place is trash. Idk what the hype is for if they can't even keep their store open during proper business hours. I came at 11pm to a sign that read "systems down cash only." So I go all the way to the casino next door to use the atm (so I wouldn't be charged $10 to use Venetian's). JUST TO COME BACK 10 MINS LATER TO A NEW SIGN "we're now closed"   IT WAS 11:20!!!! Like WUT. I even asked the girl to make sure and she says "yeah we're closed..."   Never coming here again. I'll be sure to let my followers on IG know as well

FMBXbl-MPqp2qPLRTMrPaQ.text: The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is bacause of 3 things 1) too much arugala 2) aside from the fancy desserts on the shake they are otherwise bland and 3) salty pickle... other than that WOW. I highly reccomend trying one of their shakes just for the experience. I got Brooklyn blackout and my husband got the cake batter. For our food I got the Greg norman burger, very delicious! Our waiter was super friendly and outgoing. Def coming back again

udVrTt85sdyDaeXVb8MPoQ.text: This is my third time to black tap, because the service from John A is one of a kind. He treated us with the BEST service in town, and made our dining experience truly amazing and enjoyable. His quality service is one to note, he defiantly knows what he is doing. He is so personal with us, and we come back every time just for his immaculate service.   The atmosphere and food are amazing too! Food is hot and fresh, and the milkshakes are picture perfect as well.   We will keep returning just for our quality service from John A.  THANK YOU!

Mnr17ZMKRWW9XnSstoX4gw.text: Stopped in here on our way through last night and this place was great. Food was delicious and the shake, while ridiculous in size, was also very tasty! My wife said the Cobb salad was the best she ever had. Would definitely return!!

TYCLH7Ci9xX2pkWLJVP8TA.text: Great service. The milkshakes are amazing! Oh my goodness gracious. I don't know how one person can finish one by themselves. I know they have this restaurant in NY and it's very popular. The atmosphere was very causal. Laid back but nice. Good for families. Didn't have a burger because I was saving room for the shake but everyone else in my party were happy:)

YnnbTfJN8M6wzRQMDfpqKQ.text: Great shakes. Underwhelming food for the price. Cute ambiance for old school heads but you will spend $$$$$

4-wnSepsKvPD59eOLA0Ayw.text: I came here and just ordered a milkshake. It was the birthday cake one, there was literally a piece of cake on top the shake which was super cool! But very hard to eat without an extra plate.   I thought the food was really over priced based on what my friends ordered, they said they're burgers were good but not amazing. I also thought the milkshake was overpriced too but I get it, they're extravagant and known for that I think.   And thennnnn our server barely tended to us and also didn't give us a palazzo employee discount when we told her we worked in the hotel. It was extremely hard to get a hold of her when we needed to. Fyi- there's added gratuity for groups of 6 or larger.   Basically, I most likely won't go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JT86coiA6vDCT0ORrprMDw.text: Black Tap was a good tourist restaurant.  I liked the look of the venue, pictures, and art work in this location. The ice cream milkshakes was what brought me and my family here. It was a nice place to eat. The music was incredible. It was like I had my own iPhone plugged up to the speakers. Next time I go I want to buy one of the shirts and try a different milkshake. Unfortunately I would only go back for the milkshakes. In my opinion the size of their burgers was just not worth it in the price.  I feel as if I'm going to pay $15-$20 for a burger and fries I want the patty on the buns to be bigger. But overall I would rate Black Tap 4 out of 5 stars. The music and milkshakes were great

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cL7DHnqLR2W1CstY1KGD4A.text: Very busy, very crowded, very loud. You absolutely need a reservation. They have a lot of beers on tap, specialty alcoholic drinks, and insane milkshakes- which is what they're most known for. The menu is burgers and bar food. They have vegan options- I had a couple choices for dinner which was a surprise. No vegan desserts though- you'd think if they had vegan burgers on the menu they'd have at least one vegan milkshake.

u6zbGh8cOP1P3z82KaFK1A.text: It's hard to review things in Vegas when they are, across the board, a total disaster from a value perspective.  Black Tap's damage?  Three beers, two cocktails, and two appetizers - $90.  (Tax and tip included.)  $9 for a beer at a place that isn't "fancy".  Er, ok.    The appetizers were really good.  Our appetizers (fried sprouts and fried mozzarella cheese) were good enough to make me think that they are serving a good product here.  The cocktails were great, and the service was really great.  The bartender was very personable and made some good suggestions.  If you'd charged me $60, then this is a five star review.  But, $9 beers and $15 cocktails require that you deliver something superlative, and Black Tap can't do that.

MyjohZsmrPVCYyOPhMCRWw.text: Makena was our server and he was amazing! Couldn't have asked for a better dining experience. He was patient and attentive and took all our annoying photos with a smile. Will be back next time I visit! Thank you Makena! :-)

BbqZ9obdcvMKHpZHpRWXxA.text: Burgers were amazing. I've been craving it since i tried it. The service is good but nothing exceptional. I love the mood and decor inside. Wish the music was a little lower, it was kind of hard to talk over it. Didnt get to try the shakes but will definitely come back.

Cl30kXIqRXaap8ZiqpYjVw.text: Absolutely amazing!! I will definitely be back to try all of the milk shake flavors!! You get so much more than expected.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QbcWtcJagfmpy8Rl5ZbqxA.text: I loved the milkshake. The burger was delightful. This is a very good restaurant. I love how nice the servers were. The jars were so cute. Keep up the good work.

MkjX7sPjFgYehGVX0VcISA.text: Food was good! Little pricey...but....it's on the strip. What do you expect? BBQ burger and fries was good. Their crazy shakes are fun! Ambiance is cool, service was good. If you go on the earlier side of the evening you won't experience a wait to be seated. Fun experience!

YkWoFZFVB-fpPvQeB9biiQ.text: From the moment you walk in to Black Tap till you walk out, you and your guests are treated like royalty. From the appetizers, snacks, burgers and milkshakes you're in for an amazing "Instagram worthy" food experience. Some of my favorites were the Chicken Wings, Crispy Brussel Sprouts, and The Greg Norman Burger, and of course the Oreo Cookie Shake! What a great venue for an event or even a night out on the town. Yes they also serve lunch too, I recommend sitting on the patio.

Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pizza burger &amp; Truffle Burger

75AfM73DFg-mtTRQLzX4GQ.text: We walked in around 1230pm on a Monday and luckily there was no wait for a party of three and even had some patio seating open. All the staff was pretty friendly and the atmosphere of the spot was clean and fun. Started off with some ice water that is in the bottle that they leave on the table for you to refill yourself if they can't make it back when you're low. Ordered from fried mozzarella and changed the sauce to marinara. Also got the Cookie Shake which is like a hard childcare chip cookie and a vanilla shake and tons of cream and cookie crumbs. The shakes there are so outrageous they make the entire meal. They need to serve the shakes on a large plate rather than on a tiny saucer since it drips and spills all over. We then ordered the Pizza burger $17, The California burger $17 and the Greg Norman burger with wagyu beef and blue cheese $20. All burgers come with their regular fries but you can upgrade to sweet potato or onion rings for $2 more. One thing I didn't like is I ordered ranch on the side for my fries and they don't tell you his but they charge you $1 each for that! I think anytime there is an up charge they should let you know. Food came out quickly and was tasty. It's a gourmet speciality burger and shake shop on the strip and if you're lucky enough to sit outside you get to watch the gondolas pass. They play pretty good mix of music outside too. All in all I enjoyed my experience and the bill came to $70 something but we had a 20% discount for casino employee.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. View from our shady table on the patio
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $17 California turkey burger
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cookie shake $15

lbRfBGdrnz4Pn8qaHU4X2Q.text: 1 star because the food was decent. Unfortunately the service spoiled any good taste we had left in our mouth.  Creative burgers at comparative prices for Vegas stip. Outdoor patio was inviting/cute (we we're a group of 7 girls) ducks from the nearby "canal" were enjoying any crumbs.  Our server had NO personality. Never said his name and unfortunately none of us have our receipts. Upon check out he informed us that he could split the check 3 ways... No big deal, we figured it out. But unfortunately he could not understand what went on what card. Even when we Wrote out the items on said receipts. The manager was finally involved and not sure why, he was no assistance.  On our way out.. I verbalized to said manager,  that our experience was not enjoyable. The manager then stated that the server found out some personal news and it was "messing with him"  We all have lives outside of work, we understand it's had to compartmentalize certain things. If that item is affecting your performance, you should go home or take a break. Not make our dinner a headache in a town of pure entertainment.  TL:DR, food fine, bad service experience

j_k5eJgGiuWaOK02UnQalQ.text: Hello! I went with my friend Nickole H. And it was awesome!! The cotton candy shake was to die for!! The people where super kind! Definitely recommend!

wPXp9M6mDQVkyRXnY2CvxQ.text: Came here yesterday around 5pm with a party of 6 and we were seated right away. We heard that this place just opened and no way were we going to try to go here on a weekend. I was happily surprised there was no wait. NOTE! They will not seat you unless your full party is there.  That atmosphere is great and the wait staff is friendly. I really loved  and the music they played. I saw a DJ booth, so I'm assuming they have a live DJ on the weekends/nights. Regardless of no live DJ the music was amazing, it was old school hip hop and pop.   Now to the food, I ordered the Crispy Brussel sprouts and Truffle burger with egg. Don't like Brussel sprouts? Order these and you will,  they are delicious, believe me you will thank me. I liked the Brussel sprouts more than I liked my milkshake and my milkshake was DELICIOUS. I ordered the Sour Power shake. And, sour power it was. First my shake was sour, then it was sweet. Or wait, I think that was just the sour patch kids that were on the side o my glass. Along with sour patch kids, I also enjoyed a lollipop and a pixy stick with my shake. Presentation was amazing, and black cherry ice cream melted into a perfectly thick milkshake. My burger was good, but is it really hard to ruin a burger? Nope.   5 stars, no wait, good food and great music! If this wasn't on the strip I would come here often.

photos.caption: Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Love cotton candy than you cant go wrong with this shake.
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sour Power, if you like sour candy, ordering this is a must!
Photo of Black Tap - Las Vegas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crazy shakes from left to right:The Cookie shake, Sour Power, The Cake Shake &amp; Cotton Candy.

HQtzTnKKAG2mBA2uY-wcBQ.text: After walking in circles literally 4 times around the Venetian, we found it. Yay! Lol I wanted to try Black Tap based on the milkshakes that I had been seeing advertised. Great marketing by the way because after seeing them I was sold.  We went at a time where it wasn't too crowded. It was two of us and we were seated within 2 minutes. Our waiter was friendly and wasn't too far off if we needed anything. The decor nice and hip. Loved the paintings on the wall. The music was on point. Great selection of songs.  Our food was great and my daughter said hers was amazing. Good portions that got us full but yet we still wanted one of those yummy looking shakes. I had the cake shake & my little one had the oreo cookie shake. It was as cute & yummy as I thought. I was embarrassed because I ate ALL of mine and even started eating off the icing & sprinkles from around the rim lol   My only issue would be the smell of cigarette smoke while eating. There was a patio area so not sure if it was coming from out there or from the casino. Not pleasant when trying to eat.   Lastly, would be nice to see shrimp or fish on the menu...  *Side note: While stuffed, we were discussing what we will order next time we visit lol. We definitely enjoyed ourselves and have already referred friends & fam.

MIhlwxiTruz8ciF5xuQU1Q.text: The Burger Salad was amazing and could have fed two people.  Other family members had burgers and the fries were not cooked enough. The shakes looked amazing but we were too full to have one.  I thought the price for ice tea($5) was ridiculous and this is why I took a star off.  Don't gouge people who aren't drinking alcohol.

PkkCp_YJ486ptdd2Q_3tJw.text: I read plenty of reviews on Black Tap and decided to go and check it out and I was not disappointed!!! The atmosphere is fantastic with a cool retro 80's vibe but the food is to die for!!! We ordered the Old Fashion burger and let me tell you there isn't anything old Fashion about it!!! The burger was moist and juicy with caramelized onions and mushrooms with just the right amount of Swiss cheese to put me on cloud 9! Then for dessert what more can I say then milkshake, milkshake, milkshakes!!! Pick one, pick two, pick them all and they are all unbelievable!!! We ordered the cotton candy milkshake and it was divine while others around us raved about the cookies and cream, the chocolate peanut butter and the birthday cake!!! Don't delay and make your way to Black Tap you will not be disappointed!!!

cenqev85tT3GuM34rgxV_g.text: LOVE LOVE LOVE. I got the vegan burger and it was super tasty and the portions were very generous. Then there are the crazy shakes. BEST SHAKE I'VE EVER HAD. The cake shake surpassed all of my expectations. I can't wait until my next trip here :)

5Awc7uvJYRCkP9MIf4CXzg.text: We had such a great time. My daughter turns 14 today and she wanted to go with our family to eat and have some shakes last night. The service was truly amazing. Food was on point! Views were killer. We have a knew spot to go back to often! Gotta go Ya'll.

M4aAO-5APJeHLGNV0Fl9lg.text: This was my first time visiting Black Tap and we brought guest with us.  I was so bummed b/c service was not good. Our food took over an hour and the server was not attentive. I ordered the vegan burger it came out chilled. To say the least I was not happy, I sent the burger back and it took another 15-20min to come back out. When my food came out all of our guest were finished eating.   It was not a good experience for me and my guest. I will NOT be back or recommending this place. Hope you all have a better experience! Good luck!

0jSpI8L1yb4mZshbZ6YUGQ.text: I don't usually write bad reviews, but I was so disappointed in Black Tap. I ordered a simple cheeseburger medium rare. My burger came as a ball that was cooked medium well, not what I asked for. The burger was more like a meatloaf and had no flavor. I added salt, pepper and condiments to make it taste better. I still couldn't bring myself to eat more than half. My husband had the Wagyu burger and enjoyed it but said it was average. Wagyu burger was $7 more than my burger.  On a positive note, the view for outside seating was nice. There are lots of burger places on the strip. Try something else.

1OIfmPCgF98uSUe_8zHJUw.text: Insanely busy last night but service was still on point. Food came out fast and the recommendations from the server were so delicious. Definitely worth the price! Thought the milkshakes would be mediocre as I assumed it was just made for presentation but the shakes were awesome. Can't get enough of the cotton candy. Definitely hit the spot.

33vwSHrJLAK86284JmrYqA.text: As a local I'd have to agree with everyone else asking what the hype is about this place . The burgers were mediocre at best (if I had to choose the truffle burger was my fav) and the shakes although very appealing to the eye are just a bunch of pre-made ingredients stacked and stuck to large glassware . The Brooklyn Chocolate shake tasted like Hershey's syrup simply mixed with ice cream & they use canned whip cream . For $15 a pop y'all can't make some fresh whipped cream and chocolate ganache ?! This is our second time here & probably won't be back .

TzJstSRzbo9605TEOz5LMA.text: We were invited here for a friends birthday and what a surprise it was to us!  I cannot have gluten and that makes it hard to eat at any burger place.......except here!! We were thrilled to see gluten free buns available.  The burgers were divine and of course we had to try a shake.  DeathByChocolate lived up to its name! Hahaha. Drinks, service, cleanlines all outstanding.
